Her store is located in her own home.  She is requesting a loan to give her the financial means to stock her business as Francisca does not have the necessary money to do this and she really needs to both for herself and her children since it is her business which enables them to cover their family expenses.  Francisca would like to be able to stock her store with products such as detergent, canned food, bread, candies, drinks and other products which are necessary in a home and are most requested in a store.  Francisca hopes to improve her profits and thereby be able to lead a more stable life.

loans.use: To buy perishables

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy materials for her business

loans.name: Layla

texts.en:
Layla is a 43-year-old mother of six children. Layla has a cosmetics salon which she runs from her home.

Layla needs this loan to buy cosmetic supplies such as creams, lotions, wax, and manicure and pedicure products. Layla is building up a steady clientele who are appreciative of her professionalism and high quality of work.

Layla wants to make sure her eldest daughter studies at university and gains her degree and eventually she wants all of her children to receive a higher education. In her business she wants to branch out to gift products and specialty items for holidays and anniversaries. One day she wants to develop her business into a specialty boutique salon serving women of the entire area.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic supplies

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel Ángeles H. tiene 23 años y estudio hasta el segundo año de secundaria y la carrera de cultura de belleza, es casada con el señor Giovanni desde hace 8 años, ellos tienen dos niños llamados Miguel de 8 años y Jasón de 6 años. Ella se dedica a vender zapatos y ropa por catalogo, también comenta que vende un poco de bisutería que ella  misma diseña, sus clientes la conocen como una mujer muy trabajadora ya que le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, y una buena vendedora ya que les da buenos precios. Doña Isabel solicito su préstamo para aumentar el negocio de los zapatos y ropa de diferentes colores y tallas para cuando le pidan ya tener en existencia en su casa y ya no mandarlos pedir, también para comprar pedrería y plata para diseñar su joyería, con sus ganancias en un futuro ella quiere tener un local estable en su casa para estar al pendiente de la educación y cuidado de sus niños.
texts.en:
Isabel Ángeles H. is 23 years old. She completed her second year of high school and studied cosmetology. She has been married to Giovanni for 8 years and they have two sons named Miguel who is eight years old and Jasón who is six. 

She sells shoes and clothing by catalog. She also sells some jewelry that she designs herself. Her clients know her as a very hard working woman because she helps her husband with the household expenses. Also because she is a good saleswoman and gives them good prices. 

Mrs. Isabel requests the loan to increase her shoe business and to buy clothing in different sizes and colors so that she will have them in stock in her home without having to order them. She also wants to buy stones and silver to design her jewelry. With her future earnings she wants to have a stable place to run her business from home so that she can attend to her children and their education.

loans.use: To invest in catalog shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia B. is from the village of Taboc Sur, Oroquieta City. She is 51 years old. Lucresia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lucresia works in a fishing business, harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Lucresia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lucresia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lucresia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. Lucresia is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Lucresia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to raise.

loans.name: Cleymer Antonio

texts.es:
El señor, Cleymer Antonio A. C. trabaja como Fontanero de sistema de agua potable en una empresa aguadora desde 3 años. Vive en la ciudad Carazo comunidad de San Marcos, en el barrio San Pedro de los Molinas

Es casado de 30 años de edad, tiene 3 personas a su cargo dos de ellas son menores de edad.

Agradece a CEPRODEL, ya que le permite con este préstamo comprar materiales de construcción que tanto lo necesita para invertir en la mejora de su casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Cleymer Antonio A. C. has worked as a potable water system plumber at the water company for three years.  He lives in the city of Carazo in San Marcos community, in the residential area known as San Pedro de los Molinas.

He is 30 years old, married and has three dependents, two of which are school-aged.

He is grateful to CEPRODEL for the loan he plans to use to buy construction materials for home improvement.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: 32-year-old T. Justus is a retail businessman who operates from Kyakature-Kyenjojo. His retail business is now 5 years old and he says he began this business with savings from a now defunct farming business. Justus, who is happily married with 2 children, says this business generates for him 120,000 shillings per week.  With this loan, Justus says he is going to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more retail commodities to resell

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Rachael is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a firewood selling business for the past three years, selling to her local residents. Rachael faces a major challenge with the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to establish a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of firewood to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of firewood for sale.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to financially support her husband, who wants to improve his milk-selling business by purchasing another buffalo.  

Sughran lives in a 3 room brick house with her family in a small city called Kot Radha Kishen, which is located in Punjab, Pakistan, and famous for its dairy industry. She moved here with her family 15 years ago.

She is the mother of three sons and three daughters. All of them are illiterate because Sughran is unable to provide them with an education due to the family's poor financial situation. 

She is 42 years old and married to M. M.. M. has been in this business for more than six years and is well-known among his clients. He earns good profits from his business. He gets up early in the morning and milks his buffalo to sell the milk to his nearby clients. 

Sughran is hopeful that her husband will be able to make positive changes to his business by investing the loan in his business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk-selling business

loans.name: Magret

texts.en: Magret is currently in a business of selling small items such as beans. She is 40 years old, married to a businessman and has 4 children (2 of whom go to school). Magret borrowed a loan to stock more small items such as beans for sale. She hopes to expand with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: stock more small items such as beans for sale

loans.name: Ruth Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora. Ruth Gonzáles es socia del banco comunal en Sueños y vive en la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad es de clima frió, tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica, su gente se dedica al comercio y es una ciudad que tiene muchos lugares para visitar.

Doña Ruth tiene 40 años, está divorciada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 18 y 4 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en la universidad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en la casa de sus padres que es propia y comparten los gastos del hogar.

La Señora. Ruth tiene con un local en donde se dedica a lavar la ropa en seco, esta actividad la realiza hace 4 años, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 años y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de detergentes, suavizantes de ropa y más productos para su lavandería.

Su sueño es construirse una casita.
texts.en:
Ruth Gonzáles is a member of the 'Sueños' (Dreams) community bank and lives in the city of Azogues.  This is a cold climate city of great architectural beauty.  Its people work in commerce and it is a city that has a lot of places to vist.

Ruth is 40 years old.  She is divorced and has two children aged 18 and 4.  Her eldest daughter is studying at University.  Ruth doesn't own her own home but lives in her parents' home (which they own).  She shares the household expenses.

Ruth has premises where she dry cleans clothes.  She has been in this business for 4 years.  She works from Monday to Saturday, from 8.00am to 6.00pm.

Ruth has been a member of her community bank for 3 years and she will use her loan to buy detergents, fabric softeners and other products for her laundry service.

Ruth's dream is to build a small house of her own.

loans.use: to buy detergents, fabric softener and other products for her laundry service

loans.name: Baax Yaye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité BAAX YAYE est créé le 27 août 2009. Il est composer de 08 femmes issues du même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce en général/ Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de MONTAGNE NORD3.

Fatou M. (debout à l'extrême droite de la photo avec de cheveux en friche) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 28 ans. Elle est célibataire sans enfant.

Elle fait un petit commerce de vêtements. Et parallèlement elle fais de la coiffure. Elle pratique cette activité depuis environ 05 ans.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de s'approvisionner en marchandise ci-dessus énumérée et d'acheter aussi des produits pour la coiffure. 

Objectif est de soutenir sa maman dans la prise en charge de la famille tout en subsistant à ses besoins personnels
texts.en: The solidarity group Baax Yaye was created on August 27, 2009.  It is made up of 8 women from the same neighborhood.  Their primary business is, in general, small shops.  The group is a member of the Montagne Nord 3 Banc Villageois.  Fatou M. (standing at the far right of the photo with the wild hair) is the leader of the group.  She is 28 years old.  She is single with no children.  She runs a small clothing shop.  At the same time, she styles hair.  She has run this business for 5 years.  Her new loan will allow her to stock up on the merchandise enumerated above and to also buy hairstyling products.  Her objective is support her mother in taking care of the family, while still supporting her personal needs.

loans.use: to purchase clothes intended for sale

loans.name: Edwin And Maria

texts.en:
Many years ago, Edwin worked at a large bank where his sole job was to count cash. “I didn’t feel like I was being treated with respect,” he recalled. “One day I realized the job was not for me, and I could do something else. I could be my own boss.” 
 
Not long after that, Edwin and his wife, Maria, started a family-owned janitorial and handyman repair business. Thirty years later, the business is still going strong and now employs two additional workers to help manage a wide variety of jobs that range from installing tile in houses to gardening to cleaning office buildings.
 
The couple’s favorite part of running a small business is the flexibility it affords them. They work hard, but have the freedom to create their own schedule and spend more time with family. “As my own boss there’s nobody telling me what to do – but that also comes with responsibility. You have to be disciplined. You can’t afford complaints from clients,” said Edwin.
 
Despite 30 years of experience and their strong work ethic, the recession has presented a significant challenge to the business: “When the economy is bad, things are tough, because people don’t have extra money to spend on fixing their houses.” 
 
In order to secure more work, Edwin and Maria needed capital, but many of the places they initially looked charged interest rates pushing 90%. Fortunately, their search also led them to Opportunity Fund, a local micro-lender, where they were approved for a $750 micro-loan (with an interest rate of 8%). With their loan, Edwin and Maria will be able to take on an extra account and build their credit for larger business loans in the future.

loans.use: to take on an extra janitorial account and build their credit history.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles, a 27-year-old married father of four children, has been selling curios along Kijabe Street in Nairobi for five years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES 21,000.  This will be his first loan from KADET LTD with which he intends to buy more curios such as beads, flower pots, etc. for resale.  Charles hopes to generate another business from the anticipated profits and join a group of international curio exporters in the future.

loans.use: to buy more curios.

loans.name: Cielo I Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "CIELO I", está integrado por 9 clientas, se encuentran ubicados en el Estado de México. en este grupo se encuentra la señora Yolanda de 36 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos: 2 hombres y 2 mujeres, nos platica que estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria, actualmente se desempeña como diseñadora de ropa, oficio que adquirió por cuenta propia, tiene un pequeño taller de costura que inició hace aproximadamente 10 años, decidió poner su negocio de costura para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Solicita el prestamo para la compra de materia prima como son: telas, hilos, costuras, etc. Las ganancias que obtenga lo utilizará para la  construcción de su casa y renovar el mobiliario y equipo de su taller, además de cubrir los gastos escolares de sus 4 hijos.
texts.en: This group is called "CIELO I" [Heaven I]. It is made up of 9 clients. They are located in the state of México.  Yolanda is in this group. She is 36 years old and has 4 children, 2 boys and 2 girls.  She tells us that she went to school until the third year of secondary school. At this time, she works as a clothes designer. She learned this trade on her own and has a small sewing workshop that she started approximately 10 years ago. She decided to open her sewing business to help her husband with the household expenses. She is asking for the loan to buy materials such as: fabric, thread, etc.She will use the earnings she makes to build her house and renovate the furniture equipment in her workshop, in addition to covering the school expenses of her 4 children.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for her sewing business

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria tiene 58 años D. edad, ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos, vive con su familia en una comunidad granD. en la zona rural D. cayalti, en el departamento D. Lambayeque.

Maria se dedica la venta D. golosinas y gaseosas en el exterior D. un  colegio desD. hace más D. 3 años en los cuales a conseguido clientela fija para sus negocioy en los que adquirido experiencia en el negocio 

Maria está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1000 nuevos soles para que pueda invertir en su negocio, comprando más mercadería para su negocio D. esta manera ella pueda ampliar y hacer  crecer su negocio, contando con más productos para ofrecer al publico.

Maria es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad D. vida. Las personas que la conocen le consideran una persona  amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás
texts.en:
Maria tiene 58 años D. edad, ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos, vive con su familia en una comunidad granD. en la zona rural D. cayalti, en el departamento D. Lambayeque.

Maria se dedica la venta D. golosinas y gaseosas en el exterior D. un  colegio desD. hace más D. 3 años en los cuales a conseguido clientela fija para sus negocioy en los que adquirido experiencia en el negocio 

Maria está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1000 nuevos soles para que pueda invertir en su negocio, comprando más mercadería para su negocio D. esta manera ella pueda ampliar y hacer  crecer su negocio, contando con más productos para ofrecer al publico.

Maria es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad D. vida. Las personas que la conocen le consideran una persona  amable y siempre dispuesta a ayudar a los demás

loans.use: Compra de mercadería para ampliar sus negocio.

loans.name: Melina

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Melina works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippinesand also earns additional income from selling fruit.  Melina is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to  buy fish, fruit and vegetables to sell in her stall.

Melina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish, fruit and vegetables to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Siempre Vivas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SIEMPRE VIVAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Angelica. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: metalmecánica, costura, confección de guantes de arquero, confección de deportivos, venta de comida, joyería, pasanaco.

La señora Angelica,  indica que esta hace quince años que trabaja con Pro Mujer, pero que se retiro hace cinco años; ahora volvió a trabajar con la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de implementos de arquero, que viene trabajando hace 16 años, negocio que aprendió de su familia.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de tela e hilos), que compraran por mayor de la calle Isac Tamayo y posterior a la elaboración del producto lo venderá en los departamentos de Santa Cruz y Cochabamba. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio.
texts.en:
The “Siempre Vivas” (Always Living) communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Center.  It has nine members led by a governing board headed by Angélica.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses like: metal shop, sewing, manufacturing gloves for archers, sportswear manufacturing, food sales, jewelry, ‘pasanaku’ (a traditional Bolivian method of group money saving).

Angélica indicates that she’s been working with Pro Mujer for fifteen years but dropped out five years ago.  Now, invited to rejoin by one of the promoters, she decided to work with the institution again.  Currently, she has a business sewing implements for archery.  She learned this business from her family and has been in it for 16 years.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase her capital; she will buy fabric and thread at wholesale on Isac Tamayo Street and after making the items will sell them in Santa Cruz and Cochabamba Departments.  This way of life makes it possible for her to generate resources to help out her family since she’s married and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health clinic.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Filma

texts.en: Filma is a 42-year-old woman who is married and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has three school-aged children with her. She sells tasty food items in the local community to earn a living.  She has been working in this business for three years. She earns a total monthly income of PHP 3,000. Filma has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 from GDMPC to purchase feasible food items to sell. She has been a member of GDMPC for four years already. Filma hopes to build a food-vending stall in the town market.

loans.use: To purchase food items to sell.

loans.name: Zaira Vanessa

texts.es:
Zaira  de 23 años de edad, es soltera, vive en su casa de sus abuelos, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito de Paijan que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace unos años aproximadamente Zaira se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos), bebidas sandalias y ropa, su negocio lo ha colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad, con las ganancias por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos personales.

Para poder implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mercadería para abastecer su tienda, con el único ideal de que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos nuevos para ofrecer a sus clientes y también para cubrir su préstamo. Zaira es una persona joven que con esfuerzo y trabajado se a preocupado por su bienestar y de tratar de ayudar económicamente a las personas con las que vive.
texts.en:
Zaira, 23, is single and lives in her grandparent's house, which has basic utilities and is located in the Pajan district in the department of La Libertad.  This area is known for its animal husbandry and agricultural activities.

For several years, Zaira has had a business selling groceries (everyday products such as milk, rice, cooking oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, and eggs), drinks, sandals and clothing.  Her business is located in her home for her comfort, and with the earnings from the sale of her products she tries to cover all of her personal expenses.

In order to stock up her store, she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy merchandise.  Her idea is to use the loan for the sole purpose of growing her business so that she will have more new products to offer to her customers and the revenue to pay back the loan.  Zaira is a young person who, with her hard work, knows how to take care of herself and also tries to provide financial assistance to the people that she lives with.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
Nasceu  em Boane,  provincia  de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, casada  e  não tem filhos. Fez 2ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua mãe e seu irmão enviando dinheiro para ajudar as despesas. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é negociante  ha mais de 15 anos e dedica-se a compra e venda de produtos diversos, e tem um rendimento de serca de cerca de 12.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material PARA CONSTRUCAO DE UMA CASA ( areia, ferro, cimento,pedra, blocos, e outros) para a  sua obra. O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 5.000.00mt,também  para a sua obra.
Pretende concluir a sua casa para melhor confortar a sua familia, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Isabel was born in Boane, which is in Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is married and has no children. Isabel finished second grade and quit school because she could not afford it. She lives in her own house with her family and supports her mother and brother by sending them money to help with their expenses.

She has never left her hometown. For more than 15 years Isabel has been a businesswoman, buying and selling various products. She earns around 12,000 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses. She also saves some money in her bank account (at BIM).

She has never had loans from other banks, and she learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Isabel's second Hluvuku loan, and she is asking for 10,000 meticais to buy construction materials for her house (sand, iron, cement, stone, blocks and other items). The first loan was for 5,000 meticais and was also used for home construction.

Isabel plans to finish her house and make her family more comfortable, so she will ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy materials for building a house (sand, iron, cement, stone, blocks, etc.).

loans.name: Genilyn

texts.en:
Genilyn works hard to support her family. Genilyn is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Genilyn requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing materials.

Genilyn has been in this business for a year now.

In the future, Genilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fishing net and other fishing materials

loans.name: Enkhbold

texts.en:
Enkhbold, 42, is a watchman in a public organization. He lives with his two children and his wife in Kherlen town of Dornod, a province of Mongolia. He has been doing his job since 1996. 

Actually, he is an agronomist but he has not been working in this occupation. But he wants to use it for his job and his life.  

He has a plan to have his own vegetable garden and sell the produce to urban clients. He said that he is going to use his profession in his own business and grow natural produce. Therefore, he decided to implement his plan through purchasing land in the suburbs as a vegetable garden. It will improve his family income and their living conditions.
 
Therefore, Enkhbold is taking a loan to purchase land as a vegetable garden.

loans.use: To purchase land for a vegetable garden.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabric, cloth, and sewing supplies to successfully launch her clothing line

loans.name: Noun

texts.en:
Noun, 52 years old, is a grocery seller at home, and earns $5 per day. Her husband is a driver and earns $5 per day. They have five children, two are studying and the other three are working, earning $2 per day each. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy more grocery goods to sell. This loan can help her to buy different kinds of goods to sell that can make more income. She wants to extend her grocery shop when she has enough money. For her children, she wants to support them to study and at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Arafa

texts.en:
Arafa is applying for another loan to start a fruit juice selling business. She will use this 80,000 Kenyan shilling loan to purchase a multipurpose blender and stock of fruits for making juice. In the future, Arafa hopes to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Arafa has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase a multipurpose blender and stock of fruits for making juice.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha Lorena tiene 40 años, ella es maestra de primaria. Ella tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo que con mucho sacrificio ha logrado mantener. Ella quería realizar este crédito con el fin de comprar zinc, clavos, perlines entre otros para reparar el techo de su vivienda, no lo había podido realizar porque no tenía el capital suficiente y es por medio de los créditos que ella quiere poder realizar esta necesidad.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena, 40, is an elementary school teacher.  She has three minor children to care for whom she has managed to support with great sacrifice.

She wanted to get this loan with the goal of buying corrugated metal roofing, nails, and perlins, among other things, to repair the roof of her home.  She hadn't been able to do this because she didn't have enough capital, and it's with loans that she wants to be able to carry out this necessity.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal roofing, nails, and perlins, among other things.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a single mother of 3 children, aged 37-23, living in Hioma, Uganda. She has no other dependents and she is the only income earner in the family. Hence, the responsibility of taking care of the family welfare rests on her.

Florence owns a clothing business and she has been operating it for 4 years now. She started it with limited capital of 500,000 shillings but now she has a capital of 1,000,000 shillings. 

She faces the challenge of having accidents while moving to different markets to vend her clothes, and her dream is to operate from an established premises. Florence needs the loan to rent a shop.

loans.use: to rent a shop for selling her clothes.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 30-year-old business man who lives in Juba. He is married and has three children between the ages of one and 10, two of whom go to school. 

Joseph sells food and household goods, and has had this business for a year and a half.  He heard about Kiva field partner Finance Sudan through a door-to-door promotion done by loan officers. He plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy items such as tomato paste, powdered milk, salt, and detergent. This business is Joseph's only source of income, and in five years' time he hopes to be able to build his own shop.

loans.use: to buy items like tomato paste, powdered milk, salt, and detergent

loans.name: Bidii Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Bidii Group in Western Kenya! John is the facilitator of the group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

John takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, John had a very good maize yield, harvesting 14 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to John and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, John will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Bidii group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Maria Dilia

texts.es:
La señora María, de 45 años de edad, con estudios básico solo logro terminar la primaria pero con un deseo de superación ha salido adelante con su negocio de tortillería una de las actividades más productivas y populares de la ciudad de Estelí de donde es originaria, tiene dos hijos de 18 y 14 años de edad respectivamente están estudiando pues para ella son su prioridad ya que desea un mejor futuro para ellos. Inicio sus actividades con la venta de 50 tortillas era muy poca cantidad pues no tenía mucha materia prima después fue aumentando más cantidad a medida que conseguía mas clientela vio también que en las pulperías la gente preguntaba por tortillas entonces comenzó a ofrecer sus tortillas a las pulperías le genero un buen resultado este ha sido su segundo negocio antes de dedicaba a la costura pero no le ganaba mucho pero la venta de tortillas es más rentable así que decidió vender tortillas. 
Ella realizo el crédito para  comprar leña y maíz al por mayor pues le resulta mejor comprar por mayor cantidad para poder obtener un buen precio por la materia prima así producir más.  Uno de sus planes futuros es contratar a personas para que le ayuden a elaborar tortillas y así cubrir parte de la demanda de sus clientes ya que ella solo no es suficiente para cumplir con todos los pedidos, Su meta próxima es hacer reparaciones en su humilde casa empezando por la cocina que es donde elabora sus tortillas.
texts.en:
María, 45, has only achieved a very basic level of schooling, but has a great desire to get ahead and has done so with her tortilla business. This is one of the most productive and popular activities in the city of Estelí, where she is from. She has two children, 18 and 14 years old respectively. They are studying, and are Maria's priority and she wants a better future for them.

She started her business selling 50 tortillas, a very small quantity, because she didn't have enough of the needed ingredients. Afterwards, her inventory increased because she gained additional clients. She also noticed that in small corner shops a lot of people were asking for tortillas, so she began selling her tortillas in these stores as well. This turned out to be a good strategy, and has become her second business. Before she worked sewing but she didn't make very much money. Selling tortillas is more profitable, so she decided to sell tortillas.

She will use the loan to buy wholesale firewood and maiz (corn), since she gets a better result by buying wholesale so as to get a good price for the materials, and produce more. One of her plans for the future is to hire employees so that they can help her make tortillas and satisfy part of her clients' demand, since she alone can't fill all of her orders. Her next goal is to make repairs on her humble home, starting in the kitchen--where she makes her tortillas.

loans.use: to buy firewood and corn.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie lives in Buchanan.  She is 35 years old, married, and has four children ages 14 to 18 who are in school and live at home.  For the past eleven years, she has been selling blouses and slippers in the market.  She established the business with small loans from friends.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more blouses and slippers to expand her business. In the future, she wants to build a house.

loans.use: buy blouses and slippers

loans.name: Pom

texts.en:
Mr. Pom, age 37 and a father of 4 children, has been residing in Takhmao town together with his family. He is a construction foreman who is in charge of and watches over a group of workers at the building site. He typically yields approximately $6 per day through this business. Besides his main outdoor work, he also devotes some spare time to be a fisherman to generate additional income.

With the loan he has applied for from HKL, Pom will buy construction supplies to support his business. His future goal is to upgrade his skills and become the owner of construction projects and to build a construction team by himself.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Alla

texts.ru: Алла использовала предыдущий кредит КИВА в качестве вложения в материал для строительства дополнительной теплицы. За счет построения этой теплицы Алла смогла увеличить количество высаженных овощей и, таким образом, получить дополнительный доход. Кредит в размере 15 000 гривен необходим Алле в этот раз, так как ей не хватает средств для расширения тепличного хозяйства. Так как Алла постоянно стремится увеличивать объемы выращивания ранних овощей, она хотела бы продолжать вкладывать дополнительные средства в развитие своего дела и в дальнейшем.
texts.en: Alla used her previous loan from Kiva to invest in construction materials for building an additional greenhouse.  Due to the construction of this greenhouse, Alla was able to increase the quantity of planted vegetables and, thus, earn an additional income.  She needs a loan in the sum of 15,000 hryvnia this time because she does not have enough money to expand her greenhouse business.  Because Alla always strives to increase the volume of growing early vegetables, she wants to continue investing additional funds into developing her business in the future.

loans.use: to expand her greenhouse business

loans.name: Enkhtsetseg

texts.en:
Enkhtsetseg is a 48-year-old widow who lives with her two daughters, ages 23 and 26, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the outer ger districts of the city. Her younger daughter is a student while her older daughter helps with her business. 

Enkhtsetseg supports her family by operating a shoe retail stall at the largest outdoor market and also two other indoor markets in Mongolia, with help from her elder daughter. 

When she first began her business in 2002, Enkhtsetseg was a contracted seller of a local shoe factory and she didn't have her own working capital. As a result of her hard work, today she has 6.5 million Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital at her stall. During the past 10 years, she has gained a lot of experience and she has been able to improve her living conditions. 

She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to import goods from Beijing for the upcoming season.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Sourng's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Sourng is now 55 years old and married. She has five children. Sourng and her husband are farmers who grow as main business to support the family. Having been in the business for 30 years, they are able to make daily earning of 55,000KHR and manage to save about 25,000KHR each day. 
This is the first loan for sourng with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to timely grow her rice so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Janel

texts.en: Janel owns and operates a transportation transport service  for many years to earn a living. He had support the family's daily needs with this income aside from their retail store.  Recently, he took a new loan to buy spare parts for his  motorcycle maintenance to used for his transportation business and a portion to buy additional goods for their retail store. He plans to buy sidecar for his motor for expansion of his business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses will use the loan to buy fertilizers and fertilizers for his tea plantation. He is such a hardworking man with an aspiration of buying land to expand his tea plantation. The reason behind engaging in the businesses of tea growing and motorcycle transport was to get income to look after his family. He has been in the motorcycle business for the last two years and is proud to mention about the profits that have enabled him to improve on his standards of living and the family at large. He faces a difficulty of loss of soil fertility and pesticides which affect his tea plantations’ expected harvests.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and fertilizers for his tea plantation.

loans.name: Ada Marina Castellan

texts.en: I have had a grocery for the past 5 years.  I sell everyday household Ã­tems like chicken, sugar, coffee, butter, ham, and the like.  My business is in a good location and my costumers like how I treat them.  My business sustains our family because my husband does not make enough meet the needs of the whole family, so together we are able to provide for ourselves.

loans.use: Invest in inventory of meats, canned foods, razors, chicken, butter, tiolet paper, beans, sugar, corn, and other Ã­tems.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Elizabeth would like to buy shares

loans.name: Abiodun

texts.en: A woman of age 58, Abiodun is married and has six children. She lives in the semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria, where she started her own retail business in the year 1996. She specializes in the sale of drinks. According to Abiodun, a loan of US$625 would greatly help her in expanding the business.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Telman

texts.en: Telman B. is in the unusual, but needed, business of  finishing and selling headstones. His enterprise is in the town of Khachmaz which is located on the North Eastern coast of Azerbaijan. Telman is looking for funding so that he can increase his inventory of unfinished headstones.

loans.use: To purchase unfinished headstones

loans.name: Abdou

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the four members of the Ndigne group, led by Mr. Abdou D.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Background: The Ndigne group is located in the village of Louly Ngogom. Situated in the interior of the country, Louly is an agricultural village that specializes in peanut farming.

Purpose: To support the families of the village in between harvests, and improve living conditions.

Activities: The business consists of buying sheep, fattening them and selling them at the weekly markets.”

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

Business description translated from French by Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance Fund.

«Contexte : Le groupement Ndiguné est un groupement du village de Louly Ngokhom ; Situer au centre du pays,le village de louly est un village d’agriculteur qui se donne surtout à la culture de l’arachide .

Objectif : Soutenir les familles en période de soudure Améliorer les conditions de vie

Activités : l’activité consiste a acheter des moutons, les engraissés et les vendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires.»

loans.use: Purchase and fattening of sheep for resale

loans.name: Salimata

texts.en:
Salimata Kamagaté is so professional, indeed. When we met her in the market of Treichville, in the southern region of Abidjan, she welcomed us with a big smile. She has a long experience, dating from 1980, in selling utensils and tubers; a business like a heritage from her ancestors.

Today Salimata is 40 and hopes that Kiva.org lenders will help her by lending to her, after months of very short-term funding. She is confident in herself: her experience is going to make the difference as far as profits are concerned.

Salimata is married and is mother of a kid attending school .They all live together in Marcory and Salimata goes every morning to Treichville market, which is about 5 miles from Marcory. She needs the loan to purchase goods in bulk and to pay school expenses for her daughter.

loans.use: Salimata Kamagate will use the loan to purchase goods and pay school expenses for her daughter

loans.name: Vilma Maria

texts.es:
Vilma is an exemplary mother who has demonstrated to her children the value of life and what it takes to be able to get ahead in our society. She has four children, 3 of whom are already independent, although one is still of school age.

Vilma started her business with a capital of US $200.00 selling merchandise on credit, door to door, in diverse companies (to the workers). However, when the new market (Israel Lewites) was opened, she was able to get a hold of a section and she installed herself there, even though the conditions were not the most appropriate. This is how she got started, motivated by the need to support her family. Little by little she has been maintaining and remodeling her locale thanks to loans given to her by CEPRODEL.

Her record is of 14 loans in two and a half years. Vilma says during this time she has felt happy and satisfies for the support offered by CEPRODEL and the trust given to her and her business. Vilma has prospered and as proof of that is the fact that her sales used to be of US$50-60/week and now she sells around US$30.00/day. Similarly, when she started with CEPRODEL her credit was of US$180.00 and now it is of US$580.00 thanks to her hard work to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga and son, Kiva volunteers

Vilma es una madre de familia ejemplar, ha demostrado a sus hijos el valor de la vida y lo que cuesta poder salir adelante en nuestra sociedad. Sus hijos son cuatro, 3 de ellos ya son independientes y uno aun esta en edad escolar.

Ella inicia su negocio con un capital de US$200.00 vendiendo mercadería al crédito de manera ambulante en diversas empresas (a trabajadores), sin embargo cuando abren el nuevo mercado (Israel Lewites) ella se logra apoderar de un tramo y se instala en el mismo aunque las condiciones no eran las mas apropiadas. Es así como ella comienza impulsada por la necesidad de la manutención de su familia. Poco a poco le ha ido dando mantenimiento y acondicionando su local gracias a los créditos que se le ha brindado por parte de CEPRODEL.

Su récord es de 14 créditos en 2½ años, tiempo en el cual dice sentirse contenta y satisfecha por el apoyo que CEPRODEL le ha brindado y la confianza depositada en ella y su negocio. Vilma ha prosperado y prueba de ello es que antes sus ventas eran de US$50-60 dolares semanales, y hoy vende alrededor de US$30.00 diarios. Así mismo cuando inicio con CEPRODEL su crédito era de US$180.00 ahora ya es de US$580.00 gracias a su ardua labor por prosperar.

loans.use: Buying various products.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Inés is a member of the community bank La Amistad del Dorado, located in the province and district of Moyobamba in the department (region) of San Martín. She works selling a variety of sweets in the principal schools of the city as well as in the central plaza.

Her siblings motivated her to develop this business. She considers the loan she received from the community bank a great help because it allowed her to build an inventory of a wider variety of products, including the products most in demand among her young clients.

With the loan of 500 soles (Peruvian currency) which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy a larger quantity of chocolate, cookies and waffles in packages, boxes of gum, popular sweets known as chisitos, fried potato sticks, candies in bags and packages of soft drinks.

Inés is very optimistic at the age of 41. She very much likes what she does, especially the daily contact with her young clients, together with her husband and her three children, who always support her. Inés wishes to further develop herself every day as a woman and a business person.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Inés es socia del Banco Comunal “La Amistad del Dorado”, ubicado en la provincia y distrito de Moyobamba, departamento de San Martín, se dedica a la venta de golosinas en sus diferentes variedades, los mismos que ofrece en las principales escuelas y colegios de la localidad así como en la plaza principal.

Fueron sus hermanos quienes la motivaron desarrollar este negocio y considera que el préstamo recibido del banco comunal es de gran ayuda porque le permite surtir y variar los productos que vende y que son requeridos mayormente por los niños.

Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará mayor cantidad de chocolates, galletas y waffle en paquetes, chicles por cajas, chisitos, papitas fritas por tiras y caramelos en bolsas y bebidas gasificadas en paquetes. Inés con sus 41 años se muestra muy optimista, le gusta mucho lo que hace sobre todo el contacto diario que tiene con sus pequeños clientes, junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos, que siempre lo apoyan, desea desarrollarse cada día más como mujer y como negociante.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (chocolates, cookies, waffles, etc.)

loans.name: Gavharoi

texts.en:
Y. Gavharoi is 49 years old and married with two children.

Gavharoi is full of energy. Although she is a seamstress now, she used to sell jewellery . Two years ago Gavharoi started her own business, tailoring and selling curtains. Gavharoi has very good taste and predicts well which styles and types of curtains can be of high demand. She is ready at any time to advise her clients in making their choice.

Gavhar has been working with IMON since April 2007. She manages all her loans accurately without violations and delinquencies. Today Gavharoi requests 1000.00 US Dollars. She is planning to expand her business and to open a private tailoring shop. Gavharoi thanks all for their support and promises to repay the loan in 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business and open a private tailoring shop

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia M. is 32 years old, married, with a 16 year old child. She and her husband also take care of two others aged 58 and 60. In 2005, Sophia started selling clothes and she works everyday from 10am to 4pm at her business where she can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue purchasing recyclable items and products.

loans.name: Selene Mayret

texts.es:
Selene V. started her business two years ago, because she no longer had work and needed a source of income to pay for personal expenses. She decided to rent space and outfit it for the purpose of selling clothing and shoes. At first, she was afraid her enterprise would not work out but thanks to much effort on her part things have been going well.

Currently, she seeks a loan of $500USD to be repaid in 4 months in order to purchase additional merchandise. With your help, Selene will continue her progress.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Selene V. inicio su negocio hace 2 años, ya que no tenia trabajo y necesitaba de una fuente de ingresos para solventar sus gastos personales. Por lo que decidió rentar un local y acondicionarlo para la renta de ropa y zapatos. Inicialmente tenis miedo de que no funcionara pero gracias a su esfuerzo le ha ido bien.

Actualmente solicita un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 4 meses para surtir más mercancía. Con tu contribución Selene seguirá progresando.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Claudia Estela

texts.es:
Ms. Claudia S. is a 36-year-old single mother of a 9-year old son, for whom she works so hard everyday because she wants to provide him with an education. They live in the Hialeah neighborhood in the city of Managua. She has 5 years of experience in her business. She used to be a street vendor, but after much effort, she was able to set up a general store. Her plans are to continue working arduously so that she can increase both her inventory and sales. She needs this loan in order to replace the roof of her general store because winter is approaching and she wants to prevent leaks.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Claudia tiene 36 años de edad, habita en el barrio Hialeah de Managua, es soltera y tiene un pequeño hijo de 9 años de edad, por el que ella trabaja fuertemente todos los días, ya que quiere darle estudios a su pequeño. Tiene 5 años de experiencia en su negocio, antes era una vendedora ambulante pero con mucho esfuerzo pudo poner su pulpería, sus planes son seguir trabajando arduamente para poder tener más inventario y más volumen de ventas. Necesita el préstamo para cambiar el techo de su plupería ya que el invierno se acerca y no quiere que se le meta el agua al negocio.

loans.use: Replace roof of general store

loans.name: Horn

texts.en: Horn S., 61, has seven children and lives in the Kampong Cham province with her husband, Phaok Son. They work together selling groceries and they make around $2 each day. They have their parents to support as well in their household, so three of the children work in the garment factories. Horn S. is asking for a loan of $150 to purchase more groceries for their store. They believe that with the loan, the expansion of their business will bring about an increased income and a higher standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase more groceries

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru:
Dilafruz S. lives in the Rudaki region. She is not married. She lives with her parents. She studies at the Institute. When not studying, she uses her free time to sew national dresses. She sews at home. She wants to take out a loan to buy material. She can then sell pre-made dresses. She plans to pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Сатторова Дилафруз проживает в районе Рудаки. Не замужем . Живет с родителями . Учится в Институте. Кроме учебы в свободное от работы время занимается пошивом национальных платьев. Шьет дома. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить материал . Готовые платья отдает на продажу. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase material

loans.name: Phann

texts.en: Mrs. Phann C. is a villager in Trea Village in Kandal Province. She is 40 years old and the mother of a young child.  She and her husband, Mr. Sieng Sophal, own a small restaurant where they sell Chinese noodles, ricepots, fried rice and drinks. Aside from this business, they are farmers. On their plantation, Mrs. Phann C. does not have enough money to buy fertilizer and pesticide. Therefore, Mrs. Phann C. asks for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina sells groceries in the local marketplace of Zhidachev where she lives with her family of four. She started working in the market as a salesperson. However, later she saw the benefits of being self-employed and decided to launch her own enterprise. Galina has been in this sphere of trade for five years. Currently, she has about $3000 in stock.

Galina is hoping to use the current loan of 5000 Grivnas ($US1050) to increase the assortment of her merchandise and boost her sales. Galina has gained much experience working in the sphere of commerce as a salesperson at first. Today she is happy to be self-employed and see her small enterprise grow and become more and more stable. Galina is hoping to use a portion of the proceeds she generates from higher sales to pay her son's college fees.

loans.use: To increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Roun's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan that contains three members. Mrs. Saret is the group leader. Mrs. Roun C., 36, is a pig breeder. Her husband is a Khmer style constructor; sometimes he goes away from home for his construction works. To increase her income, Saret needs a loan of US$300 to purchase more piglets to breed. The remainder of the loan would be used to purchase pig food.

Mrs. Sal S. is vegetable seller. She requested a loan of US$300 to expand her business by purchasing more vegetables to sell.

Mrs. Meat K. is vegetable seller and she requested a loan of US$300 to purchase a greater variety of vegetables to sell.

They are people living in Kdol Daunteav Commune, Battambang Province.

loans.use: Purchasing more piglets to breed

loans.name: Khursand

texts.en:
Khursand is a hard-working entrepreneur from Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is married and the happy father of six children. He owns a market vending business where he sells clothing for men at a busy locale. Khursand decided to start his own business after he was unable to find other work. Now, two years later, he has about $2000 invested in inventory and he makes about $300 a month profit. In addition to his business, Khursand also works part time as a taxi driver, which enables him to earn more income.

Khursand has requested a loan of 2500 Somoni (US$750) that he will repay within nine months. He will purchase new inventory for his business. Khursand will use the profits from his business to improve his standard of living and do some remodeling of his home.

loans.use: Purchasing the new goods for selling.

loans.name: Marian

texts.en:
Marian O. is 25 years old, and she is single. She makes lovely African designs for her customers. She also sells tailoring materials. She is happy because the demands for her tailoring materials and skills will increase this festive season. 

She hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She needs a loan in the amount of N52,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Roger Antonio

texts.es: El señor Roger Antonio Pavón tiene la edad de 35 años habita en el barrio santa rosa ubicado en la cuidad de Masaya , junto a su compañera de vida ; la cual trabaja para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar ya que tiene dos hijas que estudian , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida a su familia , este señor se desempeña como ayudante de albañil y a la vez como agricultor , don Roger tiene dos años trabajando como albañil y catorce años trabajando sus tierras , el sueño de él es llegar a terminar su casa ya que con muchos esfuerzos y apoyo de su esposa han construido la mayor parte , pero por falta de financiamiento no lo han logrado terminar . El cliente Roger solita el apoyó de nuestra institución para comprar materiales de construcción y llegar a cumplir sus sueños de tener una vivienda digna para su familia
texts.en:
Mr. Roger Antonio Pavón is 35-years-old and lives in the Santa Rosa neighborhood in the city of Masaya. He lives with his wife, who works to help him with the household expenses, as they have two children in school. His future plans include improving his family’s standard of living. Roger is both an assistant bricklayer and a farmer. He has spent two years as a bricklayer and fourteen years working his land. His dream is to finish his house, which, thanks to a great deal of effort and the support of his wife, is nearly complete. However, lack of finances has prevented them from finishing it. Roger is seeking support from our organization so he can buy construction materials and realize his dream of having a decent home for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to finish building his house

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en:
Chhorn K. is 28 years old and lives with her husband and two young children in the Kampong Cham province. 
She sells various kinds of vegetables in the market and is able to make about US$8 in revenue each day. Her husband operates a moto-taxi, earning approximately US$2 of profit a day. 
Mrs. Chhorn K. would like to request a loan of $1000 to expand her vegetable stand by increasing the amount of produce to meet her clients' demands.
(Mrs. K. is pictured with her husband and young child)

loans.use: To increase the amount of produce to sell in her vegetable stand.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Fifty years old and married, Mr. Ruben M. has three children who help him run his small store, Despensa Los 3 Hermanos, which he has operated for over 17 years. He says it was very difficult when he began his business selling drinks and ice cream from a small kiosk, but thanks to the assistance of his family and the constant support of his wife, he was able to develop the business. Much has been accomplished now that his enterprise is growing and his main associates are his sons, who he charges with tending to the store and buying provisions.

One of Mr. M.’s short-term objectives is to finish his home; at the moment it requires some paint and floor work. Of course, another objective is to continue supporting his sons through their studies so they will have the opportunity to achieve a more formal career.

Mr. M. says that thanks to his business he has been able to build his own home, support his family and help his sons. The loans from Fundación Paraguaya have allowed him to keep his business well-stocked with necessary items such as sugar, yerba, beef, milk, rice, and drinks.

loans.use: To purchase goods for the store such as sugar, milk, noodles, rice, meat, beverages, and vegetables.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị L. năm nay 38  tuổi , chị đang sống cùng chồng và ba con đang tuổi đến trườngtại thị xã Phúc Yên tỉnh Vĩnh Phúc. Chị L. tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Hiện taị cả hai vợ chồng chị đều đang chăn nuôi lợn gà và buôn bán rau quả tại chợ. Nhờ có sự giúp đỡ  của chồng nên công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị đang phát triển rất thuận lợi và cho thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vốn cho công việc kinh daonh của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị L., 38 years old, lives with her husband and three school-age children in the town Phúc Yên, Vĩnh Phúc province. Mrs. L. has participated in the TYM Fund since 2003. Currently, both she and her husband work raising pigs and chickens, and selling fruits and vegetables at the local market. With the help of her husband, the family businesses are doing extremely well and provide them with an income of 5,000,000 VND (292 USD) per month. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (525 USD) to invest in the family enterprises.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pigs, chickens, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Prum S. is 38 years old and her husband's name is Sophat, age 41. They currently make a living as local cultivators. They plant different kinds of vegetables. As another revenue source, they are domestic produce traders. The couple has two children who are students in secondary school.

The mature cashew season is coming. To earn additional income, Prum is asking for a loan to order cashews to store in her home, and re-sell to gain income. She lives with her family in Kompong Cham Province.

loans.use: Order cashews.

loans.name: La Familia Group

texts.es:
Este grupo esta conformado por 10 personas todas viven cerca al lugar de reunión que es la casa de la señora Matilde P., quien es la líder del grupo por ello la nombraron presidenta, ella se dedica a la venta de material escolar en la feria de su zona “Munaypata”;  tiene 4 hijos y esta casada con el señor Omar B. quien trabaja como administrador en la tienda de la fabrica de Stabilo en el centro de la ciudad de La Paz, la señora Matilde es una persona perseverante y ante todo  muy leal con la institución, porque ya antes trabajo en otro grupo donde sus excompañeras crearon algunos problemas, por ello ella se propuso formar  otro grupo con personas de mas con fianza y en su zona y así seguir trabajando con Emprender.
Otra líder del grupo es la señora Danitza B. quien se dedica a la venta de comida, tiene 2 hijos y manifiesta el querer seguir trabajando con Emprender y mas Lugo obtener un crédito mas alto para  aperturar su pensión.
También son parte del grupo  el señor Ivan tito Q. Q. quien es protesista dental.
Giovanna Daysi P., ella es soltera estudia la carrera de Derecho pero también es una joven emprendedora que se dedica al tejido de prendas de bebe a maquina.
Marcelo Victor P. también se dedica al tejido de gorritos y ropa de bebe.
Eugenia M. Velásquez  se dedica a la venta de comida en la puerta de su domicilio.
Angelica C. Rioja ella es parte de la mesa directiva del grupo tiene el cargo de Tesorera, su negocio es el de repostería.
Tereza Manuela S. N., ella tiene un taller de producción de zapatos de cholita, trabaja junto a su esposo Jaime Gonzales.
Adriana Q. B. se dedica a la  venta de cosméticos.
Fabiana Domitila M. ella vende comida “pescado frito” en el mercado Uruguay también vende al por mayor ropa que trae desde Chile.
texts.en:
This group has 10 members, all of whom live close to where the group meets - Señora Matilde P.'s house. She is the group's leader, the person they have named as their president, and she sells school supplies at the area's market: Munaypata. She is married to Señor Omar Barrerahas, who works in the offices of a clothing store in middle of the city of La Paz. The couple have 4 children. More than anything, Matilde is very determined and very loyal to the group. Earlier, she was part of a different group but the other members were difficult to work with, so Matilde founded a new group, this group, with people who were more reliable and lived in her neighbourhood. In this way, was able to continue working with Emprender. Another very active member of the group is Señora Danitza B., who sells meals. She has 2 children. She is looking forward to her future work with the communal bank and especially, to realizing her goal of opening a little hostel. Other group members include Señor Ivan tito Q. Q., who is a dental prosthetician; Eugenia M. Velásquez, who sells meals from his home; Adriana Q. B., who sells cosmetics; Fabiana Domitila M., who sells fried fish in Uruguay market, as well as importing and selling clothing from Chile; Giovanna Daysi P., who is single and studies law, but who also makes and sell babies' clothing; Marcelo Victor P., who also makes clothing for babies; Angelica C. Rioja, who is the group's treasurer and who runs a pastry shop; and finally, Tereza Manuela S. N. and Jaime Gonzales, who are married and run a traditional shoe making business.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock a bookstore

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer Y. is a 30-year-old farmer.  He and his wife, Norma, have been blessed with one child, Elisi. Elisi is 18 years old and has just graduated from high school, but unfortunately is not able to pursue a college degree at the moment due to financial difficulties. Elmer's family lives in the peaceful area of San Isidro in Quirino, Isabela. He strives to sustain his farm to further support his family’s immediate needs.

Elmer is thankful for the financial support provided to him last year by the Kiva lenders, and is requesting a second loan amounting to 16,000 Phillippine pesos (or about $350 US) for his farming needs. He has been farming for 10 years, growing rice and tobacco. He will use the money to purchase the necessary materials for his agricultural business which he needs for the upcoming planting season. Elmer also hopes to raise his family’s standard of living and be able to support his daughter’s college studies.

loans.use: To purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Soutien Plus Group

texts.fr: Godeline F. vend des poissons salés, des arachides, des pains et des fruits selon les saisons. Elle a commencé le commerce en vendant des pains en 1981 avec un capital initial de $3. De 1981 en 1990, l’évolution de son activité lui a permis de la diversifier en y ajoutant des savons, du sucre et des poissons salés. Les instabilités politiques et économiques des années 90 dans le pays ont également affaibli son activité. De 2000 à ce jour, Godeline a fournit un grand effort pour stabiliser son affaire. Elle a décidé d’intégrer un des groupes de Hope dénommé « Soutient » en vue d’avoir un appui financier pour développer son commerce en vue de supporter sa famille. Elle a planifié avec le crédit de mai courant d’acheter 1sac d’arachides et ½ carton des poissons salés à revendre dans le but d’accroitre le revenu. Son mari est tombé malade depuis 2005 et il est affaibli. Son ambition est d’ouvrir une maison des vivres frais. Son affaire lui procure un bénéfice de $120 par mois. Godeline est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 13 et 28 ans. Six d’entre eux étudient.
texts.en:
Godeline F. sells dried fish, peanuts, bread, and fruits, depending on the season. She started her business by selling bread in 1981, with an initial capital of $3. From 1981 to 1990, the evolution of her business enabled her to diversify, adding the sale of soaps, sugar, and dried fish. Political and economical instabilities in the country during the 90's weakened her business. Since 2000, Godeline has been making great efforts to stabilize her business. She decided to join one of the groups of Kiva's partner, HOPE, in order to get financial support to develop her business to support her family. The group she joined is called "Soutient". She plans to use this loan to buy one sack of peanuts and one half box of dried fish, to retail in order to increase her revenue. Her husband has been sick and weak since 2005. Her ambition is to open a shop to sell fresh food. Her business turns a monthly profit of $120. Godeline is married and the mother of 7 children, who are between 13 and 28 years old. Six of them are students.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy one sack of peanuts and one half box of dried fish

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina de 34 años, trabaja muy duro para darle lo mejor a su hijo Jorge de 5 años, vive en una casa alquilada y lo que más quiere es mejorar sus vidas y sabe que trabajado duro lo logrará.	Edad, estado civil, miembros de su familia. Se dedica a la venta de ropa en la Explanada Laguna Temporal (Lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), su puesto es muy concurrido, ya que ella siempre trata a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y respeto. Tiene 2 años realizando esta actividad y espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en uno de los principales puestos de la explanada. Catalina disfruta mucho de conversar con sus clientes e informarles sobre las características de sus prendas, de esta manera toma confianza con sus clientes y puede realizar una buena venta. Lo que considera más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto sin poder salir a la calle, ya que tiene que estar siempre alerta a cualquier imprevisto. Catalina quiere mejorar su vida y sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro para lograrlo. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados planea comprar más ropa y así implementar mejor su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Catalina is 34 years old and works very hard to give the best to her 5-year-old son Jorge. She lives in a rented home and, more than anything, she wants to improve their lives. She knows that she will succeed by working hard.
She sells clothing in the Explanda Laguna Temporal (where the markets are held in Juliaca). Her stall is very popular since she always treats her customers with kindness and respect. She has run this business for 2 years and hopes that it will grow into one of the esplanade’s top stalls.
Catalina very much enjoys talking with her customers and telling them about her clothing; this way she earns their trust and she can make a good sale. The most difficult part is staying at her stall all day and not being able to go out in the street, since she always has to stay alert. Catalina wants to improve her life and knows she must work hard for it.
This is her second loan with MFP; she knows she has to make her repayments on time and is prepared to do so. She is a very happy and responsible member of her communal bank. She plans to buy more clothing with the requested 1000 PEN and thus better supply her stall.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa M. owns and operates a specialized retail business selling electronic load in the local community. She is 45 years old, married and from the city of Dipolog. Teresa just started this business early this year.

In 2007, Teresa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Teresa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in a business selling homemade ice in the community. Teresa is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional working capital for e-load retailing. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in e-load retail business

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Фуркат мужчина 33 лет. Женат имеет 3-х детей.Фуркат как глава семьи работает и зарабатывает деньги.Жена домохозяйка, нянчит троих детей. Фуркат более 10 лет водит маршрутное такси №18 - Худжанд - Гафуров.Каждый день работает без выходных.Данный кредит берёт для обновления чехлов своего автомобиля марки "Газель" так как они очень износились.
texts.en:
Furkat is a 33-year-old man. He is married and has 3 children. As head of household, Furkat works and earns money. His wife is a homemaker, who takes care of their three children. Furkat has been driving a shuttle bus #18 on the Khujand-Gafurov route for over 10 years. He works every day, without days off. He is obtaining this loan in order to update seat covers for his Gazel vehicle because they have become very worn.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Updating vehicle seat covers

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin sells jewelry and clothes. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. She travels to Togo and Cotonou (in Benin) to purchase her goods. Toyin lives in Lagos. She is 34 years old and married with 2 children. Toyin is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more jewelry and clothes to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: Emilia A. sells clothes and also runs a mini-restaurant in Asebu Yamoransa. Emilia has received no education. She is single and has no children. Emilia has been selling clothes and also running a mini-restaurant since 2003. She is responsible for paying utility bills, paying rent and also feeding her family. Her loan will be used to purchase spices and other food supplies for her food preparation and sale and also to buy clothes in larger quantity for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase spices and other food supplies for her food preparation and sale

loans.name: Love Group

texts.en:
Love Group is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Hawa K., living in Kolahu, Lofa county, Liberia. Hawa is 40 years old, married, and has 5 children aged 5–20. She also takes care of 3 children orphaned in the war. Her children are all in school, the oldest in 10th grade. Hawa was unable to attend school because although she enjoyed it the cultural norm was for girls to rely on their husbands to provide, and therefore school was considered unnecessary. She lives in remote Kolahu city in rural Lofa county, the breadbasket of Liberia. 

Hawa’s business is in red palm oil, used for baking, which she buys wholesale and sells in a temporary market stall in the central Kolahu market. She has run her business for 3 years and is successful because her customers like her personality and work ethic. She is taking the loan to purchase 2 large tins of palm oil, which she will re-package and sell in smaller bottles. Her dream is to grow her business so she can one day have a bigger table in the main market and ultimately her own permanent shop. With the profits from her business, Hawa dreams of raising her family well in her own house and sending the kids to university.

loans.use: Purchase 2 large tins of oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Additional capital for fish vending

loans.name: Srun

texts.en: Srun S. is 36 years old and resides with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She works in a grocery store, making approximately US$1.50 each day. She also raises pigs and chickens for her additional income. Her husband is a farmer who typically makes about US$3 per day. He grows rice, fruit and vegetables. This couple has two school-aged children. Srun would like to take out a loan of US$500 to make two investments. She uses US$250 to rebuild her grocery store and the leftover is used to raise more chickens.

loans.use: Rebuild grocery store and raise chickens.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina M. is from the village of Danao. She is 34 years old. Lina is single. To make a living, Lina owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lina has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.
