In 2001, Lina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Lina is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Lina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan G. , 52 years old, resides at Siayan, Zamboanga del Norte. Married, he is blessed with 5 children. His wife is a businesswoman but the income of his wife is not enough for the needs of their family since their children are all in school. The school miscellaneous expenses and tuition fees have increased, so he has found a way on his own to support his wife. He owns a small sari-sari store and sells gasoline and oil lubricant which he started with a small amount of capital.

He has been an active member of Paglaum since September 2009. He is thankful that Paglaum has come to their place because he believes that it can help to put more capital into his business, while he enjoys the programs and services of Paglaum. He has applied a loan to PMPC in the amount of Php15,000 as additional capital for his business.

loans.use: additional capital for his business

loans.name: Maritza Del Socorro

texts.en:
Maritza Del A. M. is 44 years old. She lives in Corredores, in the southern region of Costa Rica, with her husband and four children. Maritza is in the textile business: she designs and produces shorts and pants by hand with her sewing machine. She started her business in November of 2006 with an initial investment of 700,000 colons ($1200 US) she sells her products from her home and from door to door in her neighbourhood. Her clothes are very popular, and at the moment she has more orders than she can keep up with. 

Maritza’s main challenge has been securing a reliable and affordable supplier of raw materials. Currently, her supplier is located in San Isidro, which is close to her home, but the materials are expensive and delivery is unreliable. She knows a supplier in San Jose who is much more professional and affordable. Due to the longer distance and associated costs of distribution, the San Jose supplier requires a minimum quantity to be purchased with every order. Currently, she does not have enough capital to place a large enough order to satisfy this restriction. Maritza is applying for a loan of 500,000 colons, which will enable her to purchase larger quantities of materials from the source in San Jose. With your help, she will be able to purchase in bulk and take advantage of a lower price for the materials she needs. By switching suppliers, Maritza will increase her profit margins and use the income to improve her family’s quality of life.

Maritza has a strong work ethic; she devotes the hours from 7am to 6pm to her textile business. On a good day she can produce 10 articles of clothing. Shorts sell for 2500 colons (around $4US) while pants sell for 4000 colons (roughly$7US). The majority of sales are done in cash, and in a good month she earns 500,000 colons. In a bad month, she only earns 60,000 colons.  After accounting for the costs of raw materials, rent and machinery maintenance, Maritza uses her revenues to support her family.

Maritza dreams of opening her own store where she could offer a more diverse range of products.

Your contribution is a direct investment in the improvement of the lives of families living in a poor community of southern Costa Rica.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for clothing

loans.name: Yong

texts.en:
Mr. Yong S., 50, a resident of Tralach village in Takeo Province, is a farmer who owns a plot of land upon which he cultivates rice. Because his field is infertile and he does not yet have rice seed, he is requesting a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizers, and pesticides for his farm.

His wife, Mrs. Suong Siem, is a grocer, and they have four children, two of whom stay at home to do housework while the others are attending the local school. His wife is shown in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizers, and pesticides.

loans.name: Folashade

texts.en: Folashade is 44 years old and married with two children. She sells used clothes of various kinds, different designs of shoes, and bags. She has been in the business for over twelve years and says her business is moving and she looks forward to owning a boutique in the future. Folashade is a focused, hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to sustain her businesses. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 140,000 to purchase more clothes, bags, and shoes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more bags, clothes, and shoes to sell

loans.name: Ivette Del Rosario

texts.es:
A sus 25 años de edad, la joven Ivette del Rosario se dedica a la actividad de costurera realizando todo tipo de piezas para vestir así como vestidos y camisas. Ella es una joven muy trabajadora y siempre está preocupada por el bienestar de su familia y por ello ha duplicado sus esfuerzos en el negocio.
El crédito que ella está solicitando lo invertirá directamente en la compra de los materiales de trabajo y principalmente la compra de tela para elaborar uniformes escolares porque ya se acerca la temporada de clase donde aprovechará para trabajar con mayor dedicación en la actividad.
texts.en:
At 25 years old, young Ivette del Rosario works as a seamstress, making all types of pieces of clothing, such as dresses and tops. She is a very hard working young woman, and is always worrying about the wellbeing of her family, and for this she has double her efforts in the business. The loan that she is seeking will be invested in the purchase of working materials, principally material to make school uniforms, because the school term is coming when she will take advantage to work with more dedication at the activity.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
Albina es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Albina es casada, tiene 60 años y 8 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Huayllapampa, Albina vende comida y bebidas los días domingos en el estadio de su comunidad, además Albina se dedica a la crianza de animales menores.
Albina necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas y cervezas.
Los sueños de Albina son ampliar su negocio y tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Albina is a member of the Violeta Communal Bank. She is 60 years old, married with 8 children, and lives in the Huayllapampa community. Albina sells food and drinks every Sunday at the community stadium. She is also involved in raising small animals. Albina is requesting a loan of 800 soles to purchase sodas and beer. Her dream is to improve her business and to have her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sodas and beer

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan M. is a 48-year-old married woman who lives in Talusan, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns a living by running a fishing operation. Her husband, Abundio, is 55 years old and a fisherman by trade. They have seven children, all of whom are adults.
Susan joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 1995 in the hope of helping her husband to improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF, she has been able to increase the family income by engaging in her fishing business. Now she earns an average monthly income of 10,000 PHP from her business activities.
Susan is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP was used to fund the operation of her fishing business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her seventeenth loan, of 19,500 PHP, which she intends to use to buy additional fishing materials. Susan is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials

loans.name: Maria Elia

texts.es: La señora María Elia es casada con el señor Roberto Pérez y son una pareja muy estable, pero sobretodo muy trabajadora. Ellos tienen un negocio de abarrotes de nombre “El Changarro” establecido desde hace 15 años con el apoyo de su marido e hijos los cuales les ha proporcionado a todos carrera profesional con el esfuerzo del trabajo de su negocio. Como una familia muy unida están solicitando este crédito para la inversión a su negocio.
texts.en:
María Elia is married to Roberto Pérez; they are a very stable couple, and above all very hard-working. They have a grocery store called “El Changarro” ("The Little Shop") which was established 15 years ago. María Elia benefits from the help of her husband and her children, who have all been able to learn a profession thanks to the family's hard work with the store. As a very united family, they are requesting this loan to invest in their business.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in her business by purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Rowaida

texts.en:
Rowaida is a housewife and a mother of six children, four boys and two girls.  Five of them are school students while the sixth, who is over 18 years old, is helping his dad to afford family expenses.  They both work as construction workers.

The family used to own land where they grew vegetables to sell as a second source of income, but the land was confiscated because it is located where the apartheid wall is being constructed. Therefore, Rowaida rented a small shop to start a small supermarket, and she applied for a loan from FATEN to fill the supermarket with goods.

Rowaida says that the supermarket income will be used to pay her five children's school fees and other household expenses. The supermarket is located in an excellent location of the village of Qalqilia.

Rowaida comes from a conservative family, so her son appears in the picture above.

loans.use: To stock the borrower's supermarket

loans.name: Rosario Amparo

texts.es: La Sra. Rosario tiene 48 años D. edad tiene 4 hijos do D. ellos  mayores D. edad, y dos en edad escolar, ella es viuda, vive en casa propia D. material noble recientemente construida, ya que fue afectada por el terremoto, ella actualmente se esta dedicando a la venta D. productos D. limpieza en el mercado Arenales como ambulante, adicional a eso  prestando servcios D. costuras, ella tiene muchos sueños y objetivos uno D. ellos es poner un negocio propio en su casa. Con el dinero que solicita invertira en capaital D. trabajo para su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosario, 48, has four children, two of whom are adults and two still in school. She is a widow and lives in her own, recently built with substantial materials (because it was damaged by the earthquake), home. She sells home cleaning supplies in the Arenales market; she also works as a seamstress. She has many dreams and goals in life, one of which is to set up her own business in her home. She will use the funds to buy more stock items.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy home cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en: Narantsetseg is 33 years old and lives with her son in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  Her son, Batbayr, attends a local secondary school. Presently, Narantsetseg operates a stationery trading business in her town. She purchases her products at wholesale prices from Narantuul, the largest market in Mongolia, and resells them for a profit. Narantsetseg has been successfully operating her business since 2009. She is an honest person who has been working hard to build a bright future for her son. She is focused on her own future as well. She is requesting a 400,000 tugrug (~ 285 USD) loan to expand her product line so she can sell consumer products including shampoo, toilet paper, tissues and soaps.

loans.use: to expand her product line

loans.name: Ilisaeva's Group

texts.en:
Ilisaeva A. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Balykchi, A.. She is 36 years-old and married with seven children: four sons and three daughters. Three sons and two daughters study at school and the others are preschool age. A. does not work outside the home and looks after the children. Her husband works in a furniture store. Nine years ago he began to take orders for making furniture and the initial amount of this business activity was 15,000 soms (aprx. $325.8). Due to this profit, they opened their own store, bought a computer and their monthly income is now 30,000 soms (aprx. $651.60). With money received from this loan, A. plans to pay for her elder son's school graduation.   In the future they plan to expand the business and to educate their children.

Muzakanova M. is 38 and married with three children: two daughters and a son. All the children study at school. M. works as an implementer in a store, she earns 3,000 soms (aprx. $65.15) per month. Her husband works an architect and his salary is 5,000 soms (aprx. $108.57). In 2005, with an initial sum of 5,000 soms (aprx. $108.57) they opened a photo salon. Thanks to this activity they earn an addition 5,000 soms (aprx. $108.57) and they have been able to buy a computer and furniture for their home. With money received from this loan, they plan to purchase a printer. In the future, they would like to buy a flat in Bishkek.

Zhumaeva A. is the treasurer of the group. She is 42 and married.  She has two sons and a daughter. The older son is a student and the others study at school. A.'s husband works on the railway, so he earns 6,000 soms (aprx. $130.30) per month. A. works at the railway station too and her salary is 4,000 soms (aprx. $86.90). 10 years ago, with an initial amount of 10,000 soms (aprx. $217.15) they bought five heads of small cattle, fattened them and they were resold.  As a result, they increased their number of livestock and they now have 15 heads of small cattle. Thanks to this activity they make an addition 3,000 soms (aprx. $65.15) per month. A. would like a loan to buy three heads of small cattle for an amount of 9,000 soms ($195.44).

Rysalieva G. is 63.  She is married and has raised two sons. The older one is 33 and works a painter. The other one is unemployed. G. does not work outside the home but takes orders for sewing national products. Two years ago with an  initial amount of 1,000 soms ($21.72) she began to take orders from neighbours and was able to make home repairs. Now she wants a loan to purchase fabrics. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Kiva partner Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan which delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/about Partner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To pay for graduation at school.

loans.name: Argemira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Preparar, ensamblar, acabar piezas y convertirlas en delicados vestidos para damas , uniformes colegiales, conjuntos para niñas es lo que en toda su vida ha visto hacer en su familia Argemira del Carmen M. Martínez,  quien desde muy niña aprendió este arte y ya adulta lo ha  convertirlo en un buen negocio, que  representa sus principales ingresos de sostenimiento. Es así como ella en Sabanagrande, Municipio del Atlántico, al oriente del mismo,  es una fiel representante del saber confeccionar y con su creatividad también elabora edredones, fundas y adornos decorativos en cada época del año.
Para Argemira los créditos que ha recibido de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo le han permitido mejorar la calidad de sus productos pues pudo comprar una maquinaria apropiada para su línea de productos. En la actualidad  solicita un crédito mixto por valor de $900.000 para comprar materias primas y poder elaborar conjuntos  de niñas,  así como también repuestos para repotenciar su maquinaria.
 Su gran meta es llevar la calidad de sus productos a otras ciudades, para ser conocida y poderlos vender en mayor cantidad. Su desafío es superarse en el plano de actualización relacionada con su arte, porque vive consagrada a su trabajo  y con poco tiempo para ello;  Argemira tiene muchos desafíos y cuando se presentan, sobre todo en las dificultades económicas, siempre se sobrepone con su trabajo y las supera.
texts.en:
Throughout her life Argemira del Carmen M. Martínez has watched her family cut out, assemble, finish parts, and then turn them into stylish women’s clothing, or school uniforms, or children’s outfits. Ever since she was a young girl, she has been learning how to do this art, and now as an adult, it has become a profitable business providing her main income. She lives in Sabanagrande, west of the municipality of Atlántico. Because of her knowledge and creativity she also makes quilts, pillowcases, and ornaments for the different seasons of the year. The loans that Argemira has received from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation have allowed her to improve the quality of her products. She was able to buy the right sort of sewing machine. Now she is asking for a loan to buy the materials needed to make children’s outfits, and spare parts to improve the sewing machine. Argemira’s goal is take her quality products to other towns so she becomes better-known and sells more items. Her challenge is to find the time to keep on improving her work to which she is devoted. She also has financial difficulties but she always overcomes them through work.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sewing items and sewing machine spare parts

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es: Al visitar este banco comunal Mateo Pumacahua conversamos con el socio Isaías, tiene 27 años,  es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chinchero del Departamento del Cusco, él se dedica a brindar servicios de taxi en la misma ciudad  o cubre la ruta de Chinchero a Cusco ó viceversa. Ya son ocho años que brinda  este servicio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, el ser socio de la Fundación le ha ayudado mucho a superarse y hacer que su negocio crezca, con este nuevo crédito él quiere hacer mantenimientos de su carro. El anhelo del  socio es abrir una empresa de transportes.
texts.en:
The staff of Asociación Arariwa visited with the Mateo Pumacahua Communal Bank and spoke with Isaías, a member who is 27 years old. He is single and lives in the city of Chinchero, in the department of Cusco. He provides taxi service within his city or covers the route from Chinchero to Cusco and vice versa. He has been offering this service for eight years already and it's going very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work. Being a member of the organization has really helped him to get ahead and to grow his business. With this new loan, he wants to do maintenance on his car. It is his hope to one day open a transport company.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car maintenance

loans.name: Razia Begum

texts.en:
Razia Begum lives in Riwind, a city famous for its dairy business, with her family. She has spent 20 years of her life in this city. She has two sons and both of them work. One does embroidery work by taking orders from the city. The other is running a video center in the market, where he sells video cassettes, DVDs, etc. 

Razia Begum’s husband is a street hawker. He sells different kinds of edible items such as nimko, chips and sweets in different streets of the town. Razia Begum also financially supports her family by doing embroidery for her neighborhood clients.
 
She has applied for a loan to help her son, who wants to buy an embroidering machine for his embroidery business. Before, he did hand embroidery but due to a large amount of orders, he needs an embroidery machine to fulfill them on time. 

Razia Begum is hopeful that this investment will have a positive impact on her son’s business and his income will be increased.

loans.use: Purchase embroidering machine for her son's embroidery business

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Heang C. is 32 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its fifteen members who are located in Prey Lve Lech village, Takeo province. Each member of this village loan will use it to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Heang C. is a farmer who works very hard to support her two children. Her husband, Mr. Chea Ouch, is a construction worker and also helps his wife on the farm. In order to increase their income to improve their family living, Mrs. Heang C. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets to raise and pig feed.

This couple has two children, who are both attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and pig feed

loans.name: Sope Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE MAME DIARRA est créé le 30 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 31 femmes toutes mariées. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, mères d’au moins de 03 enfants. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et se sont organisées par voisinage et affinité
Dans l’intention d’augmenter leur pouvoir d’achat, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution CAURIE MICRO FINANCE. Elles sont à leur deuxième expérience avec cette dite institution et tous leurs prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Bado F., debout à l’extrême de la photo, bras croisés, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 56 ans. Elle est vendeuse de fruits de saison. Elle s’approvisionne à Louga et revende au détail dans son village
Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer  régulièrement  des fruits en quantité
Elle contribue à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille tout en renforçant son niveau d’épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sope Mame Diarra was created on December 30 2009. It is made up of 31 women, all married. They have an average age of 45, and are the mothers of at least 3 children. They all come from the same village and have come together as friends and neighbors. With the goal of increasing their purchasing power, the women decided to join the Caurie Micro Finance institution. This is their second time working with Caurie and all their previous loans have been properly repaid. Bado F., standing, edge of photo, arms crossed, is the group's leader. She is 56 years old, and sells fruits in season. She obtains her supplies in Louga and sells at retail in her village. This new loan will allow her to regularly increase her stock of fruits. She contributes to the improvement of her family's living conditions and at the same time, increases her level of savings.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit in season

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy A. sells second-hand clothes at Takoradi. She is married and has two children. She has been through junior high school. Her husband is a teacher. Lucy uses her income to help her husband with the general welfare of her home. The loan s going to serve as additional capital to be used to purchase bales of second-hand clothes for sale.  Lucy plans to plough back her profit into her newly expanded business.

loans.use: additional capital to purchase bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, de 40 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su madre Lucia de 60 años, juntos habitan en la tranquilidad de un paraje de la sierra central peruana. Aunque todavía no tiene familia este trabajador hombre labora todos los días con mucha dedicación, pues desea brindarle una buena calidad de vida a su madre. 

Es por eso que se dedica a la agricultura, siembra papa y oca en los terrenos que posee. Cuando es tiempo de siembra contrata operarios que la ayudan en la labor, y también cuando debe recoger los pesados sacos de sus productos naturales, durante la cosecha. 

Dice que aunque es algo tedioso vigilar sus plantaciones a diario para que no se pierdan por causa de la plaga de insectos. La  recompensa a todo su sacrificio se manifiesta cuando vende su producción a regulares precios a los mayoristas de la ciudad, además se dedica a la crianza de ovejas, que comercializa de vez en cuando en las ferias de su comunidad. 

Como tiene muchos planes a futuro para mas adelante quiere sembrar en mayor cantidad y comprar algunas ovejas para criarlas y comercializarlas después a mayor precio. 

Es el quinto crédito con MFP, y promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente, porque sabe que solo así alcanzara el tan anhelado progreso y podrá brindarle una estabilidad económica a su madre, también dice que esta muy satisfecho con el desempeño de su grupo comunal ya que esta compuesto por personas responsables y solidarias. 

Con el crédito que solicita, comprará abono y fertilizantes que necesita para mejorar la productividad de sus tierras, pues quiere obtener mayores ganancias económicas.
texts.en:
Juan, age 40, lives in his own house with his 60 year old mother, Lucia. They live together peacefully in a parish on the central Peruvian mountain range. Even though he does not yet have a family, this hard-working man labors with great dedication everyday. He wishes to give his mother a good quality of life. That is why he devotes himself to farming. He plants potatoes and “oca” (an edible root) on the land that he has. When it is planting time he hires laborers to help with the work. He also does this when he needs to pick up the heavy sacks of his natural products during the harvest. He says that even though it is somewhat tedious to watch over his crops everyday so that he does not lose them to insect infestations, he is compensated for all of his sacrifice. The compensation occurs when he sells his production at the usual price to the city’s wholesalers. He also raises sheep, and he sells them every now and then at the community fairs. He has many plans for the future in order to get ahead. He wants to plant in greater quantity, and he wants to buy some sheep to raise and later sell for a greater price. This is his fifth loan with MFP. He pledges to make his payments punctually. He knows that it is the only way to make the desired progress and to be able to give her mother financial stability. He also says that he is very happy with his communal bank’s performance. It is comprised of responsible and supportive people. He will use the requested loan to buy the natural and chemical fertilizer that he needs to improve his land’s production. He wants to get greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to improve his land's production

loans.name: Chann's Group

texts.en:
This small group loan is made up of four members, all residents of the rural area of Siem Reap Province. The members have chosen Mrs. Chann S. as the group leader.

Chann S. is 48 years old and earns a living as a domestic tailor, sewing or mending clothes for her villagers. She has five teenage children: two work driving a boat for tourists and the other three attend school. Her husband is skilled in building houses, knowledge he uses to earn a living.

Chann S. is taking her first loan to buy tailoring accessories to perform her sewing service.

The other borrowers who are jointly taking this loan are:

Mrs. S. is applying for a loan to increase the capital of her fish-selling business.

Mrs. P., a grocery trader, is applying for a loan to increase her inventory.

Mrs. N., a fish-seller, is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy tailoring accessories to perform her sewing service

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en: "With hard work nothing is impossible". Estrelita G. is from Barangay Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 46 years old and is married with four school-aged children. Estrelita owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eleven years and earns approximately 5,200 PHP a month. In 2006, Estrelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Estrelita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 7th from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Guillermo is a 70-year-old pepper producer and father of four who lives with his family in the region of Upala in the Northern part of Costa Rica, minutes from the Nicaraguan border. Guillermo is a dedicated farmer. He plans to focus his efforts on the planting and harvesting of Cayenne and Habanero peppers. He works to strike a balance between accomplishing the daily tasks associated with agricultural production and the completion of domestic responsibilities. In addition to his agricultural activity, Guillermo feels it is important to be an active member of his community. As a result, he dedicates a significant portion of his time to community meetings, groups and events. The rural zone where Guillermo lives is sparsely populated with infrequent bus service and a general lack of infrastructure. Guillermo is working hard and striving to reap the maximum benefits from his land and his labor. 

Although this is an individual loan, the community in which Guillermo and his family live is very close-knit and interdependent. Neighbors help and support one another by sharing experiences and expertise acquired over the years. All individual members of the Upala community are dedicated to the improvement of living conditions for the region as a whole.

This loan will be used to finance the production of Cayenne and Habanero peppers. Specifically, the loan will be used to finance the purchase of a variety of necessary agricultural nutrients, fertilizers and chemicals in order to ensure a healthy harvest. All labor and logistical tasks associated with production will be carried out by Guillermo. The production cycle (from planting to harvest) for these types of peppers is roughly one year. Guillermo planted his peppers four months ago and will expect to harvest in the next eight months. Typically, he dedicates the hours from 6:00 AM to 4:00 PM everyday to his agricultural activities. 

Piper and Capiscum Processors Compañía Agrícola Industrial (PROPICA) is an international buyer and seller of chili pepper and ground pepper products. In cooperation with Fundación Mujer, PROPICA has guaranteed to purchase the agricultural products (the peppers) that are to be produced with the help of this loan. PROPICA acts as a guaranteed client for small agricultural producers in the area of Upala, thus ensuring that their products will reach market. 

The main obstacle Guillermo and other producers in the Upala community face is a lack of access to working capital funds. The collaboration of Fundación Mujer and PROPICA represents a unique opportunity to Guillermo, his family and community. By offering a source of start-up capital and a guaranteed client to purchase what is produced, this is a chance to improve living conditions for Guillermo as well as the community at large. Above all, Guillermo wants to take advantage of the current opportunity that has been presented. He wants to profit from this collaboration and see improvements in his home and neighborhood.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural chemicals and nutrients.

loans.name: Ngin

texts.en:
Ngin S. has been a farming businesswoman for a long time. She lives in the province of Kompong Chhnang. Since 1990, Ngin S. has owned and operated her farm to cultivate a rice crop, from which she earns a daily income. Ngin S., 37, is married to Sokon, 40, who is a local construction builder. Ngin S. has three children, one of whom is married and lives independently while the two remaining are single. 

In the past, Ngin S. hired farmer’s cow to help plow her farmland. She hopes to reduce her farm expenses by using her Kiva loan to buy a pair of cows for plowing.

loans.use: To buy a pair of cows for plowing

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra is a widow. She lost her husband a few years ago as a result of a sudden death. It was a difficult time for her and for her four sons. She moved to her brother’s home. She worked very hard to raise her children. Unfortunately, she couldn’t provide them with a proper education but she feels happy that she raised them with discipline and instilled in them good habits.
  
Her eldest son provides catering services to his clients. He offers his services at marriage functions and birthday parties. The next son works in a motor workshop as a motor mechanic. Her two younger sons stay at home and don’t work. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother, who operates a clothes-selling business. With the loan, he will buy clothes of different varieties in a bulk quantity to improve the condition of his business and to offer more variety to his customers. 

Azra is hopeful that by investing money in her brother’s business, his business will grow further and earn him more income. He has been doing this business for past 12 years and has a good knowledge about the latest trends of market. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she has paid her installments on time and attended every meeting. 

Note: In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Azra.

loans.use: To buy clothes for a clothes-selling business

loans.name: Rizaldy

texts.en:
Rizaldy M. is from the village of Binakalan, Gingoog City. He is 41 years old. Rizaldy is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rizaldy owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motor cycle taxi or habal-habal services to local community members. Rizaldy and his wife are also engaging in buying and selling variety of fish like mackerel, sardines & milk fish. Rizaldy has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rizaldy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rizaldy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sale. Rizaldy is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools for the maintenance of the motorela. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rizaldy from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools for the maintenance of his motorela

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en: Marie Chantal is 27 years old. She is married and has four children, including twins. Two of her children attend school but the twins are still too young for school. Her husband works as a mason. Marie Chantal has operated a business selling foodstuffs for three years. She would like to get this loan to buy more potatoes, green bananas and rice to sell. She says that her business is very significant because it has enabled her to renovate her house and build more houses. With the profit from this business, she would like to buy a vehicle to help in her business.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Jerobia

texts.es:
Jerobia es una pequeña comerciante,  se dedica a la venta de ropa y costura, venta que realiza en la zona de puerto cabeza, en donde las ventas son buenas, muy esforzada para lograr el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda. Cuenta con el apoyo de su familia y esposo siendo electricista.
Atreves de los financiamiento ha venido logrando hacer su casa, con el crédito anterior comenzó la construcción del muro, el cual seguirá con este  nuevo préstamo ya que le falta la mitad de la construcción. Comprara materiales como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y seguir la obra.
texts.en: Jerobia is a small businesswoman who sells clothes and sews.  She makes her sales in the Puerto Cabeza area where sales are good.  Jerobia is working hard so that she can improve her home.  She has the support of her family and her husband is an electrician.  Through loans, she has been managing to build her home.  She used her last loan to begin building the walls.  She will continue this work with this new loan since the job is only half done.  She will buy materials such as stone, sand, cement and iron to continue the job.

loans.use: To buy building materials to finish building her walls.  The job is half done and her goal is to finish it.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn D. S. is from the city of Calabayan Ozamiz City. She is 44 years old. Merlyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a business venture operating a transportation service. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from offering motor transport services. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Merlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Merlyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair vehicle for better service

loans.name: Josephfine's Group

texts.en:
Josephfine C. is from the village of Brgy. Bintawan Norte, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 49 years old. Josephfine is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Josephfine is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Josephfine owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Josephfine has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Josephfine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephfine is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Josephfine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Brgy. Bintawan Norte, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Look To God Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Look To God” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Adama K., 40, is the leader of this group. She is married to a businessman and they have two children who are attending primary school. Adama has been a businesswoman for 15 years. She sells rice, beans, bananas, and any other food items that she can lay hands on. With her share of this loan, Adama will buy food in larger quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy food in greater quantities

loans.name: Potey Andromagne Eurydice

texts.fr:
Jeune cliente de 26 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 1 et 14 ans. Elle se lance dans la vente de la friperie  en 2005, quand elle constate que c’était difficile pour sa famille de  vivre avec le seul salaire de son époux.
Elle a des ventes minimales de 5000 fr et 40000frs quand elle a bien vendu.
A l’octroi de son prêt elle compte acheter des nouveaux ballots de pantalon, culotte et body.
Elle est décider de faire des bénéfices et  d’épargné pour pouvoir atteindre ses ambitions, à l’ avenir supporter la scolarité des ses enfants.
texts.en:
Young 26 year old client, married and mother of 3 children whose age varies between 1 and 14 years.

She launched out in the sale of the secondhand clotehes shop in 2005, when She saw that it was difficult for her family to live with only the wages of her husband. 

She has low sales of 5000 Fr and up to 40,000frs when she sold well. 

With the granting of her loan she intends to buy new bundles of pants, shorts, and pullovers. She  wants to profit and save to be able to reach her ambitions, in the future to support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: Purchase of bales of pullovers, shirts, sailor shirts, dresses, skirts

loans.name: Rita's Group

texts.en:
Rita S. is from the village of De Vera, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 34 years old. Rita is the leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Rita raising livestock, primarily chickens, for sale. Rita has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Rita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Rita is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Rita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana se dedica a la venta de ropa por mayor y menor en el interior del país, el crédito lo requiere para adquirir mas ropa deportiva por  que tiene demanda. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri sur de la ciudad de La Paz;  es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  La cliente se encuentra muy feliz por que con los créditos que se le otorgaron anteriormente pudo aumentar su capital de trabajo y sus ingresos mejoraron mucho.
texts.en: Mrs. Juana sells clothes wholesale and retail in her country. The loan will be used to acquire more athletic wear to meet her client's demand. She lives in her home located in the Pasankeri area south of the city of La Paz. She is single and has two children.  She is very satisfied with prior loans she was offered to buy more clothes resulting in an increase of profits.

loans.use: To buy more athletic wear to meet her client's demand.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
María tiene 30 años de edad y es soltera. Vive en casa de sus padres con su hermana y una prima en la parte rural del distrito de Reque, una zona ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el norte de Perú.  Su comunidad no cuenta con agua potable ni energía eléctrica. 

María se dedica a la crianza de animales como patos, pollos, y pavos. Ella cría estos animales en el terreno de su padre ubicado cerca a su domicilio y los alimenta de pastos naturales. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona y a sus propios vecinos. Tiene más de 15 años de experiencia en este rubro. Desea invertir su crédito en la compra de terneros pequeños para engordarlos y venderlos. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles. Con sus ingresos, María puede seguir apoyando a sus padres con los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
María is 30 years old and single.  She lives in her parents' home with her sister and a cousin in a rural area of Reque district which is located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, in the north of Peru.  Her community doesn't have access to drinking water or electricty.

María's business is raising livestock such as ducks, chickens and turkeys.  She raises these animals on a plot of land belonging to her father which is located near her home.  She feeds them natural fodder.  When her animals have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale to the traders who visit her area.  She also sells to her neighbors.

María has more than 15 years experience in this line of work.  She would like to invest her loan in buying young calves to fatten and sell.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  María will use her income to continue supporting her parents with their family expenses.

loans.use: to buy calves to raise and sell

loans.name: Nelly Naty

texts.es:
Nelly de 37 años, es una mujer trabajadora que inicio su actividad vendiendo útiles escolares en su papelería escogió esa actividad ya que tenía que mantener a sus hijos, es separada y tiene tres hijos de 16, 17, 18.

Ella labora desde la 7H00am hasta las 9H00pm  con la ayuda de su hija. Con el préstamo desea comprar útiles escolares papelería y mochilas para incrementar su negocio y aumentar sus ingresos. Ella desea seguir en el negocio para darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nelly, age 37, is separated and has three children aged 16, 17, and 18. She is a hardworking woman who decided to start her own school supply business because she had to provide for her children.

Nelly works from 7am until 9pm with the help of her daughter. She will use the loan to purchase school supplies, stationary, and backpacks in order to expand her business and to increase her income. She wants to continue to develop her business to be able to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to purchase backpacks, stationary, and school supplies

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reyna Isabel tiene 37 años, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos. Se gana la vida con la venta de cosméticos, desde hace más de 2 años. Ella sale a vender sus productos de manera ambulante. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería para vender. Por ello ha acudido a solicitar un préstamo con la intención de comprar pintura de uñas, pintura de labios, cremas, perfumes, tratamientos, sombras, polvos, entre otros. Con los ingresos de su negocio, Reyna puede ayudar a su familia con el sustento económico de su familia. Su mayor anhelo para su negocio es algún día tener una tienda para vender sus productos.
texts.en: Reyna Isabel is 37 and a single mother of two. She sells cosmetics door to door and has done so for the past two years. Now she wishes to expand her business by increasing her sales inventory.  For this reason, she seeks credit to buy items such as nail polish, lipstick, skin creams, perfumes, rouge and other beauty products. With increased sales, Reyna hopes to help her household prosper. One day, she hopes to open her own shop to sell her products.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick, 27, is married to Lilian and they are blessed with one child who is one year old. 

He owns a curio shop in Westlands where for the last three years he has been selling a variety of curios. The business earns him a monthly income of 19,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

This is his first loan from KADET Ltd. with which he wants to buy more curios for sale. He will use the anticipated profits to build a house for his family and hopes to have another curio shop.

loans.use: to buy more curios for resale

loans.name: Sandra Nathaly

texts.es:
Sandra de 26 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada  en el distrito de Olmos  a  una hora del departamento de Lambayeque.  Se caracteriza por ser una zona agricola y ganadera.

Sandra se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y es conocida por su vecinos porque ofrece sus productos de casa en casa, pero también tiene productos en su domicilio.  Estos productos es para que las personas mejoren su imagen personal, en especial las mujeres y con sus ingresos podrá soventar sus gastos personales.

Ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles para implementar su negocio comprando más productos de belleza, los mismos que tendrá en stok para ofrecerlos a sus clientes.   Sandra es una persona muy conocidad por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y una buena hija que trata de brindarles algunas comodidades a sus padres.
texts.en:
Sandra is 26 years old, single, and lives in her parent’s house, which has all the basic services.   It is located in the district of the Olmos, one hour from the department of Lambayeque.  This is a zone known for its agriculture and livestock.

Sandra dedicates herself to selling beauty products, and is familiar to her neighbors because she offers her products door-to-door, but she also has products in her house.  These products are so people can improve their image, especially women, and with her income she can meet her personal expenses.

She has requested a loan of 800 new Peruvian soles to supply her business by buying more beauty products.  She will have the same in stock to offer to her customers.  Sandra is a person very well known for her hard work, responsible nature, and for being a good daughter that tries to provide some comforts for her parents.

loans.use: buy more beauty products to supply her business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es: Angelina de cincuenta y cuatro años de edad vive con sus dos hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una pupuseria y venta de comida los días de semana en la localidad donde reside, ésta es muy concurrida de personas, por lo que Angelina posee mucha clientela, además de que sus comidas tienen un sabor exquisito y a un buen precio, a la gente le gusta comer en el lugar porque es muy higiénico y les dan un servicio especial. Ella piensa que el trabajador nunca se rinde y el que nunca se rinde siempre tiene la oportunidad de ganar es por eso que ella le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar material para su negocio como maíz, arroz, queso, frijoles, chicharrón, carnes, embutidos, verduras, bebidas entre otros; de esta forma siempre podrá satisfacer el apetito de sus clientes. Angelina tiene la esperanza que con su esfuerzo y dedicacion lograra darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Angelina is fifty-four years old and lives with her two children in her own home.  She has a pupuseria (pupusas are a traditional food of El Salvador) and food store, open every day of the week, located in the house where she lives.  It is a very busy place, as Angelina has many customers.  In addition to the fact that her food has exquisite flavors and is reasonably priced, people like to eat at her locale because it’s very clean and they receive special service.

She believes that the worker never surrenders and that, those who don’t surrender, always have the opportunity to succeed.  This is why she turns to INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to purchase ingredients for her business such as corn, rice, cheese, beans, sausage, meats, cold cuts, vegetables and beverages, among other items.  In this manner, she will be able to satisfy her customers’ appetites.  Angelina has the hopes that, through her effort and dedication, she will manage to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: buy corn, rice, cheese, beans, sausage, meats, cold cuts, vegetables and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 42 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a personal beauty products (Avon) dealership business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Janeth has been in this business for four years.

In the future Janeth would like to save enough money to provide financial stability for her family & to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 31 años, convive con Aquiles de 30 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Lucila, de 13 y Talía, de 7 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. La principal actividad económica del lugar es la agricultura. Por ello está laboriosa mujer se dedica a la siembra de papa, arveja y maíz; asimismo cría animales como toros, vacas, de los cuales saca una buena cantidad de leche para la elaboración de queso, los que vende en la ciudad de Huasahuasi, obteniendo buenas ganancias. Ya tiene más de 20 años dedicándose a la agricultura y ganadería; y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poner en práctica lo que sus padres le enseñaron. Además cuenta que es muy buena en la venta ya que después de cada cosecha los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de Huancayo, obteniendo buenas ganancias. Paralelo a su trabajo, se dedica a cocinar los alimentos del día, a los peones que trabajan en las chacras.  Ahora después de cosechar sus cultivos de papa, piensa sembrar alverja y papa de otra variedad; sin descuidar a sus animales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Pioneros de Cumutay” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde espera el apoyo de todos ustedes para lograr sus planes. Además se compromete en pagar de manera puntual sus cuotas. Luz de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja y varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para comenzar con éxito su próximo sembrío de papa de la variedad única.
texts.en:
Luz is 31 years old and lives with 30 year-old Aquiles.  The couple have two children: 13 year-old Lucila and 7 year-old Talía.  They live together as a family in their own home which is located in the small village of Cumutay.

The main business activity in this area is agriculture.  This hard-working woman grows potatoes, peas and corn.  She also raises animals such as bulls and cows which provide a good quantity of milk for making cheese which she sells in the town of Huasahuasi.  This makes her good profits.  Luz has worked in farming and livestock raising for more than 20 years and what she most enjoys about her work is putting into practice what her parents taught her.  She also tells us that she is good at sales as, after each harvest, she sells her crops in the wholesale market in Huancayo and makes good profits.  In parallel with this work, Luz also cooks the day's meals for the laborers who work on the farms.  After she has harvested her potato crops she is planning to sow peas and another variety of potato, without neglecting her animals.

Luz is a member of the "Pioneros de Cumutay" (Cumutay Pioneers) community bank and this is her fifth loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive the support of each and every one of you in helping her to achieve her goals.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments punctually.  With your support, Luz will invest the money she has requested in buying two bags of pea seeds and several sacks of natural fertilizers so that she can make a successful start to sowing her next crop of única-variety potatoes.

loans.use: to buy two bags of pea seeds and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Snooky

texts.en: Snooky is 40 years old and lives in Dapitan City. She is married with four children. To earn a living, Snooky has a business selling fish. She earns about PHP 3,500 each month doing this type of work. Snooky has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fresh fish to sell. Snooky has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Lusmila

texts.es: Lusmila tiene 36 años, convive con Ernesto, su esposo y fruto de esta relación tienen 3 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Lusmila a pesar de ser mujer,  se dedica en el negocio de venta de madera, actividad que lo realiza en compañía de su esposo. Pues en dicho trabajo encontró la estabilidad económica que buscaba, ahora puede cubrir los gastos estudiantiles de sus hijos. Por otro lado, también se dedica en la negociación y el traslado de la madera,mientras su esposo se encarga de sumnunistrarla,  que luego son repartidos por las carpinteria, quien le abastece a Lusmila de bloques de madera donde ella los reparte a las carpinterías del distrito de Pichari. En un futuro próximo Lusmila desea tener su propio local de expendio de bloques de madera en el distrito de Pichari para si de esta manera atender rápidamente a sus clientes. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete en realizar el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1500 soles que solicita, comprará una cadena para su moto aserradora.
texts.en:
Lusmila is 36 years old and lives with her husband Ernesto and the fruit of their relationship, 3 children.  Together they live in their own house located in Pichari district.

Despite being a woman, Lusmila, together with her husband, runs a business selling wood. She found the economic stability she was looking for in this work and is now able to cover her children’s educational expenses. Lusmila sees to the transactions and transport involving wood, while her husband is in charge of supplying it. The wood is delivered for processing into blocks which are then supplied to Lusmila who distributes them to the carpenters in Pichari district. In the near future Lusmila wants to have her own shop for the sale of blocks of wood in Pichari district in order to more quickly take care of her customers. 

This is her first loan with MFP, which she is committed to repaying on time.  With the 1,500 soles that she is requesting, she will buy a chain for her motorized saw.

loans.use: to buy a chain for her motorized saw.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 
Rodelyn has a retail shop that sells snacks, detergents, breads & biscuits. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages .
Rodelyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Rodelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Satkynbu's Group

texts.en:
Satkynbu is the treasurer of this group. She is 56 years old and divorced. She has raised a son who is 25 years old and works in Russia. Satkynbu works as a teacher. In two years she saved 7000 soms from her salary and with the money she started breeding livestock. By reselling livestock after fattening it, she earns an additional 1000 soms to meet her daily needs. Satkynbu applied for the loan because she needed additional financial resources for purchasing more livestock. She wants to spend some part of the funds from this loan on purchasing furniture to improve the family’s living conditions. In the future, she wants to build a shed with the profits gained from reselling livestock.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and home furniture

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a meat goat selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase goats for resale.

loans.name: Sonia Alexandra

texts.es:
Sonnia de 38 años, es una mujer trabajadora que decidió hace 15 años atrás tener un pequeño negocio de confección de ropa y así darse tiempo para pasar con su familia. Poco a poco fue mejorando sus ingresos hasta que decidió tener un ciber para darle un mejor futuro a su familia. 

En la actualidad tiene los dos trabajos donde dedica medio tiempo a la confección de ropa y el otro medio  tiempo al ciber ya que le ayuda su hermana.  Su horario de trabajo es desde las 08h00am hasta las 22h00pm.  

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con sus dos negocios por eso quiere mejorar sus ingresos con un préstamo para comprar computadoras y aumentar así la clientela que tiene. En el futuro quiere ampliar sus dos negocios.
texts.en:
Sonnia is 38 years old and she is a hardworking woman who decided to set up a small clothing production business 15 years ago to give herself time to spend with her family. She gradually improved her profits until she decided to set up an internet cafe, to provide her family with a better future. 

Currently she has both businesses. Half of her time she spends making clothing and the other half of her time she spends in the internet cafe, in which she gets help from her sister. Her work schedule is from 8am to 10pm.

She has many aspirations for her two businesses and she wants to improve her income through a loan. She will purchase computers and this will increase her clientele. In the future she wants to improve both businesses.

loans.use: to purchase computers.

loans.name: Maliumai

texts.en:
Maliumai is 37 years old and married with 6 children. She owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business.    

She needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve the business.

In 2009, Maliumai joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Tumbuh Kembang 8 Group

texts.en: Ferry has been selling clothes on credit since 2009. She is 35 years old and married with one child. She started to sell clothes door-to-door around her neighborhood but now her neighbors just come to her house to shop. The business is going well, and she can help her husband pay for their child's school fees. She has received more orders from her customers and needs the loan from VisionFund Indonesia to buy more clothes. This is her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia. Her hope is that one day she can have her own kiosk and sell a larger variety of clothes. Her hope for her child is that she can afford to send her child to school through university.

loans.use: to pay for more clothes to resell on credit

loans.name: Katherina Jaoska

texts.es: Katherine ha sido una joven que ha tenido que trabajar desde muy joven. Ella tiene 1 hijo bajo su cargo, pues tiene la responsabilidad de brindarle lo necesario. Ella se dedica a una pulpería y venta de mercadería en general a pesar de no ofrecer muchos productos compra ciertos que sus clientes le solicitan. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, pan, galletas, refrescos, papel higiénico, sopas, fósforos y golosinas.
texts.en: Katherine was a young woman who had to work very hard from an early age. She has 1 child under her care and is responsible for providing him/her with what is necessary. She has a grocery store and sells general merchandise. Inspite of not having a large inventory, she stocks certain products that she is sure her clients want. The reason for the loan is to buy dry grains, bread, biscuits, soft drinks, toilet paper. soups, matches, and sweets.

loans.use: to buy dry grains, bread, biscuits, soft drinks, toilet paper. soups, matches, and sweets.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Evangeline has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Evangeline has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Evangeline hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Khadidiatou

texts.fr: Madame Khadidiatou  vit au Sénégal. C’est une femme marié de 34 ans qui  exerce l’activité de femme de ménage. Parallèlement  elle pratique le commerce et la vente de tissus teintés, parfums, lait  de corps, etc. Elle capitalise une expérience de   plus de 10 ans dans son activité qu’elle a choisi sous l’influence de sa maman. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juillet 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000frs prévu pour  l’achat de tissus teintés qu’elle avait commandé et qui sont destinés a la vente. Son objectif est de développer son activité et accroitre ses bénéfices.
texts.en: Mrs. Khadidiatou lives in Sénégal. She is married, 34 years old and works as a housekeeper. At the same time, she manages a busines of selling dyed fabrics, perfumes and lotions. Following in her mother's footsteps, she has over 10 years of experience in the business. She has been a member of U-IMCEC since July 2011. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 cfa francs to pay for an order of dyed fabric which she intends to resell. Her goal is to grow her business and increase profits.

loans.use: to purchase one order of fabric for resale

loans.name: Nyanzi

texts.en:
Nyanzi is a poised 28-year-old married man who is a go-getter and highly ambitious. These attributes have won this father of three respect in his community in Kyenjojo in the West of Uganda.  

He says that his marital status has played a significant part in his focused outlook at what he sets out to do,

Nyanzi has been plying his barber shop business for close to two years now. Nyanzi also offers phone-charging services and in the evenings, he retires to go do some farming in the village. He reckons his income totals UGX 20,000.

He says he will use his Kiva loan to purchase barber shop equipment like shaving machines. He also plans on expanding his barber shop.

loans.use: to purchase barber shop equipment like shaving machines. He also plans on expanding his barber shop.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Celsa; ella tiene 47 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pollos y pescados en el mercado de Urubamba y también la socia vende de crianza de animales como cuyes, pollos y chanchos, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local para que pueda que vender los pollos y pescados. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos y pescados al por mayor y también para comprar comida para los animales.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Celsa, a member of “SAYHUA 3”, a communal bank located in the Urubamba district, in the Urubamba province and in the Cusco department.

Celsa is 47 years old, she lives with her life partner and she has 3 children. She alternates her daily chores with her retailing activity, selling chickens and fish in the Urubamba market; she also breeds and sells livestock such as “cuyes” (“cuy” is Quechua for Guinea pig), chickens and pigs. Thanks to this activity she can provide for her children. Her dream is to own a shop where to sell chickens and fish. She is requesting a loan to buy chickens and fish at wholesale price, as well as to buy animal feed for her animals.

She is happy about the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues.

loans.use: To buy chickens and fish and tobuy animal feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Arame

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée et mère de 9 enfants.Elle vit avec son mari et tous ses enfants dans la maison familiale.Elle tient une petite boutique de vente de produits alimentaire mais s'active surtout dans l'élevage de moutons.Elle achète des moutons de race qu'elle élève et revend au bout de dix à douze mois.Ces deux activités génèrent des revenus assez importants qui lui permettent de suppléer son mari dans la prise en charge de la plupart des dépenses familiales. Elle prend en particulier entièrement en charge les frais de scolarité des enfants, leurs dépenses sanitaires et d'habillement.Pour renforcer son activité d'élevage, elle sollicite auprès de UIMCEC un prêt de 500000f pour acheter dix moutons. Son ambition est d'élargir son activité.
texts.en: The borrower is a married woman and mother of 9 children. She lives with her husband and all her children in a family house.  She runs a small shop selling groceries but is mostly in the business of raising sheep.  She buys purebred sheep that she raises and resells after 10 to 12 months. These two businesses generate revenues large enough for her to supplement her husband in taking care of the majority of the family expenses.  Specifically, she takes care of all the children's school fees, medical expenses, and clothing.  To strengthen her sheep-raising business, she is asking UIMEC for a loan of 500000 francs to buy 10 sheep.  Her ambition is to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep.

loans.name: Journadel

texts.en:
Journadel is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 
Journadel has a retail shop that sells used clothing such as t-shirts and blouses. She has run this business for three years. She has requested a loan of  5,000 PHP to buy stocks of used clothing for resale.
Journadel is a new member of Kiva partner HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teófila, es comerciante de ropa, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 6 y 10 años de edad, ella tiene una experiencia en el negocio de 15 años, lo tiene en el mercado municipal, nació por su propia iniciativa.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de blusas, short, ropa interior, para surtir el negocio, esta inversión le ayudara a Teófila a mantener sus ventas y agradar a los clientes.
Su objetivo es fortalecer el negocio, para atraer a más personas, además de que tendrá la oportunidad de generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Teófila’s a clothes merchant.  She lives with her husband and two children who are 6 and 10 years old.  She has 15 years’ experience in business which is in the municipal market and arose from her own initiative.

She is requesting the loan to buy blouses, shorts and underwear to stock the business.  This investment will help Teófila keep up her sales and please customers.

Her objective is to strengthen the business to attract more people as well as will have an opportunity to earn greater profits.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shorts and underwear.

loans.name: Afe-Peb Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AFE-PEB est composé de deux personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée  Bernadette (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 55 ans n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Bernadette est mariée. Le couple a deux  enfants, dont un scolarisé et a leur charge. Bernadette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Bernadette vend des sacs de riz et des fruits de saison depuis vingt ans. Bernadette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Bernadette ensemble avec les membres du groupe AFE-PEB sollicite pour la sixième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs de riz et des fruits de saison.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
