Norma is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Norma is 48 years old and has two children are still in school.

Norma has a fishing business in the Philippines. Norma requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy new fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Norma has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business

loans.name: Naomi Nungari

texts.en:
This business is a member of the Virtuous Women Group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members must make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff

Naomi is a single mother with 5 children and 2 dependants. Naomi is an active member in the community. She is the Coordinator of the umoja road village. She is a leader of the Nambala Women group that has a project of grinding mill.

By joining the women groups in Ongata Rongai Naomi was able to attend short business skills courses. She has experience in different businesses from which she was able to raise capital buy a plot and developed it with rental houses due to high demand. She has 6 semi permanent houses and two are due for completion. She took a loan from WEEC of USD 139 in 2005 and laid the foundation of the two rooms.

loans.use: Given a loan of USD 300 she will be able to complete the two rooms and install electricity to make them more marketable.

loans.name: Yamina Antonia

texts.en:
Yamina is a very active and entrepreneurial woman. She is married with 3 children and lives in the city of Mérida, Yucatán. Her husband is a taxi driver and therefore has no fixed income. This situation has led to financial difficulties. For this reason, 17 years ago she decided to open a small grocery shop in her own home. At first her selection was small, but with time she continued to grow. Thanks to the business, she has been able to help her husband during hard times. Because of this she works hard every day.

At this time she is in need of a loan of $925 to acquire more merchandise for her clientele, thereby allowing her business to grow. Don’t hesitate any longer. She needs your help and sincerely appreciates your support.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Yamina es una mujer muy activa y emprendedora, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y viven en la localidad de Mérida, Yucatán. Su esposo es taxista por lo cual no tiene un ingreso fijo, esta situación ha generado dificultades económicas, es por ello que hace 17 años ella decidió abrir un atienda de abarrotes en su propio domicilio. En un comienzo no tenía mucho surtido, pero conforme fue pasando el tiempo fue creciendo. Gracias a esta actividad ha podido apoyar a sus esposo en lo momentos complicados, es por ello que trabaja arduamente cada día.

En este momento ella requiere de crédito de $ 925 DLLS para poder surtir más mercancía que ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera hacer crecer su negocio. No lo dudes más ella te necesita y agradece tu apoyo sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en: Shahnoza has been engaged in trade for 4 years. When she decided to start her own business, she borrowed $100 from her relatives. Shahnoza is a mother of 2 children. Although she has a University degree, the small salary at her previous job forced her to leave and start working at the market. At this point, her business has grown, and she has a much higher amount of turnover. Since she works at an open-air market, her main goal is to improve her working conditions. She would like to use the next loan to buy construction materials and repair the roof of her business site with the help of her husband.  She will probably spend about $300 for the repairs and the rest to buy goods.

loans.use: Improving working conditions.

loans.name: Gloria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Gloria is a widow of six years and to move herself and her five children forward she started her own business selling cheese and chorizo. Shortly after, one of her daughters fell ill with cancer and underwent costly treatment before, sadly, dying. Gloria has had to overcome great familial loses, but she still has four children, two of whom live with her along with two grandchildren. She wants to provide them nothing but the best, which is why she works so hard.

Gloria started buying her products through middlemen, but now she buys straight from their suppliers and gets a better discount. But she has to buy in larger quantities and currently she needs a loan of $925, which she plans to repay within six months, to cover the costs of stocking her business. Gloria and her family really need your support to help improve their quality of life. They are forever grateful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Gloria es viuda desde hace 6 años y para sacar adelante a sus cinco hijos empezó su propio negocio con la venta de quesos y chorizo, poco después una de sus hijas enfermó de cáncer y estuvo en tratamientos muy costos, pero lamentablemente falleció. Gloria ha tenido que superar grandes pérdidas familiares, pero aún tiene cuatro hijos, dos de ellos y sus dos nietos viven con ella y desea ofrecerles lo mejor, por lo que se esfuerza mucho en su trabajo.

Gloria empezó comprando sus productos con intermediarios, ahora lo hace directamente con sus proveedores, por lo que recibe un mayor beneficio, pero tiene que consumir cantidades mayores y para surtir su negocio ahora requiere de un préstamo de $ 925 dólares, mismos que devolverá en 6 meses. Esta familia necesita mucho de tu apoyo, ayúdalos a mejorar su calidad de vida, ellos te lo agradecerán por siempre.

loans.use: Purchase cheese and chorizo

loans.name: Naim

texts.ru:
Naim has been selling canned goods for 10 years. He is married with 2 children and has a secondary school education. Naim’s wife helps him in his business and his children study in school. He started his business by selling glass canning jars.

Naim became a client of MicroInvest in 2004. Back then his inventory was worth $350. Slowly after getting a loan he added canned goods to his product selection (juice, tomato paste, jam, etc.) and got a new business location. Today he has increased his inventory to $1200. He plans to use the new loan to open a store.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ахмедов Наим вот уже 10лет занимается продажей консервных изделий. Женат, имеет двоих детей. Жена помогает ему в торговле, дети учатся в школе. Образование у Наима среднее. Начал свою деятельность с продажи стеклянных банок для консервирования. Клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» стал в 2004году, тогда его товарооборот составлял 350$. Постепенно после получения займа он добавил в свой ассортимент консервные изделия (сок, томатная паста, варенье и т.д.), приобрел новое место деятельности. Сейчас он увеличил товарооборот до 1200$. На будущее планирует открыть магазин.

loans.use: to open a store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his milk sales business

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata learned bread making at the age of 20, and started a micro business soon after the training.  Married with 2 children, her husband is a tailor in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  She supplies bread to restaurants and also to retailers who are hawkers in the town.  With previous loans, she managed to purchase her ingredients wholesale and this increased her production and income.  Fatmata’s aim is to construct an adequate brick bakery outside the family house and increase her production.  She believes a loan of $375 will enable her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To construct a bakery where she can produce her own bread

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah L. is a farmer and a tailor. She is requesting a loan to purchase seed for her farm as well as cloth and thread for her tailor business. She looks after 4 children and wants to increase he profits to improve her standard of living.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To increase supplies

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en: K. Nazira lives in Nau, Tajikistan. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006. She considers herself an executive and reliable client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure. Mrs. K. Nazira is engaged in the distribution of wholesale food products. She has 5 years of experience in the business. She has a good business turnover. Now Mrs. K. Nazira requests a loan of $625 for importing tinned food.

loans.use: To import tinned food

loans.name: Magamaga West E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sarah N.. She is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to add to her business. Sarah is 35 years old and is married with a husband that sells fish for work. She has 3 children ranging from age 10 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 29000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and invest more capital in the business. Sarah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy more food and materials and the loan was paid back on time.

Sarah is joined in her small group by Jane T., Edith N., Hadija Nakaami, and Tappy N.. Jane T. has a business in charcoal selling and wants to expand to bulk selling. Edith N. is currently operating a business selling clothes and wants a loan to increase stock. Hadija Nakaami operates a business running a bakery and selling spare parts and wants to purchase more baking ingredients. Tappy N. is currently in the business of selling used clothes and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: To purchase more raw food and boost restaurant business

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
Señora Gladis Pérez Munayar is a member of the Picota communal bank. She lives in the region of San Martín in the province and district of Picota. She has a business where she sells food in the La Marginal market, which is located on the Fernando Belaunde Terry highway.

The need to give a better education to her children is what motivated her to start her business of preparing food. Thanks to her perserverance and desire to get ahead, she achieved what she had set out to do.

With this loan of 800 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of supplies to prepare the various dishes that she offers to her clientele.

She is 45-years-old, and her dream is to see her children become professionals. She also hopes to start selling chicken out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Señora Gladis Pérez Munayari, es socia del Banco Comunal “Picota”, vive en la Región San Martín , Provincia de Picota, distrito de Picota, su negocio de venta de comidas se encuentra ubicado en el mercado “La marginal” que esta ubicado en la carretera Fernando Belaunde Terry .

La necesidad de dar una mejor educación a sus hijos la impulsaron a iniciarse en el negocio de la preparación de comida, que luego gracias a su perseverancia y ganas de salir adelante logro lo que se propuso.

Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses lo invertirá en la compra de los insumos para la elaboración de los variados platos de comida que ha diario ofrece a su clientela.

Tiene 45 años, su sueño es hacer que sus hijos se conviertan en profesiones, y también desea instalar una pollería en su casa.

loans.use: With the loan, she will purchase supplies to prepare food

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana belongs to the “Mujeres Creativas 2” Communal Bank located in the Nueva América neighborhood at Mz 3 Lt. 11 in Manantay, a town in the Ucayali province of Peru. She is 23 years old and the mother of two children. Her husband is a carpenter.

With the first loan that Ana received from Manuela Ramos, she started a business selling detergent in bulk door to door. Using the money she maD. selling detergent, she has decided to invest in a business selling beauty products and, with the economic support of her husband, is now able to better help her children.

With this loan of $300, which she plans to repay in four months, Ana will buy detergent in bulk and beauty products including perfumes, lipsticks, talcum powders, fingernail polish, jewelry and eye shadows.

Ana is happy and very content with the support she receives from Manuela Ramos. She says that it is a great help to Peruvian women who want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ana pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas 2, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano. Nueva América Mz 3 Lt. 11, del Distrito D. Manantay del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 23 años es madre D. 2 hijos, su esposo es maderero. Ana con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta domiciliaria D. detergente a granel. En la actualidad con las ganancias obtenidas del la venta del detergente decidió invertir en la venta D. productos D. belleza, con el apoyo económico que le brinda su esposo esta logrando sacar adelante a sus hijos. Con este préstamo D. S/. 800.00, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará detergente a granel, productos D. belleza como perfumes, labiales, talcos, esmaltes, joyas, sombras, etc. Ana esta feliz y muy contenta por el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos, dice que es una gran ayuda para las mujeres peruanas que quieren salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products and detergent to sell

loans.name: Rosa Alvina

texts.es:
Rosa belongs to the Communal Bank Mujeres Talentosas, located at Jr. Piura 189, in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 68 years old and has 7 children. Her husband is retired. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos for 300 soles, Rosa invested in a small business selling juices. Very early every morning Rosa is ready to sell delicious juices prepared from local fruit. She has a large customer base because of the good service she provides and they are always satisfied. With help from her children she is making a better life for her family. With this new loan, which will be repaid within 4 months, she will purchase additional local fruit such as papaya, oranges, mandarines, bananas, milk, eggs, carob, etc. Rosa is very happy because she has become independent and is managing her own business and income.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en el Jr. Piura 189, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 68 años, es madre D. 7 hijos, su esposo es jubilado, es así que Rosa con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña venta D. jugos. En la actualidad todas las mañanas muy temprano esta lista para vender los ricos jugos preparados a base D. frutas regionales, cuenta con mucha clientela por el muy buen trato que da a sus clientes y siempre les da aumento y quedan muy satisfechos, con la ayuda D. sus hijos salen adelante por el bien D. la familia. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará frutas regionales, como: papaya, naranja, mandarina, plátanos, leche, huevos, algarrobita, veterraga, etc. Rosa se siente muy feliz por que se ha independizado y administra su propio negocio e ingresos.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies to make juices

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad, 36 years old, lives in Saida, a city south of Beirut. Ahmad sells fruits and vegetables in the city streets and works from home repairing old furniture. Since he is now well-known in the area for furniture repair and has a good base of clients, he is requesting a loan of $1,000 to open a furniture repair shop.  Ahmad believes that opening the shop will increase his income. This will be his second loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To open a furniture repair shop.

loans.name: Protected

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 40 years old. She is married and has 3 children. One of them is studying at university. Her old and sick mother lives with them in a rented house. The entrepreneur has a small shop selling children's clothes, and she applied to borrow $1200 to purchase new clothes and goods for the shop, paint the shop, and make some advertising in order to increase her income and save for a better life for her family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new clothes and goods

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is 30 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 14, 10 and 4. She has been a charcoal seller since 2002. Every day, she works from 7am to 6:50pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Khadija now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for re-sale

loans.name: Ollita De Barro Group

texts.es: Hace mas de cuatro años 14 personas  conforman la asociación “Ollita de Barro” que trabajan en el centro focal de Germán Buch que pertenece a Pro-Mujer, convencidas de que pueden mejorar su calidad de vida, trabajan con mucho empeño para alcanzar sus sueños. Una de las actividades mas comunes dentro la asociación es la venta de fruta, para esto realizan viajes a Alto Beni y caranavi (localidades de La Paz) donde adquieren variedad de fruta de acuerdo a la temporada, Necesitan créditos para comprar frutas en mayores cantidades, de esta manera poder generar  mayores ingresos que les permita  fortalecer sus negocios y ofrecer bienestar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
For more than four years 14 people have made up the group “Ollita de Barro.” They work in the focal center German Buch which belongs to Pro-Mujer. They are convinced that they can improve their quality of life and work with much effort to reach their dreams. One of the most common business in this group is the sale of fruit for which they travel to Alto Beni and Caranavi (locations in La Paz) where they acquire a variety of seasonal fruit. They need this loan to purchase fruit in larger quantities in order to generate greater income that will allow them to strengthen their businesses and provide for the wellbeing of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruit in greater quantities.

loans.name: Me

texts.en: Mrs. Me S. is a farmer in Srey Chey Village in Takeo Province and her husband, Mr. Tieng Sorn, is a palm juice collector who gathers palm juice to process into palm sugar or wine. Although Mrs. Me S. and her husband have different businesses, they still cannot afford to buy timber in order to build a new house for their household. Thus, Mrs. Me S. decided to ask for a loan. Mrs. Me S. is 43 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the other two are attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: Me would like to buy timber in order to build a new house for their household.

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es: Adilia tiene 28 años de edad, vive junto a su pareja que es mecánico y sus 2 hijos que estudian y son sus motivos de seguir adelante. Se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches (salchipapas: papas fritas con salchichas), este trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace 4 años atrás. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es preparar bien su comida para que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos de su buena sazón y también le gusta entablar conversación con todos. Este negocio le es muy rentable, ya que es una cosa fácil de hacer y sobre todo es bien practico. Le va bien en este trabajo por lo que no muestra dificultad alguna.  Este es el primer préstamo que solicita con MFP. Con el dinero mandar a construir una ramada (techo a base de ramas que cubre un espacio exterior determinado) y así vender tranquilamente, ya que actualmente vende dentro de su casa.
texts.en:
Adilia is 28 years old and lives with her partner, a mechanic, and her two children who are in school and are her motivation to forge ahead. She dedicates herself to selling food at night (salchipapas: french fries with sausage), work which she has been doing for four years now. What she likes about her job is making good food so that her customers enjoy her cooking, and also spending time chatting with them while they eat. This business is very profitable, since the food is easy to prepare and – most of all -- very practical. She is doing well in this endeavor as it doesn’t present any difficulties for her. This is the first loan she requests with MFP. With the funds, she will order a ramada (a roof made out of branches that covers a specified outdoor space) built so she can conduct her sales peacefully since she currently transacts her business from within her home.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Outfit a space outside of her home where she can conduct her food sales.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia I. is 52 years old and married with 5 children. She and her family live in Benin city, Edo state, Nigeria. She sells provisions, drinks and plastics from her house. She hopes to expand her business by stocking her shop with all that her customers need. Patricia needs the loan amount of $350 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more  foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 51 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos que ya son independientes, y vive junto a su esposo quien la ayuda mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de habas tostadas, maní salado y dulce, y palomitas, esta labor la viene realizando desde hace 4 años, y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se mantiene activa, además, conoce a muchas personas que degustan de sus productos y se convierten en sus clientes. Este negocio le da buenas ganancias para poder solventar los gastos en su hogar, y hasta el momento le está yendo bien. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito con MFP, por lo que se ha comprometido a ser puntual en sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a construir un kiosco rodante para vender con mayor comodidad, sin preocupación por las lluvias.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 51-year-old mother of 5 independent children, and she lives with her husband who helps her a lot. As a traveling salesperson, she sells toasted beans, sweet and salted peanuts, and popcorn. She began her business 4 years ago, and likes that it keeps her active and that she has gotten to know many people who enjoy her products and have become customers. This business gives her a good profit that she uses to pay household expenses, and up to now it has been doing well. This is the first time she has requested a loan with MFP, and she is committed to being punctual in making the payments. With the funds requested, she will have a rolling cart built to be able to sell with greater efficiency, including during the rainy season.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a rolling kiosk for her business

loans.name: Khoem

texts.en: Khoem N., 52, is a widow and has a business purchasing and re-selling rice in the village. On average, she makes  approximately US$ 20 in revenue per day and is aided in supporting the family by one of her daughters who works as a garment factory worker. To make more money, she is requesting a loan to purchase more rice for re-sale.

loans.use: To purchase more rice for re-sale

loans.name: Soeung

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeung C. was born in 1963 and is the good mother of four children.Three of her children are single and the other one is married. One single child is employed as a garment worker in Phnom Penh City. Mrs. C. is a rice farmer and her husband is a domestic building worker. They live in Pursat Province, Cambodia. 

To reduce the cost of transportation for the family’s daily transports, the couple is applying for a $600 loan to purchase a motorcycle and will be used by them to ride to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose A. is a 40-year-old mother of 5 children who sells dry maize in Kissumu. She is looking for a loan to improve her business by diversifying the products she sells. She would like people to know she is concerned mainly with her family and she wishes people could see how she lives.

loans.use: diversifying the products she sells

loans.name: Saren

texts.en: Mrs. Saren N. is 40 years old and she lives in Chi Chrab village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Pet Nat, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. This couple has five children, two of whom are employed while the others are attending the local school. Mrs. Saren N. needs a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her child to drive to work. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her child to drive to work.

loans.name: Yolda

texts.es:
Yolda es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras.
Yolda es casada, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Yolda tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende agroquímicos, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hermana, durante todos los días.
Yolda necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de productos veterinarios.
Los sueños de Yolda son ampliar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yolda is a member of the Alondras (The Larks) Communal Bank. She is 27 years old, married and has two children. Yolda has a store in some rented space where she sells agricultural chemicals. She does this every day, with the help of her sister. Yolda needs a loan of 1,200 Sols which will be invested in the purchase of veterinary products. She dreams of being able to build up her business and providing a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy veterinary products.

loans.name: Bibian

texts.en: Bibian O. is 42 years old and married with 3 children. She sells motorcycle spare parts. She is requesting a loan for the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Angèle

texts.fr:
D. Angèle est née le 15 juillet 1972 à Ekpè, dans le Département de l'Ouéme. Angèle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Angèle vend des condiments de sauce devant son domicile au quartier Agblangandan à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Angèle achète ses provisions de sauce qu’elle revient revendre en face de sa maison. Angèle a déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits de la part de ALIDé pour développer son activité. Aujourd’hui encore, Angèle sollicite auprès de ALIDé un cinquième crédit pour mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
D. Angèle was born July 15, 1972 in Ekpè, in Ouéme County. Angèle is married and the mother of 3 children. She sells condiments for stew in front of her home in the Agblangandan neighborhood in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Angèle buys her stock of condiments in Dantokpa, the big international market of Benin and re-sells them opposite her home. Angèle has already had four loans from ALIDé to develop her business. Today, Angèle is requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé so as to better satisfy her clientele.

The significance of ALIDé in the local language of Bénin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor." Bénin is a small country in West Africa next door to Nigeria. Its per capita annual income stands at US$ 1,500.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 4 baskets of fresh tomatoes, 2 sacks of hot peppers, and 3 sacks of onions

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
Analisa T. is from the town of Aloran in Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 38 years old. Analisa is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Analisa owns and operates a business installing glass for local community members. Analisa has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Analisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analisa has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Analisa is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP that she will use to purchase materials that she needs for her business. This will be Analisa's sixth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine B. is from Oroquieta City. She is 56 years old. Josephine is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a carenderia (restaurant) where she serves local foods to customers in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Josephine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Josephine from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Devina

texts.en:
Devina E. is from the town of San Simon, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 46 years old. Devina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Devina operates a family member's business venture. She has firewood to sell to her local community. Devina has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Devina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Devina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. Devina is requesting a new loan, which will be used to purchase additional firewood to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Devina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of her family and support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood to sell

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca sells drinks, foodstuffs and frozen food and she has been in the business for the past ten years. She lives in Lagos. Rebecca is 35 years old and married with three children.

Rebecca is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more drinks, foodstuffs and frozen food to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Veronica Magalis

texts.es: La joven Verónica de 25 años de edad, ha sido esforzada para salir adelante en su vida desde joven inicio dando clase  de primaria en el colegio,  tiene seis años de trabajar, casada pero aun no tiene hijos, su esposo trabaja como cajero, residen en el barrio 22 de enero en la capital de Managua, sus planes es poder mejorar la infraestructura de su casa es por eso comprara cerámica, arena cemento para repellar su casa. Este es su segundo ciclo en  Afodenic y logrado hacer las mejoras. Sus planes es poder seguir estudiando y logra la carrera de Biología ya que tiene tercer año para poder ganar mejor. Da las gracias ala institución por lograr hacer realidad sus metas.
texts.en:
Verónica is 25 years old, married, and does not have children. Her husband works as a cashier and they live in the January 22 neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. This young woman has been struggling to get ahead in life. She has been working for six years and has also started taking college classes.

Verónica is about to undertake some projects to improve the infrastructure of her house. She will buy ceramic tiles, cement, and sand to repair her home. She is requesting her second loan from AFODENIC in order to make these improvements. Her plan is to continue studying and pursue a career in biology. She still has three years left before she earns her degree. She thanks the Institution for helping her realize her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sand, cement, and ceramic tiles

loans.name: Jobir

texts.en: T. Jobir is 35 years old and the father of four children who are attending the local school. His wife is a housekeeper. Jobir owns a field for cultivating vegetables in order to earn a living. On this plantation, he now cannot do any planting because he does not have enough money for seeds and fertilizer. In order to deal with this problem, he decided to ask for a loan of 2,500 Somoni to buy necessary supplies. He counts on this opportunity to obtain a better yield, in order to improve the living conditions of his family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca es una amable mujer de 38 años de edad, vive con su esposo José, quien es chofer y sus hijos Aurora de 11 años y Jhon de 7 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas y salchipapas (papas con salchichas fritas) en la puerta de su casa, esta actividad la viene realizando hace un año, cuando por iniciativa propia decidió ser independiente al sueldo de su esposo, colaborar con los gastos del hogar y poder brindarle a su familia un ingreso extra y mayores posibilidades de salir adelante. A Blanca le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que siempre tuvo un don para la cocina siendo este oficio más que un trabajo un pasatiempo. Aunque no todo es fácil, ya que muchas veces la demanda de sus platillos es muy buena y no se da abasto sola para poder cubrir los gastos para prepararla. En el futuro desea tener cafetería en un ambiente de su casa y más adelante, un restaurante.
Este es su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, asimismo se compromete a ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Blanca solicita 1000 soles para comprar mayor cantidad de insumos y productos para preparar sus ricos platillos, así como acondicionar un ambiente dentro de su casa para instalar pronto su cafetería.
texts.en:
Blanca is a friendly woman who is 38 years old. She lives with her husband José, who is a chauffeur, and her children Aurora (age 11) and Jhon (age 7). She sells hamburgers and salchipapas (fried potatoes with sausages) outside the door of her house. Blanca started her business a year ago when she took the initiative and decided to earn her own income that was separate from her husband’s. Now they both contribute to the household expenses and she is able to provide her family with extra income and better possibilities of getting ahead.

Blanca enjoys what she does because she has always had a gift for cooking and her work feels more like a hobby instead of a job. Everything has not been easy. There have been many times when demand for her dishes has been very good, but she ran out of supplies because she did not have the funds available to prepare more food. In the future, she hopes to open a cafeteria in her home, and later a restaurant.

This is Blanca’s second loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She promises to make her payments on time. Blanca is requesting 1000 soles to buy large quantities of supplies and products for preparing her rich dishes, as well as remodel the outside of her house so that she can open a cafeteria.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing fast food

loans.name: Pon

texts.en: Pon C., 40, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She sells clothes at the local market to earn a living and is able to make about US$6 per day. Her husband is a farmer who typically makes US$4 each day. He also raises pigs and chickens. This couple is also supported by two of the children who are garment worker and one other sell CDs and VCDs from home. Pon C. is asking for a loan of US$1000 she needs to expand her clothes’ inventory.

loans.use: To expand her clothes’ inventory.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry A. is from the village of Catibac, Catarman, Camiguin Province. He is 42 years old and is single. Henry owns and operates a business providing transport services to local community members using his motor vehicle. He has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Henry joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mr. Pov C., 59, and his wife, Mrs. Eng Rous, 55, were married in 1972. The couple lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.  

Pov has been selling cows since 1982. He buys them from other districts far away from his home to resell in his village. He has asked for a loan one time already. He is now requesting his second loan of $700 to continue expanding his cow-selling business.

loans.use: To continue expanding his  cow-selling business.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel R. is from the village of Sugbongcogon, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. Raquel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Raquel owns and operates a business selling dried fish products and ready-to-wear items in the local community. Raquel has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $100 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Raquel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Raquel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ismaeel

texts.en: Ismaeel is 31 years old. He is married and has three children to whom he wishes to give the best. He is very dynamic and cares deeply for his family. He has a small business where he sells different kinds of accessories for girls and women in the streets of the city of Gaza in Palestine. Today Ismaeel requesting a loan to buy more accessories to sell. He appreciates your kindness and generosity.

loans.use: Buy more accessories to sell

loans.name: Mujeres  Anfitrionas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Anfitrionas  nace hace poco más de 2 años, gracias  a la ayuda de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en la zona. A la fecha, han superado exitosamente diversas dificultades y han sido solidarias con compañeras que lo necesitaron en su momento.
En promedio reciben cada una  696000 G, el cual será invertido en la compra de artículos que serán vendidos en sus respectivas actividades comerciales.
Todas son mujeres muy luchadoras y se dedican con mucho esfuerzo a cumplir con sus familias en todos los aspectos. Cada una se dedica a una actividad independiente como sigue:

They have been supportive of members in need. On average, they will receive 696000G which will be invested in inventory for their respective commercial activities.

They are all hardworking woman who use all their efforts to provide for their families. Each is dedicated to an independent activity, as shown below:

Healing herbs and teas sales

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Francisca Evelia

texts.es:
La microempresaria: Francisca Evelia Rodríguez tiene 48 años de edad, es casada con 3 hijos todos mayores de edad, esta microempresaria quien es profesora y también se dedica a vender joyas de plata desde hace un poco mas de dos años. Este negocio le permite tener algunos ingresos para los gastos del hogar.

La microempresaria Rodríguez tiene como principales clientes a mujeres amas de casa y que trabajan en instituciones del estado y privadas a quienes les oferta sus productos con facilidades de pago en varias cuotas. Este negocio es rentable, sin embargo se tiene que contar con un buen capital para poder comprar mayor volúmenes de los productos y recuperarlos en tres o cuatro meses.

Por tal razón la señora Rodríguez requiere se le financie para comprar las siguientes prendas de plata:

10 Unidades de anillo ojos de tigre le cuesta US  8 cada unidad, 10 unidades de anillos de piedra Onix el cual compra a US  8 cada unidad, 8 pares de aretes circulares grandes a US 13 cada par, 6 unidades de brazaletes decorados los que compra a US 6 cada unidad, 9 unidades de pulseras de animalitos a US 10 cada unidad, 8 unidades de pulseras de corazón a US 9 cada unidad, 8 unidades de cadenas de pelota a US 14 cada unidad, 8 juegos de gargantillas y aretes a US 15 cada juego y 8 unidades de pulseras de pie a US 7 cada unidad.
texts.en:
Francisca Evelia Rodríguez, 48, is married and has 3 adult children. She is a teacher but she has also sold silver jewelry for a little over two years now. This side business produces extra income for household expenses. Her main customers are housewives that work in State or private industry ofices to whom she offers her wares on easy installment payment plans. This is a profitable business but she must have reliable capital available in order to buy her products in quantity so that she can recouperate her costs in 3 or 4 months. For this reason she requires funding to buy the following silver jewelry items: 10 tiger-eye rings at US 8 dollars each, 10 onyx rings at US 8 dollars each, 8 pairs of large, circular earrings at US 13 dollars each, 6 decorated bracelets at US 6 dollars each, 9 animal charm bracelets at US 10 dollars each, 8 heart bracelets at US 9 dollars each, 8 ball chains at US 14 dollars each, 8 sets of necklace and earrings at US 15 dollars a set, and 8 anklets at US 7 dollars each.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted silver jewelry.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 32 años, vive feliz al lado de su esposo Jhon (32) y sus dos traviesos hijos; Yesenia (11) y Rubén (4), juntos habitan en su acogedora casa propia.

Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, ofrece su mercadería a sus vecinos y amistades, quienes le hacen pedidos de acuerdo a la temporada. La ventaja de su negocio es que comercializa la ropa a concesión, es decir que sus clientes se comprometen a pagarle después de un tiempo. 
A Rosa le gusta su trabajo porque obtiene considerables ganancias, que le permiten ayudar en los gastos de su casa, pero lo difícil es que a veces sus clientes se atrasan en los pagos y esto le retrasa la compra de nuevas prendas. 
Sin embargo, como es una mujer emprendedora tiene muchos planes para el futuro, entre ellos tener una tienda de ropa en un lugar fijo y con el tiempo llegar a aperturar una boutique.

Esta es la 7ma vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y asegura será responsable en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, como lo viene haciendo hasta ahora. Con el dinero que ahora solicita tiene pensado comprar mayor cantidad de ropa para ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa, 32, lives happily with her husband Jhon (32), and their 2 playful children: Yesenia (11), and Ruben (4). They live in their own cozy home. For 4 years she has sold clothing; she offers her merchandise to her neighbors and friends who make orders according to the season. The advantage of her business is that she sells clothing on consignment, which is to say that her customers promise to pay after some time. Rosa likes her work because she gets considerable earnings that allow her to help with the household expenses, but the difficulty is that at times her customers fall behind in their payments and this delays her ability to buy new garments. However, as she is an enterprising woman she has many plans for the future; among these is to have a store in a fixed location and eventually to open a boutique. This is her 7th loan from MFP, and she assures us that she will be responsible in making each one of her payments, as she has been doing up to now. With the money that she now requests she will buy a large quantity of clothing so that she can offer variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise (buy clothing)

loans.name: Olailong B Arach Dorine Group

texts.en:
A. Dorine is the group representative of five members in her group. She is thirty-seven years old, married, and blessed with three children all going to school. More so, she looks after two dependents, both schooling, too.

Dorine has operated a local brew business so far for ten years. Although the business seem to be seasonal in most cases, she is using the loan to improve her business by stocking much millet and sorghum for making local brew. This is helping her to improve on her standard of living.

loans.use: To improve her business by stocking much millet and sorghum for making local brew

loans.name: Jesus Te Ama Group

texts.es:
El centro focal de German Busch es un centro focal que ha sido creado hace siete años en la zona de Huayna Potosi – ciudad de El Alto.  La asociación comunal “Jesus Te Ama” ya tiene  12 ciclos (6 años) en el centro focal, está compuesto por 9 participantes adultos: 8 mujeres y 1 varón, además trabaja en forma paralela  a un grupo de 4 jòvenes: 2 mujeres y 2 varones .

La asociación  tienen diferentes negocios como zapatería, costura de polleras pequeñas, venta de juguetes, venta de repuesto para auto, costura de pollera, venta de verdura, venta de manta de vicuña, ferretería y en algunos casos comercio en general.

En el caso de la señora Rosario A., de 28 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de juguetes  “americanos”, desarrolla esta actividad desde hace un año y medio gracias a la invitación de una amiga.
Las ventas son realizadas en la zona 16 de Julio, en su Feria de los días Jueves y Domingo, por las mañanas.  Está casada y tiene 3 hijos (2 mujeres y 1 varón).  Lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer son los cambios que incluyen el préstamo interno, rapidez en el desembolso de los créditos.
texts.en:
The central office of German Busch was created seven years ago in the Huayna Potosi zone, in the city of El Alto. The communal association, "Jesus Te Ama," has already had 12 loan cycles (6 years) in this central office. This group is composed of 9 participating adults: 8 women and 1 man, who work alongside a group of 4 young people: 2 girls and 2 boys. The association has different businesses, such as a shoe store, a skirt sewing shop, a hardware store, the sale of toys, auto parts, vegetables, blankets made with vicugna fur, and other general products. In the case of Mrs. Rosario A., of 28 years old, her business is the sale of American toys. She has been developing this business since a year and a half ago thanks to a the invitation of a friend. Her sales are done at the Zona 16 de julio Fair on Thursdays and Sundays, in the morning. She is married and has 3 children (2 girls and 1 boy). What she likes most about Pro Mujer are the changes that the internal loans have and the credits' rapid expenditure.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: American toys

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
La Señora Maria Antonia P. M. tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, el crédito lo solicito para rellenar su venta de productos que más rotación tienen, es madre de cinco hijos todos en edad escolar cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que tiene su taller de hojalatería sus hijos en tiempos libres le ayudan a ella en la venta abren la pulpería desde las seis y media de la mañana hasta las once de la noche.
Tiene 24 años de tener su negocio que lo inicio con un capital de c$3,000.00 que fueron aporte de su esposo anteriormente ella era ama de casa  pero con el tiempo el esposo y ella decidieron poner su venta para que ambos lucharan para salir adelante para sacar adelante a sus hijos tiene cinco años de trabajar con ceprodel y sus financiamientos le han servido de mucho porque al suave le ha metido a su casa con las ganancias que le he sacado a los créditos y por que es mujer luchadora que no pierde las esperanzas de terminar de construir su casita
texts.en:
Maria Antonia P. M. has a mini-market in her house. The loan she is requesting is to replenish the products she sells the most. She has five children; all of them are school age. She counts on her husband’s help. He has a sheet metal shop. Her children help her sell during their free time. The store is open from six-thirty in the morning until eleven at night. She has had this business for 24 years. She started with c$3,000.00 from her husband. Previously she was a housewife. In time she and her husband decided to set up her sales business so that they could both strive to get their children ahead. She has worked with Ceprodel for five years. The loans have been very useful because she was able to get earnings, which she gradually put into her house. She is a tenacious woman who does not lose the hope of completing construction on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products like dairy products, general goods, basic grains, and Diana products

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina, 60, is the mother of eight children. She supports her children by selling crab traps in her community. She started this business back in 1975. This is the only way she can support her family. She sought help from Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in order to have additional capital for her business. She has asked for a loan of 6,000 Php. This will be useful to improve her business and the low interest rate will be less of a burden to pay.

loans.use: To provide additional capital.

loans.name: Florita Recolito Group

texts.en: Florita R.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. She is 58 years old, married and has three grown-up children. She is from the village of Buenavista, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Florita has been in her business for over 40 years and earns approximately 3,200 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2006, Florita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Florita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Florita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her sixth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to save as a reserve for future emergencies. Florita is the leader of a two member group accessing a loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Kagongi Bakyara Twimukye, Ntungamo Group

texts.en:
They say that hard work pays, and a very determined M. Mable has gained from the fruits of her hard work. Having started up her hotel (restaurant), bar and lodging enterprise six years ago in Rubaare, a common stopover for long-route drivers from Rwanda, Mable has no regrets.

Due to Mable’s good management and esteemed customer care, her business has maintained customers for a long time, thus creating the hotel a good market. With this loan, she wants to put in place a pool table, as it is a favorite game for many, and also make repairs to broken beds in the lodge. This will enable her to earn more profit and be able to cater for her four fatherless children’s requirements.

loans.use: To purchase a pool table and repair broken beds

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Cet homme est un entrepreneur de 31 ans, célibataire, est très dynamique. Il est électricien de formation. Cependant, pour diversifier ses sources de revenus, il fait le commerce de téléphones portables.
Il a démarré cette activité depuis 2005. Il dispose d’une boutique à Agbalépédogan(Lomé) où il expose ses derniers arrivages à la clientèle. Le crédit actuellement sollicité servira à approvisionner sa boutique de nouveaux téléphones portables.
Il espère avec ce crédit, accroître sa part de marché et jouir d’un mieux être financier et social.
texts.en:
This man is a 31-year old entrepreneur who is single and very dynamic. He is an electrician by profession. However, in order to diversify his income sources, he sells mobile telephones. He began this activity in 2005. He has a shop in Agbalépédogan (Lomé) where he displays his latest arrivals to his customers. The loan he is currently requesting will be used to stock up his shop with new mobile telephones. He hopes that with this loan he will be able to increase his market share and enjoy a better financial and social well-being.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mobile telephones

loans.name: Teodora Mercedes

texts.es:
Teodora de 46 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Tiene dos hijos  que estudian en escuelas fiscales. 

Para poder mantener a su familia ella empezó a vender víveres en un pequeño local que construyo en su casa. Poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación alcanzo a tener una tienda surtida. Vende enlatados, aceite, arroz y otros víveres de primera necesidad. Para tener mas variedad en su negocio quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, azúcar y aceites para su tienda. 

En el futuro quiere incrementa su capital de trabajo para construir mejor su casa y tener otra tienda.
texts.en:
Teodora is 46 years old and lives in the Primavera area of Duran (what is now an urban area was originally wild, with numerous hills, streams, and lakes; these are still present but the feeling of being in a natural environment is slowly dissolving). She has two children who attend public school. To take care of her family, Teodora began to sell groceries from a small shop in her home. With effort and dedication, she was able to little by little expand her business, and she now has a fully-stocked store. She sells canned goods, oil, rice, and other staple items. She would like to be able to offer more products, so she is requesting a loan to purchase rice, sugar, and oil for her shop. In the future, she would like to increase her working capital to make improvements to her home and to start another shop.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Abelia Concepción

texts.es: Abelia Concepción M. D. R. D. 52 años D. edad, es una madre D. familia muy trabajadora y entregada a su familia, la cual se gana la vida vendiendo diferentes tipos D. fruta, es gracias a este negocio como ella ha logrado darles todo lo necesario a sus tres hijos, dos D. 14 años D. edad, los cuales son gemelos y uno D. 13 años D. edad, los cuales dependen por completo D. Abelia, junto a ellos resiD. en Tonacatequepe, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador, lugar en el cual ha vivido durante 10 años. Abelia se dedica cada día a pelar, lavar y colocar la fruta en pequeñas bolsitas, muchas D. estas frutas son preparadas con limón, chile y sal, y debido a que coloca su venta en calle principal, cuenta con varios clientes, ya sean vecinos, personas que se encuentran D. paso o niños y jóvenes estudiantes D. una escuela que sen encuentra en el lugar. Abelia solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en su negocio, comprando más fruta, así mismo para poder comprar un pequeño terreno en Izalco ubicado en el departamento D. Sonsonate lugar D. nacimiento D. Abelia, esto lo hace con el deseo D. contar con un hogar propio y D. esta forma brindarle un techo seguro a sus tres hijos en el cual puedan sentirse seguros y confiados.
texts.en:
52-year old Abelia Concepción M. D. R. is a hardworking, devoted mother. She earns her living by selling fruit, and it is due to this business that she has managed to proviD. all the necessities for her three children. She has 14-year old twins and a 13-year old son, all of whom are completely dependent on her. Abelia and her family live in Tonacatequepe in the department of San Salvador. She has lived there for ten years. Every day she peels, washes, and places the fruit in little bags. Much of the fruit is seasoned with lemon, chile, and salt. Her stall is on the main street. Abelia’s customers might be neighbours, passers-by, children, or students from the nearby school. She is asking for money to invest in her business: she plans to buy more fruit. She also wants to buy a small piece of land in Izalco in the department of Sonsonate where she was born. Her wish is to build a house of her own there and proviD. a good home for her three children, a place where they can feel safe and self-confident.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fruit and some land

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of eight people living in Thnong RoleU. village, Takeo Province, led by 45-year-old Mrs Sinat S., selected by the group's members as the village bank president. Each member will use their portion of the loan for a variety of purposes.

Mrs. Sinat S. is a farmer and second-hand clothing seller in the local market, able to earn a small income to support her family living. She will use the loan to bU. more second-hand clothes and a sewing machine for the business. Her husband, Mr. SoU. Nheb, is a construction worker whose small salary also helps to support his family. This couple has two children, one a construction worker and the other a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes and a sewing machine

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is a 32-year-old man. He is married and the father of four kids. Kassem pays attention to his future and the future of his family members so that he will walk in the world and prove himself a good human being. 

Kassem has been an expert at sticking tiles for 15 years, working as a freelancer since 1998. Kassem operates his business to bear the education expenses of his kids so that they get a quality education without any hurdles and financial problems.
 
Kassem has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua to start a new business, dealing with plastic greenhouses. In addition to necessary plants, he needs to extend an irrigation network. This is his first time requesting a loan and he hopes it’s going to be positive for his family's way of living.

loans.use: To start a new business, dealing with plastic greenhouses

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes E. is married and has a child. Her husband is a driver. She has no educational background.

Agnes is a baker and also sells biscuits. She fries doughnuts and bakes other pastries at Takoradi. She adds her income to that of her husband to take care of the family.

Agnes will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to bake bread for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to buy a bigger oven.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to bake bread for sale

loans.name: Tito Richar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el  Sr. Richar; el tiene 43 años de edad y es casado, tiene 3 hijos, el socio se dedica a la administración de la empresa pollo rico; El socio es empleado administrativo y se encarga de administrar dicho negocio, el alterna su trabajo con su propio negocio familiar, el tiene una tienda de velas junto a su esposa y sus hijos, el necesita el préstamo para invertir exclusivamente en el negocio de las velas.  El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para las velas.     
    
El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “United for Success” this bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco. The member is Mr. Richar he is 43 years old, married and has 3 children. He works managing the Pollo Rico company, Mr. Richar is an administrative employee and he administers the business while simultaneously working on his family’s business. He has a store where he sells candles with his wife and children. Mr. Richar needs the loan to invest exclusively on his candle business. The member needs the loan to invest in materials to make the candles. The member is grateful and values the loan given to him through this medium and is equally committed to meet with the payment of his quotas in the time period established.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member needs the loan to buy materials to make the candles.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Since 1995, farming, hog raising and fish farming have been Nenita G.’ sources of income in Sto. Niño. A 59-year-old mother of four grown children, Nenita never considers her age to be a hindrance to dreaming of a bigger business. Having applied for a loan of Php17,000 from CEVI, she plans to expand her business and buy farming necessities and more piglets to raise. The additional income will go to her family's daily consumption and savings for her future needs.

loans.use: To buy farming necessities and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. She has been farming for the last 5 years and employs three farmhands. Her mixed farm produces maize, beans and milk which are sold locally. She also earns income from her lumbering business in the same location.

Consolata is 39 years old. She is married with 6 school-aged children. All the children attend school.

She successfully repaid her previous loan of 45,000KES from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 70,000KES to purchase a dairy cow. She says that this loan will help her purchase a quality dairy cow that will increase her milk production and earn her more income. The extra income from this loan will go towards the education of her children. She plans to expand her dairy farming in the future by acquiring at least 4 dairy cows. She also plans to expand her cereals business and build a large cereal store in future. Her primary challenges are lack of enough finance to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and animal feed and poor road infrastructure in the area.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Alliance Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées, les 4 membres du groupe ALLIANCE  de l’association SEWA, ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et de 1 enfant. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier HEREMAKONO de la ville de BOUGOUNI, troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des relations de voisinage. 
Ces femmes font le commerce de jus de fruits, des produits alimentaires et des habits à l’image de BINTA S. qui a  un pagne blanc sur  sa tête jusqu’à l’épaule. 
Avec l’intention d’acheter assez d’habits pour satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle, elle a décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui elle est à son troisième prêt de groupe et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Madame BINTA S. vend ses habits dans un kiosque à l’auto gare de BOUGOUNI.
Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter 70 complets pour les petits garçons, 50 robes pour les jeunes filles et 20 chemises pour les adultes.
 Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes de BAMAKO. Toutes les ventes se font en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt  Madame BINTA S. espère obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de 35000 FCFA  qui selon elle sera réutilisé dans son entreprise.
texts.en:
The four members of the Alliance group (which belongs to the Sewa association) are all married women, averaging 30 years of age with an average of one child each. They live in nuclear families with their children and husbands. These women live in the Heremakono district of the town of Bougouni, the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They met through relatives and neighbors.

These women sell fruit juice, food products and clothes (Binta S., who is wearing a white "pagne" wrapped around her head down to her shoulders, sells clothes). With the aim of buying enough clothes to satisfy customer demand, she decided to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, and is now on her third group loan from this institution; all the previous loans have been repaid correctly.

With this loan she is planning on buying 70 outfits for small boys, 50 young girls' dresses and 20 adults' shirts. She gets her supplies from wholesalers in Bamako. All her sales are made on a retail basis, for cash and on credit, to a customer base made up of men and women. With this loan, Mrs. S. is hoping to make a monthly profit of 35,000FCFA, which according to her will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida F. is  51 years old, married, and has two adult children and one child who attends high school.  She is a resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her youngest child to college, a dream for most Filipino parents like Adelaida as she herself is a high school graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Adelaida operates a tailoring business while overseeing operations of her ready-to-wear clothing business and a variety store. She mainly sells curtains, bedsheets, blankets, and other items for the home. Seasonal demands for clothing such as uniforms are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,500 every week from her tailoring business and variety store.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan for PHP 21,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread, and newspapers for patterns. She also plans to use the loan to buy additional grocery items as replenishment for her variety store. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread, and newspapers for patterns and assorted grocery items for her variety store

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce A. sells beer, soda and a local brew at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and soda to sell. Joyce is 39 years old and married with a husband who is a carpenter. She has seven children--four of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her bar.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer and soda to sell

loans.name: Salima's Group

texts.en:
Salima I. is the treasurer of this group. She is a 60 years old widow. Salima has raised three sons; all of them are working in Russia. In order to make money Salima breeds farm animals. She has eight sheep, a cow and a calf. Her grandchildren help her with that activity. Reselling some farm animals after fattening she makes 5000 soms per month. That profit makes it possible for her to receive treatment in the hospital.  With money received from the loan Salima wants to purchase a cow, in order to start selling dairy products. In the future Salima wants to start repairing her house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: María Graciela

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal 25 Rosas.

En este hermoso lugar encontramos a la señora María, ella tiene 52 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado cuatro  hijas de 33 – 23 – 20 y 19 años, con ella viven las dos menores una de ellas estudia en la Universidad, su esposo es comerciante, vende mariscos.

Ella y su esposos se dedican al comercio,  venden  mariscos, trabajan todos los días desde las 5am hasta las 15h00, realizan todas sus actividades que van desde la comprar de sus productos a los pescadores hasta llevarlos a entregar a sus clientes, entregan sus productos al hospital de Bahía,  también tienen un puesto en el mercado en el cual venden al menudeo a las personas que a diario llegan hasta el lugar a realizar sus compras, dice que tienen en su negocio ya por 20 años y que siempre le ha ido bien ya que a ellos el trabajo no les incomoda.

Este crédito es para comprar más de sus productos como pescado, camarón, ostiones entre otros. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace 5 años y le gusta la facilidad para conseguir los créditos. Su sueño es comprar un carro para llevar sus productos a entregar en Quito que es un buen mercado.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the '25 Rosas' community bank meet in the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez which is known for its beaches, its good food and the warmth of its people.

In this beautiful place we meet María.  She is 52 years old and lives with her common-law husband with whom she has four daughters aged 33, 23, 20 and 19.  She still lives with her two youngest daughters, one of whom is studying at university.  Her husband is a salesman who sells seafood.

María and her husband both sell seafood.  They work every day from 5.00am to 3.00pm.  They buy their products from the fisherman and they deliver them to their customers.
