They deliver their products to Bahía Hospital and also have a market stall from which they sell their seafood retail to people who come there every day to do their shopping.  They say that they have had their business for 20 years and that it has always done very well because they are happy to work.

This loan will be used to buy more products such as fish, prawns, scallops, etc.  María has been a member of her community bank for 5 years and she likes the ease with which she can obtain loans.  Her dream is to buy a car so that she can take her products to Quito which is a good market.

loans.use: To buy fish, prawns, scallops, etc.

loans.name: Gioconda Del Socorro

texts.es:
Gioconda  es una mujer de recursos económicos pobre, pues ha tenido que trabajar mucho para poder apoyar  a su familia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que labora como mensajero.
Hoy en día su negocio es la venta de enchiladas y buñuelo que lo hace de forma ambulante cada día, teniendo un años en las ventas, ya que anteriormente tenía un trabajo fijo.
Con este nuevo crédito cambiara su techo, en donde comprara láminas de zinc, golosos, perlines. Lo que para ella es de gran satisfacción poder  hacer las mejoras a su casa  con el crédito anterior mejoro un cuarto, y que espera seguir mejorando para una vivienda digna atreves de los financiamientos de Afodenic.
texts.en:
Gioconda is a woman of few economic means.  She has had to work hard to support her family.  She has the support of her husband who works as courier.

Gioconda's business is selling enchiladas and 'buñuelos' (fritters).  She does this every day as an itinerant street vendor.  She has been selling for a few years.  Before she took up selling, she used to have a permanent job.

Gioconda will use this new loan to replace her roof.  She will buy sheets of corrugated metal, roofing beams and bolts.  It is very satisfying for Gioconda to be able to make improvements to her home.  She used her last loan to improve a room and she hopes to continue making improvements, through loans from Afodenic, so that she can have a decent home.

loans.use: To replace her roof.  For this work she will buy sheets of corrugated metal, roofing beams and bolts

loans.name: Aiymbubu

texts.en:
Aiymbubu K. is 48 years old and has four children. Aiymbubu was born into a low-income family and from early childhood, she had to help her parents around the house and earn money at the local diary factory. Aiymbubu got married at the age of 20. Soon she gave a birth to three daughters and one son. Unfortunately, her family life was not happy and she was divorced from her husband in 1997. As Aiymbubu became the only breadwinner for her children, she decided to start animal breeding. Using an initial amount of 15,000 Kyrgyz soms, she bought one milk cow, whose milk she sold to the dairy factory. Later on, her livestock grew and in order to reduce her expenses for the livestock's foraging, she pastured her livestock in the mountainous areas with native grasses. Now, Aiymbubu has two milk cows, two horses and 15 sheep at her farm. On the weekends, Aiymbubu and her son sells meat at the local market. 

As Aiymbubu is a very hardworking person, she is also engaged in sewing mattresses, cushions and coverings, which became very popular in her local area because of the low prices and good quality of her products. Now, Aiymbubu requests a loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz soms to buy two bull calves for fattening and reselling.  It allows her further development of her household and business. In the future, she plans to hold her daughters’ weddings and give good dowries for them. Aiymbubu in a very positive person, who according to her motto, “nothing seek, nothing find”, makes every effort to provide her children with a prosperous life.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable members of the population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, it contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is 57 years old and does stitching work to earn an income for her family. She started this business to financially support her husband who operates an herbal medicine making business. He is an expert in his field and has a great ability to diagnose diseases. Many people from different areas come to him for herbal treatments.   

Sakina has 2 sons and 2 daughters. All of them work. Her eldest son has a business of selling mobile phones while the other son is a salesman and sells groceries to different grocery shops. Both of her daughters stitch clothing and help her in her business. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her elder son’s mobile phones selling business. With the loan, he will purchase mobiles of different companies like Nokia, Samsung etc and calling cards for his shop to offer more variety to the clients to earn an extra income. 

Her son has been operating this business for the past 10 years and managing a good clientele base. She is confident that an investment will give a big a boost to his business by increasing his profits.

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself as a responsible client who never missed a single meeting and always paid her installments on time. 

She belongs to a small city of Punjab Pakistan called Kasur which is known for its tanneries industry. She lives there with her family in a 3 room brick house.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and calling cards to resell

loans.name: Amude

texts.en: Amude is currently in the business of selling alcohol. She is 35 years old and a widow. She has seven children and four of them go to school. She is taking out a loan to stock more alcohol to sell. Amude hopes to build a house in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: Stock more alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica, de 47 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Edgar (48) y sus cinco hijos, de los cuales solo se hace cargo del menor, pues el resto ya son jóvenes y trabajan; juntos buscan salir adelante en busca del progreso. 

Esta mujer se dedica a la preparación y venta de chifles (plátanos pequeños fritos) y camotes fritos,  de manera ambulatoria, desde hace 4 años. Dice que esta muy satisfecha pues le esta yendo bien en su negocio, y empieza desde la tarde con la fritura de los chifles, sale a las calles de su zona a ofrecer hasta la noche, además esta contenta pues  su esposo la ayuda en la preparación. Sus negocios los desempeña  por temporadas, a veces comercializa gaseosas, sobretodo a los sedientos chóferes de las movilidades de su zona.  Tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de ampliar el negocio de venta de chifles y camotes fritos en un lugar estable y quiere continuar adelante ya que desea mejorar sus ganancias. 

Angélica tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de ingredientes (plátanos, camotes, bolsas  para la envoltura, aceite, entre otros) que necesita para continuar preparando cantidad de chifles. 

Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que depositaron su confianza en ella para acceder al crédito para seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Angélica, 47, lives in her own house with her husband, Edgar, 48, and their five children although only the youngest is still in her care because the rest are young people who work; together they seek to get ahead in search of progress.

She has made “chifles” (small, fried bananas) and fried sweet potatoes to sell as a street vendor for the last four years.  She says that she’s very satisfied because she’s doing well in the business.  She starts out in the afternoon frying up the chifles and then goes out into the local streets to sell them until evening.  Besides, she’s happy because her husband helps her make them.

Her business develops according to the season.  Sometimes she sells soft drinks, especially to the thirsty vehicle drivers in her area.  She has lots of plans for the future like expanding her chifle and fried sweet potato business into a stable site; she also wants to continue forward improving her profits.

Angélica plans to use the loan money to buy ingredients (bananas, sweet potatoes, bags to package them in and oil, among other things to continue making quantities of chifles.

This is her third loan with MFP and she promises to repay punctually because she does not want to disappoint the people who trusted her so that she could access the loan to continue working.

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Lona

texts.en:
Lona J. is currently in a business of selling biscuits. She is 40 years old, married, with 4 children and 3 of them  go to school. 
J. borrowed a loan to stock more biscuits to sell. She hopes to use the extra profits from her business to pay  her children in  school in the future.

loans.use: Stock more biscuits to sell

loans.name: Rodina

texts.ar: ردوينه في عمر 36 سنة متزوجة ولها 2 ولدان تعمل في بيع الألعاب والخطوط التعبئة للهواتف النقالة لها في عملها 11 سنة تريد ان تؤمن مستقبل جيد لها ولعائلتها التي هي كل اهتمامها تريد دائما التجدد والتطور تحب العمل تعاني من منافسة في محيطها العملي وما ينقصها هي المادة لدعم عملها وتحسينه تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء العاب جديدة + خطوط تشريج للهواتف النقالة لها تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وكانت تلقى الدعم الكامل من العائلة لها زبائن من محيطها وجيرانها
texts.en: Rodina is 32 years old and married with two sons. She works in the business of selling toys and mobile phone lines. She has been doing this for 11 years. She would like to secure a good future for herself and her family, who are her priority. She is always seeking ways to develop her work, and loves what she does. She is exposed to a lot of competition in her local area and she suffers from lack of financial support to improve her business. With this loan she hopes to purchase new toys and mobile phone lines to sell. She has a good credit history with Al-Majmoua. She has the full support of her family and has many customers from her neighbours and local area.

loans.use: to purchase new toys and mobile phone lines to sell.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is from the village of Tigdok, Tudela Misamis Occidental. She is 70 years old, married and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Aurelia has a business venture running a retail store selling a variety of products such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, etc. in the local community.

Aurelia has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities. Aurelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Aurelia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP with which she will purchase additional inventory and use for working capital. This loan will be the sixth loan cycle taken out by Aurelia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products for her retail store such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste

loans.name: Rosmery Mirtha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; Este banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosmery: es soltera y tiene 25 años de edad; la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de choclo, ayudando a su mamá, la socia junto a su hermana y su mamá, trabajan sus terrenos de cultivo de choclo y lo venden al por mayor, la socia ahora desea invertir su dinero en un nuevo negocio propio, ella desea alquilar una tienda comercial en Urubamba y vender ropa, la socia ya cuenta con un pequeño apoyo de capital que estuvo ahorrando por meses y le hace falta exactamente este monto que pide, La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su propio negocio de ropa.

La socia está muy agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosemary belongs to the community bank "Virgen Natividad" located in the province of Urubamba and Cusco.

Ms. Rosmery: is single and is 25 years old.  She is engaged in the buying and selling of corn, helping her mother.  Along with her mother and sister, they  work their corn-growing territories and sell it wholesale.  The borrower now wants  to invest money in a new business.  She wants to rent a commercial store and sell clothes in Urubamba.  Ms Rosemary already has a small amount of capital that she was saving for months and needs exactly the requested loan amount. She is requesting a loan to invest in her own clothing business.

She is very grateful for the loan and agrees to meet the payments on the loan in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: buy and sell cloths.

loans.name: Raquel Armanda

texts.es: Raquel Armanda de 48 años, soltera con 4 hijos dos de ellos aun estudian, doña Raquel tiene su puesto de verduras en el mercado municipal de su comunidad ella atiende su puesto desde las 8:00 AM hasta las 7:00 pm, también la ayuda su hija y otra señora mas para atender a su clientela como se lo merece ella compra las verduras 2 veces a la semana  para tener productos frescos como, zanahoria, güisquil, y una diversidad de legumbres, necesita renovar su crédito para la compra de verduras  y seguir con la atención a sus clientes, también desea seguir ayudando con la educación de sus hijos ya que es poco el camino que le falta asegura ella,  ella es una mujer trabajadora  y muy responsable ya que es muy puntual en hacer sus pagos del crédito ella ya ha tenido varios créditos y  está contenta de que ella pueda recibir otro crédito que le ayude en su negocio.
texts.en: Raquel Armanda is 48 years old, single, and she has 4 children who are still in school. Raquel has a vegetable stand in the municipal market in her community. She attends her stand from 8:00 am to 7:00pm. Her daughter and another woman help her provide her clients with the quality of customer service they deserve. She buys her vegetables 2 times per week to have fresh products, such as carrots, pear squash, and a variety of vegetables. She needs to renew her loan to purchase vegetables to maintain her clients' attention. She also wants to keep helping her children with their education, especially because they are so close to finishing. She is a hardworking and very responsible person. She is very punctual to make her payments and she has had several previous loans. She is happy that she will be able to access another loan to support her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
For five years Peris has been managing rental houses as her primary business, and she also operates a posho mill (grinds maize into corn flour). She gets an income of about $285 per month. She is 60 years old and the mother of two children who are all grown up. 

She has applied for her second loan and she plans to use the entire loan amount to complete the construction of a rental house that is halfway done. With the anticipated income she will invest to build more rental houses.

In future she hopes to grow her business and build over twenty rental houses.

loans.use: to complete the construction of a house.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Maria Antonia tiene su negocio de venta de tortillas. Hace más de 35 años que tiene este negocio, ella es una persona muy emprendedora y disfruta de su negocio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de maíz, bolsas, comal y cal. Inicio este negocio gracias a su esposo y que le ha brindado mucho ayuda. Maria siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles a sus clientes buena calidad en sus productos y un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: María Antonia’s business is selling tortillas.  She’s been in business for over 35 years.  She is a very enterprising person who enjoys her business.  The reason for the loan is to buy corn, bags, a griddle and lime powder.  She started the business thanks to her husband who has provided much support to her.  María has always stood out for providing her customers with good quality products and good service.

loans.use: to buy corn, bags, a griddle and lime powder.

loans.name: Iliana Emperatriz

texts.es: Iliana Emperatriz D. 21 años D. edad, vive con su abuela D. 71 años y su compañero D. vida con el cual tiene una pequeña niña. Iliana trabaja desD. muy temprano para sacar adelante a su familia y se esfuerza por mejorar las condiciones D. vida en las que se encuentra por el momento. Ella tiene una pequeña tienda en su  hogar D. residencia la cual ha logrado establecer gracias a su dedicación y trabajo. En esta tienda el cliente es lo más importante, por lo que Iliana  se esfuerza por mantenerlos contentos, siempre los atienD. con una sonrisa y con mucha amabilidad que es lo que la caracteriza. Es por esta razón que se ha ganado la confianza D. sus vecinos y cada día demandan más sus productos. A pesar D. su corta edad es una mujer soñadora quiere abastecer su negocio con la fe puesta en Dios que D. esta manera va atraer a más clientes y así podrá mejorar sus ventas.  Esto la ha llevado a tomar la decisión D. solicitar este crédito para comprar variedad D. productos D. tienda como: azúcar, arroz, café, golosinas, variedad D. bebidas, pan dulce, detergente, etc. Ella confía que D. esta manera logrará cumplir su sueño.
texts.en: Iliana Emperatriz is 21 and lives with her 71-year old grandmother as well as her husband and small daughter. Iliana starts work early in order to prosper and achieve better living conditions for her family. She has a small store in her house, the result of much dedication and hard work. She attends her clients with excellent friendly service and a smile.  Her clientele has grown as a result and her merchandise is always in demand.  Though young, Iliana is confident that she can grow her business and for this reason seeks a credit in order to buy more inventory of: sugar, rice, coffee, sweets, soft drinks, bread, detergent, etc.  In this way she hopes to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her store: sugar, rice, coffee, sweets, soft drinks, bread, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Salaton

texts.en:
Salaton has been a farmer for the last three years. He is 31 years old, married to a house wife and blessed with four children.

He learned about KADET from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area. This is his third loan and he plans to use it to purchase farm supplies. He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm.

His dreams are to be the best and well known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina started a home-based tutoring business, Golden Apple Tutors, almost five years ago. Her business allows tutors to provide after-school tutoring. Aside from the one-on-one, multi-subject tutoring, Christina also provides SAT prep classes and other prep group classes. She has a variety of clients ranging from government entities such as private clients, Catholic Charities, the Archdiocese of Miami, and other non-profit organizations. Recently she was approved by the State and Department of Education to provide tutoring and education services in 2011-2012 free of charge for clients. Christina is constantly growing and reinventing herself in order to increase profits by developing new partnerships. 

With this loan from ACCION USA, Christina will be purchasing materials to market her own business and the new partnerships that she has established. Christina’s partnerships show her strength as a business owner and her reputation in the field. 

For more information about Christina’s business, visit: www.goldenappletutors.com

loans.use: to purchase materials to market her own business and the new partnerships that she has established

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia tiene ya más de tres años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder compra mas mercancía que es ropa para hombre, juguetes, zapatos y accesorios de para los bebes, ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión que su negocio esta necesitando. 
Con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio planea pagar el crédito ya que su esposo se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares de sus cuatro hijos, con el sueldo.
texts.en: Silvia has worked for more than three years selling used clothing.  She is requesting a loan to be able to buy more merchandise such as clothing for men, toys, shoes, and accessories for babies as right now she doesn’t have as much money to invest as her business requires.  With the profits she earns from her business she plans to pay off her loan as her husband takes care of the household and schooling expenses for their four children with his salary.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Lino

texts.es:
Lino 55 años, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Lino desde hace unos años se dedica a la comercialización de animales de corral (cerdos, ovejas y vacas), los cría en sus corrales que tiene en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que hayan completado su crecimiento ideal, los vende a sus clientes o en los diferentes mercados de la zona  y con los ingresos podrá cubrir sus necesidades y gastos familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para compra de una vaca lechera y alimento balanceado, una vez que los engorde los comercializa a sus clientes, con las ganancias que obtenga pagará el crédito otorgado y mejorará el nivel de vida de su familia. Lino con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo trata de salir adelante para seguir ayudando económicamente a su familia y brindarle a sus hijos otras oportunidades.
texts.en:
Lino, aged 55, lives with his wife and children in their own home which does not have running water or electricity.  It is located in the rural area of Tambogrande district, which is part of Piura deparment.  This area is characterized by agriculture, livestock, and handicrafts.

For the last several years, Lino has worked in the business of farmyard animals (pigs, sheep and cows).  He raises them in his farmyard, which is the area outside of his home.  He feeds them on balanced animal feed and natural pastures.  Once they have achieved their ideal growth, he sells them to his customers or in the different area markets, and with the income he is able to cover his needs and his family's expenses.

He has requested a loan of 2,000 New Soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a milk cow and balanced animal feed.  Once he has fattened his animals, he will sell them to his customers.  With the earnings, he will pay back the loan being offered, and improve his family's standard of living.

With much hard work and effort, Lino tries to move forward in life so as to be able to continue helping his family financially, and provide his children other opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow and balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent, a 29-year-old married father of five, mainly sells foods such as beans, g-nuts (peanuts), maize and millet in a food market in Ibanda. He also sells matooke to supplement his main income. This very hardworking businessman earns 400,000 monthly, a profit that has enabled him to pay the school fees for his three children.

With the Kiva loan, Vicent plans to buy more beans, millet and maize for resale. His plan for the future is to own his own store and educate his children to the university level.

loans.use: to buy more beans, maize, millet and g-nuts for resale.

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI I  est un regroupe  de 9 femmes mariées du village de SANGOULA  de la sous préfecture de BLA, dans l’ex Cercle de BLA, région de SÉGOU (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 44 ans, 4 enfants et cultivent  du riz, de l’arachide et du gombo. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles et d’augmenter les parcelles cultivables pour une meilleure production, les membres du groupe BENKADI I ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, sont à leur premier prêt de campagne. 
ROKIA,  la première assise à gauche, avec une écharpe rouge,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des semences de bonne qualité, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles pour la culture, exclusivement  au grand marché de BLA ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de BLA , YANGASSO et dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe BENKADI I comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 40.000 à 46.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en: BENKADI I is a group of 9 married women from the Sangoula village in the prefecture of Bla, in the ex Cercle de BLA, region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali). They live in traditional families, are on average 44 years old, have on average 4 children, and cultivate rice, peanuts and okra. In an effort to make a profit with their farm and to increase their farmable land for better returns, the members of the BENKADI I group decided to incorporate the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first loan. Rokia, the first woman seated on the left with a red scarf, plans to use her loan to buy quality seeds, small equipment, and agricultural resources for farming, exclusively at the grand market of BLA city. After the winter, the harvest are stocked for a certain time for them to get some value before being sold at the grand market in BLA, YANGASSO and neighboring markets, by retail (often at wholesale), by credit to a clientele that generally come from big cities. After the yield of their agricultural products, the members of the BENKADI I group plan to each earn 40,000 – 46,000 FCFA monthly, which will be used to repay the loan’s interest and family expenses.

loans.use: to buy resources, seeds, and small equipment

loans.name: Luis

texts.en: Luis, 51, is a resident of San Miguel Ramon. He is married having two children. By the grace of God and with the help of his supportive wife, he is able to provide for his children’s needs. Luis runs a hog raising business that he has been managing for two years. He raises and fattens them, and sells them at their optimum growth and size. To help him continue running his business, he is asking for financial assistance in the amount of P10,000. He will use the loan to buy feed so he can improve the weight and size of his piglets and sell them at a greater price. Luis is aiming to add more piglets in order to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase feed supplies for his hog raising business

loans.name: Lucas

texts.es:
Don Lucas vive en unión libre con la señora María Guadalupe y con quien procreo un hijo de la edad de siete meses de edad.
  
    El es la primera vez que solicita el préstamo en fundación realidad y es para invetero en la compra de mantas, en donde  lleva practicando dos años y le va bien ya que también se dedica a l transporte con su taxi en lo que lleva practicando nueve años y le ha dado un buen resultado.

     Lo que lo motivo  a  esta actividad fue su  esposa para  ir mejorando día con día sus ingreso, así también su esposa se encarga de costurar la blusa y camisas  que están bordadas, para  que juntos puedan  lograr lo que desean.

    Lo que más desea es que con el tiempo pueda tener un atienda en la que puedan vender su mercancía sin necesidad de salir a otro lugar, así también comprar un carro para apoyar a su familia cuando  llevan sus artesanías.
texts.en:
Lucas lives with his common-law wife María Guadalupe and their seven-month-old son.  

This is the first time that Lucas has requested a loan from Fundación Realidad.  He will invest it in buying fabric.  He has been in this business for two years and it is doing very well.  He also provides a taxi service.  He has been in the taxi business for nine years and it is also doing well.

Lucas was encouraged to start this business by his wife so that they could continue improving their income.  His wife sews the embroidered blouses and shirts so that they can jointly achieve what they want.

What Lucas would most like, in the future, is to be able to set up a store where he can sell his merchandise without having to travel.  He would also like to buy a car so that he can support his family when they transport their handicrafts.

loans.use: to buy fabric and threads

loans.name: Silika

texts.en:
SIlika is married and she is 34 years old with 3 children. Silika owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting cocoa for sale.  She has 3 years of experience in this business.    

Silika needs a loan of WST 1,500 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or $83 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2010, Silika joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet  lives in Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, none of whom is in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother). 

Harriet has a business selling used shoes.  She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works 6 days out of every week. Harriet sells her products at the market by means of wholesale and retail.   She also generates additional income through roasting  maize and sweet potatoes.

Harriet has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used shoes to resell. The main business challenges for Harriet include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of second-hand shoes.  Her goals and aspirations are to start importing used shoes for her business and also to buy a plot of land to build her own house. 

Harriet lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: buy second-hand shoes

loans.name: Rosa Selena

texts.es: Rosa Selena tiene 25 años, ella es una persona muy responsable su trabajo es de secretaria. Rosa quiere realizar mejoras a su vivienda, que no las había podido realizar por falta suficiente de dinero. Este es motivo por el cual realiza el crédito para la compa de cemento, piedrín, arena, entre otros. Ella es una mujer madura que quiere lo mejor para su hijo de 7 años que está bajo su cargo a pesar de que no ha sido fácil debido a las dificultades que atraviesa a diario, pero que ella no se deja abatir.
texts.en:
Rosa Selena, 25, is a very responsible person.  She works as a secretary.  Rosa wants to make improvements to her home that she hasn't been able to do for lack of enough money.

This is why she is getting the loan to buy cement, "piedrín" [a type of building stone], sand, and other materials.

She is a mature woman who wants the best for the 7-year-old son she is responsible for.  In spite of the fact that it hasn't been easy, given the difficulties she faces every day, she doesn't let it get her down.

loans.use: to buy cement, "piedrín" [building stone], sand, and other materials.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Melanie provides motorcycle or habal-habal services with her husband as the driver. She has run this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for gasoline.
Melanie has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Giovanna Jazelli

texts.es: Nuevamente Giovanna está aplicando a su  credikiva en el último trimestre del año y esto es justamente para invertirlo en accesorios femeninos papelería y adornos navideños . Ella se siente muy agradecida con sus inversiones y una vez mas agradece la confianza que los financiadores han depositado en ella.
texts.en:
Giovanna is again applying for a Kiva loan in the last trimester of the year, precisely to invest it in women's accessories, stationery items, and Christmas decorations.

She is grateful for her investments and once again she appreciates the trust that the financial backers have placed in her.

loans.use: to buy women's accessories, stationery items, and holiday decorations.

loans.name: James Sunlight

texts.en:
James is 32 years old, married, and has one child.  He has a brick laying and sales business in Kyenjojo in Western Uganda, which he has had for two years. 

James employs several youth at his brick laying business. He says his objective is to give them apprentice training so that they can emulate him and start their own businesses. He also earns additional income from farming and poultry sales. James's gross income is approximately 400,000-600,000 UGX per month.
 
James is requesting a loan, which he will use to purchase of additional brick laying equipment. He also plans to expand his business by purchasing more land. His hope for the future is for a happy family living in the house he plans to build.

loans.use: to purchase additional brick laying equipment.

loans.name: Manuel Alberto

texts.es:
Manuel trabajador, mejorar las condiciones de la infraestructura de su vivienda sigue siendo su principal plan.  Mediante el financiamiento a logrado ir cambiando algunos desperfectos de su casa. Con este nuevo ciclo de crédito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales como: cemento bond, porcelana, separadores, látex entre otros materiales que se requieren para la colocación de baldosa del suelo de su casa. Obteniendo un mejor aspecto su vivienda y contribuyendo a un mejor nivel de vida. 
Agradece a ala financiera por el apoyo y la ayuda a cumplir sus planes y proyectos.
texts.en:
Manuel is a worker whose main plan continues to be improving the conditions of his home's infrastructure. With financing he has been able to make changes to some of his house's imperfections. He will use a new round of credit to buy materials like grout, porcelain, dividers and latex, among other materials required for laying tile on the floor of his house. 

This improves his home and contributes to a better standard of living. He thanks the lender for their support and help in accomplishing his plans and projects.

loans.use: to buy materials for laying tile on his floor.

loans.name: Zainab Y

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Zainab Y.  She is single and has 3 children aged 19, 13, and 8 years respectively, and all school-going children. In 2003, Zainab Y established her soft drinks, liquor and fruit juice (Bar & Restaurant) business. She began her business because she was in school when she got pregnant. After she delivered; she was not able to further her studies because her parents were not well-to-do.  She had to go into business in order to maintain her baby and herself.  Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,800,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. She has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase savanna drinks - 20 crates @ Le120, 000 and frozen chicken - 6 cartons @ Le100,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 358,000. 

In the future, Zainab Y plans to build a club and motel.  This business helps her greatly.  She wants her children to be educated as she was unfortunate in learning.  She is very excited with her business.  Her only challenge is foreign exchange.  Competition is high, but her employees treat customers nicely and provide good food and assorted drinks.  Zainab Y serves people around town and foreigners in town.  Her business is popular because she has good sales people.  

Her suppliers are located in Makeni, Freetown and Conakry.  She usually buys her goods in large stock once per month.  She uses her profit as additional capital.  She is planning to expand as she hopes to access bigger loans.  She is hardworking and honest.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase savanna drinks - 20 crates @ Le120, 000 and frozen chicken - 6 cartons @ Le100,000.

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en:
Chanthol, 23, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than three years. Her husband is a construction worker. Additionally, she and her husband grow agricultural crops. Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Chanthol is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. By doing so, she would be able to get to work on time and save some money on her transportation expense. 

In the future, Chanthol would like to raise pigs to generate more income to support the family. Moreover, she plans to build a new house and support her child to study for a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen  es propietaria de un taller de confecciones ubicado en el barrio Pinar del Rio, donde confecciona vestidos para damas, caballeros y niños. Su gran experiencia data desde hace muchos años, cuando trabajó un tiempo importante, como empleada en diversas empresas de confecciones de la ciudad de Barranquilla y como producto de su conocimiento teórico-práctico adquirido mediante sus  estudios técnicos en el Sena. Ella tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 37 y 39 años,  vive con su cónyuge, quien se dedica a trabajos de ornamentación en aluminio y también en hierro. Carmen posee los equipos necesarios para su labor, tiene una infraestructura de maquinaria adecuada al tamaño del negocio  y sus clientes disfrutan de la muy buena   calidad con que fabrica los jeans, pantalones formales y vestidos femeninos, que son sus principales líneas de trabajo;  con ello sostiene una clientela muy rentable que cada día crece y ella vive entusiasmada con incrementarle aun mas la calidad de sus productos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará una máquina plana para mejorar e incrementar la producción y también comprará materias primas para responder a sus pedidos de principio de año. Con su negocio Carmen está muy satisfecha, porque aporta a los gastos del hogar,  pues sus ventas mensuales le generan un buen margen de rentabilidad lo que le  permite hacerlo.
texts.en: Carmen is the owner of a tailoring workshop located in the Pinar del Rio neighborhood, where clothes for women, men, and children are made.  She has had great experience for many years.  She worked for a while as an employee at different tailoring companies in the city of Barranquilla.  She also has experience as a result of her theoretical-practical knowledge that she acquired through her technical studies in Sena.  She has 2 children who are 37 and 39 years old.  She lives with her spouse, who works on aluminum and iron ornamentation jobs.  Carmen owns the necessary equipment to do her work.  She has an infrastructure of adequate machinery for the size of her business, and her customers enjoy the very good quality of the jeans, formal pants, and feminine dresses that she makes.  These are her main products of her work.  With this, she maintains a very profitable clientele that grows each day.  She is excited to increase the quality of her products even more.  This is the reason that she is turning to Kiva, the first financing that she is getting from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy a flat machine to improve and increase her production, and also to buy raw materials to fulfill her orders from the beginning of the year.  Carmen is very satisfied with her business, because she contributes to the household costs.  Her monthly sales generate a good margin of profit for her, which allows her to do this.

loans.use: to buy a flat machine to improve and increase her production and to buy raw materials to fulfill her orders

loans.name: Abahujubumwe Cb Sub Grp B Group

texts.en: ABAHUJUBUMWE is a group led by Esther who is 35 years old. The group name means “Same mission” in English. She is married with 3 children aged between 3 and 10 years. They all go to school. She sells food stuffs and she has been selling in a business for the past 3 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their life. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, maize and sorghum for sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings.

loans.use: to buy more beans, maize and sorghum for sell

loans.name: Iris Azucena

texts.en: Both my husband and myself run the business.  We both keep the store that generates income that covers the expenses of my family. My business is one of the largest in my community and once in a while visitors ask me to cook for them, which provides some extra earnings.

loans.use: Buying fruits, vegetables, sugar, soda amongst others.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married with one daughter who is attending college. She is in the grocery sales business selling a variety of food products in the busy central market. She has two kiosks and hires a lady to help her with sales. Oksana has been a client with “Nadiya Ukraine” since 1999. She started her business selling tea and coffee at one of the local markets. She saved her money and together with loans from “Nadiya Ukraine” was able to expand, setting up a second kiosk in the central city market. She is an entrepreneur of integrity – very punctual and communicative. She manages a very brisk trade at her vending kiosks. Many loyal customers keep coming back because of Oksana’s friendly attitude, cheerful nature and willingness to serve them well. Oksana would like a loan for $1,200 to expand the range of food products she has available such as coffee, tea, candy, chocolates, mayonnaise, and vegetable oil. She is planning to purchase these groceries wholesale where she can get a good price. Income generated from Oksana’s business will allow her to invest more in her daughter’s education as well as provide a better living for her family which is her first priority in life.

Оксана – одружена, в неї є дочка. Вона навчається в університеті. Оксана продає харчі на центральному ринку міста. В неї два кіоски, в одному з них працює жінка, яку Оксана взяла на роботу в якості реалізатора. Оксана стала клієнткою „Надії України” в 1999 році. Вона починала з продажу чаю та кави на одному з місцевих ринків. Оксана використала власні заощадження та за допомогою позик від „Надії України” змогла розширити свою торгівлю, відкривши другий кіоск на центральному місцевому ринку. Вона – чесна, пунктуальна та комунікабельна. Торгівля біля її прилавків завжди дуже жвава. Багато покупців знову й знов повертаються по покупки до Оксани через її дружелюбну вдачу, щирість та бажання якомога краще обслуговувати клієнтів. Оксана хотіла б отримати позику в 1 200 доларів для того, щоб придбати більше товарів харчування, а саме каву, чай, цукерки, шоколад, майонез, олію тощо. Вона планує придбати продовольчі товари оптом для подальшої роздрібної торгівлі. Позика допоможе Оксані вкласти отриманий прибуток в освіту дочки, а також забезпечити кращий рівень життя для родини, яка завжди займала перше місце в житті Оксани.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of food products

loans.name: Enoma

texts.en: Mrs. Enoma A. is married with three (3) children. She is 36 years old, a LAPO client for the past 3 years. She is happily engaged in sales of provision and drinks. She is optimistic that she can expand her business with a loan $500.

loans.use: To buy more drinks

loans.name: Aydin

texts.en:
Aydin has 12 years of experience in this business. He is 49 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, settled in Khirdalan settlement. He is  married and has 2 children.
He sells seasonal agricultural produce.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to expand the area of his shop.

loans.use: To expand  his shop

loans.name: Hamira

texts.ru:
Hamira S., 45 is married mother of 3 children. Her youngest daughter helps Hamira in her business. Hamira has high school education. In the past, Hamira worked as a seamstress and her husband was a builder. They earned enough to pay for their needs. Since perestroika both Hamira and her husband began to sell. Now, while her husband is away working as a seasonal laborer in the neighboring countries, Hamira is the one responsible for providing for her family and raising her children. While taking care of her daughters, Hamira managed to expand her business. She joined MicroInvest in 2003 and took the first loan of $90. Today, Hamira’s line of credit reached $1400, which illustrates that Hamira has been a disciplined borrower since the beginning of her relationship with MicroInvest. In the future, Hamira plans to increase the assortment of goods and open a new trading spot. P.S. Hamira’s daughter is on the photo.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Сражидинова Хамира – 45 лет, замужем . Мать троих детей из которых младшая помогает ей в торговле. Образование среднее. Раньше работала на фабрике швеей а муж строителем , что позволял семье покрывать житейские финансовые расходы. После перестройки в стране, они оба стали заниматься торговлей. Сейчас муж на заработках в соседних странах, а она, приняв все тяжести жизни на свои плечи, продолжает расти дочерей и заодно увеличить товарооборот. Начала кредитоваться в МЗФ «Микроинвест» в 2003 году с 90$. А сейчас ее активы достигают 1400$ ,что показывает, что она очень дисциплинированно кредитуется в МЗФ с начинания ее деятельности. В будущем планирует расширить ассортимент и открыть еще одну торговую точку. P.S. На фото её дочь.

loans.use: Increase the assortment of goods and open a new trading spot

loans.name: Dunia Maria

texts.en:
Dunia Maria H. has had a small business selling used American clothes from her home for 8 years. She has a good business selling women's and men's clothing.

She is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase more clothes to sell. She would like to open another store near her house during the busy Christmas season. Dunia Maria H. is a single mother with three children, and she must work to support her children and pay school fees.

loans.use: Purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is the happiest client that we interviewed. She gladly explained that the loan has made her relationship with her husband very cordial because she contributes greatly to meet the family’s income from her profits. She started her business with $70, and with previous loans from SMT she has increased her capital to $400. Esther is 37 years old and married with 5 children. Together with her husband, Esther plans to provide the best to their children. She is requesting another loan of $375 to increase her stock. Esther would like to purchase 125 more gallons of palm oil.

loans.use: She would like to buy additional stock of palm oil wholesale for distribution.

loans.name: Bessy

texts.en:
Bessy A. is a 25-year-old entrepreneur and mother of two school-aged children. She and her husband live in Kisumu, Kenya. Her husband works as a security guard in Kisumu town.

Bessy began her current business of selling new clothes in the year 2005. She specializes in both children’s and women’s clothing such as skirts, dresses, and casual and formal tops. She periodically travels to Kampala, Uganda, where she is able to purchase a good variety at wholesale prices.

The prime location of her business on a busy street, and her two years of experience and her friendly interaction with customers has enabled her to establish a good clientele base. Her customers return to her shop for her wide selection or to make requests for certain styles.

Bessy plans to expand her business with her loan of US $700. She will invest part of the loan in a trial stock of second-hand clothes and also continue to purchase new ready-made clothes for re-sale.

loans.use: Continue purchasing new clothes and also try to buy stock of used clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Nabweru Iii A 2030(A) Group

texts.en:
Jeniffer is a 35 year old wife and mother of 3 children from Nansana, Uganda. Over a year ago, she founded a restaurant and has since grown it into a successful dining and catering enterprise, with her partners, Margret, Resty, Hellen and Juliet, who provide an important part of Jeniffer’s produce. To further expand her business, she needs your help. With your loan she could grow her restaurant and continue to improve Uganda’s food service industry and her community.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To improve her catering business

loans.name: Yudelki

texts.en:
Yudelki R. sells new and used clothing to people of the Batey of Palavé community of San Cristobal. Yudelki is in her early twenties, and she and her husband have a newly born girl. The entrepreneur explains that her businesses help her supplement the family’s income and face some of their financial issues. In addition, she says she feels independent since she doesn’t have to wait for a man to give her everything she needs.
Yudelki will use her loan to restock her business. She is putting aside money to rent a small locale before long for the business.

loans.use: Yudelki would like to purchase used and new clothing in bulk for her small business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more rice.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa is married and has a son. Her husband works as an employee. She started the business to help with the household expenses because her husband's salary was very low. Things were very hard with the small amount of income they had at that moment so she started selling shoes three years ago. At first she only handled orders by catalog and she was sharing the expenses in order to be able to keep the supply, until she was able to work independently and have her own client portfolio.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $150, to be paid in 3 months, to purchase a shelf to display her merchandise. With your help Teresa can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Teresa es casada tiene un hijo y su esposo trabaja como empleado. Inició el negocio para apoyar los gastos de la casa dado que el sueldo de su esposo como empleado era demasiado bajo. La poca entrada de dinero con que se contaba en ese momento era muy difícil por lo que comenzó vendiendo zapatos hace 3 años solo trabajando pedidos por catalogo y compartiendo credenciales para poder surtir. Hasta lograr independizarse y contar con una cartera de clientes.

Solicita un crédito por US $150 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar un estante para demostraciones. Con tu apoyo Teresa saldrá adelante.

loans.use: To purchase a shelf to display her merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk to increase her sales

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
Chhin S., 26, is married and lives in Kampong Cham province with her husband and two young children. She works as a farmer and is typically able to make $7 a day. The weather has made farming difficult in Cambodia this past year, and inflation has also been very steep. These factors mean difficult economic times for many Cambodians, as food prices have been high.

Chhin S.'s husband works as a taxi driver and typically makes $5 a day. She sees an opportunity to expand her husband’s business and wants to take out a loan to make a few purchases. She is asking for $1,200 to buy a trailer to connect to her husband's motorbike to transport heavy items, such as wood. She feels that expanding her husband’s business will allow him to increase his income and to raise the standard of living for the whole family.

loans.use: To buy a trailer for a motorbike

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.ru:
Muhammad H. is a resident of Vahdat city. He is married with four children. He works as a farmer and has a farm where he raises bull-calves. To increase his turnover, he would like to take out a loan and purchase an additional bull, which will help him develop his business as well as get additional income which he needs to support his family. He will pay off his loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva volunteer.

Хасанов Мухаммад житель города Вахдат . Женат , имеет четверых детей. Работает фермером. Имеет хозяйство , где разводит бычков. Для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот хочет получить кредит и купить еще одного бычка. Это поможет развивать его бизнес .А так же получать дополнительные доходы так необходимые его семье. Прогасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame   Fatoumata   Traoré est âgée de 28 ans et vit avec son époux et ses 3 enfants dans une famille monogame à Sido Soninkoura un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région économique du Mali).
N’ayant pas été à l’école pour des raisons sociales, très vite elle commença les activités génératrices de revenus notamment le commerce du bois de chauffe depuis maintenant 3 ans. 
Elle est en relation avec l’institution Soro Yiriwaso il y’a de cela 3 ans. Après avoir bouclé 3 prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire) avec une association de son quartier, elle est à son premier prêt individuel et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elle s’approvisionne sur place à Ségou et quelques fois dans les villages environnants (tel Kélékou) en bois de chauffe auprès des paysans officiellement reconnus dans la profession. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 5 chargements de bois de camion de bois de chauffe.
Elle vend à la maison nuit et jour (car dispose d’un endroit aménagé où les bois sont stockés à l’abri de la pluie.). Madame Fatoumata Traoré vend en détail, en gros à une clientèle essentiellement composée de femmes et de boulangers qui sont ravitaillés à crédit remboursable hebdomadairement..
Son avantage dans cette activité est qu’elle n’a pas de concurrent car elle est la seule vendeuse de bois de chauffe de son quartier. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 115.000 FCFA qui servira à payer les intérêts du prêt et investir le reste dans les activités. Son ambition est de diversifier ses activités en ouvrant une boutique d’articles divers.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata Traoré is 28 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in a monogamous family in Sido Soninkoura, one of the outlying neighborhoods in the town of Segou (the fourth economic area of Mali).

She never attended school due to social reasons. Very quickly she started a business to generate an income, more specifically,for the last three years, she has been selling firewood. For the last 3 years, she has had a relationship with the organization Soro Yiriwaso. After having completed 3 group loans (interdependent loans) with a neighborhood association, she is applying for her first individual loan. All the previous loans have been repaid on time.

She gets her firewood supply on Segou's plaza and sometimes in the surrounding villages (such as Kélékou). She buys from farmers well known in the trade. She plans on using this loan to buy 5 truck loads of firewood.

She sells from her home day and night (because she uses a space set aside where the wood is stored, sheltered form the rain). Mrs. Fatoumata Traoré sells retail and wholesale mostly to women and bakers who buy on credit that is repayable weekly. Her advantage in this business is that she has no competition because she is the only seller of firewood in her neighborhood. She is planning on making a monthly profit of 115.000 FCFA which will allow her to both repay the loan and invest the rest in her activity. Her ambition is to diversify her activity by opening a shop selling various items.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of firewood

loans.name: Alvaro Benjamin

texts.es: El señor Alvaro Benjamín Menchú Vásquez de 38 años de edad, Casado actualmente reside en la 8va. Calle 9-25 de la zona 2, de Totonicapán. Hace más de trece (13) años viene trabajando de comerciante y elaborando chumpas, güipiles y otras prendas típicas con variedad de estilos y diseños. Entregando su producción en Antigua Guatemala y Solóla  y   hace unos  años se acercó a las oficinas de Asdir para solicitar un crédito para implementar su capital y surtir su mercaderia con el credito anterior crecio economicamente y se desarrollo de otra manera con su negocio  viendo que dia a dia va mejorando su negocio y su nivel de vida y de su familia hoy nueva mente se ve con la necesidad de otro credito  que será invertido para ampliar su capital de trabajo y mejorar su producción, ya que se acerca la feria titular de nuestro pueblo para que el pueda producir más y así obtener buenas ganancias  para el beneficio del mismo. Ya que también se acerca el fin de año y así con el crédito solicitado pueda exponer su trabajo a los turistas que visitan nuestro país y así ellos puedan ser acreedores de esta producción tan tradicional de nuestro país.
texts.en:
Mr. Alvaro Benjamín Menchú Vásquez, a 38-year-old married man, currently lives on 8va. Calle 9-25 in zone 2 of Totonicapán. He has been in business for over 13 years, making jackets, güipiles (traditional Guatemalan dresses) and other traditional apparel in assorted styles and varieties. He sells his merchandise in Antigua Guatemala and Solóla. A few years ago, he visited the Asdir office to request a loan in order to increase his capital and stock up on merchandise. With his previous loan, his business was able to grow financially and develop in a different way. Upon noticing that both his business and his family’s standard of living have been improving on a daily basis, he once again feels the need to obtain another loan that will be invested in increasing his work capital and improving production. Because the town fair is approaching, he would like to be able to produce more and earn more profits for his own benefit. Furthermore, the end of the year is coming up, and with this loan he wants to display his work to the tourists who visit the country so that they can purchase our traditional clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies to make clothing

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en: Mrs. Kalpana K. lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur and lives with her huband Mr. Shyam Kumar K.. He is a taxi driver in the Kathmandu valley. Mrs. Kalpana opened her fruit shop a few months ago in the Sanepa-chock. Now Mrs. K. is requesting a $150 loan to buy fresh fruit to sell during the festivals of Dashain and Tihar.

loans.use: To buy fresh fruits

loans.name: Djekafo (Soyons Ensemble Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Djekafo sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 23 ans et 3 enfants .Elles vivent dans de familles traditionnelles élargies avec leur mari, des coépouses, les enfants, les beaux frères, les beaux parents et autres parents dans le village de Marka-Coungo (Région de Koulikoro République du Mali)
Ce groupe a opté pour l’achat et la vente des produits cosmétiques, du quinqueliba et quelques fois des condiments alimentaires. Le quinqueliba est une plante qui sert de substitue au café et est utilisé pour ses vertus thérapeutiques. Reconnu et réputé pour la qualité des produits fournis, ce groupe ne cesse d’augmenter le nombre de sa clientèle. Afin donc de maintenir et de satisfaire les besoins cette clientèle, elles décidèrent ensemble de travailler avec le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 4 ans. Après sept prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous correctement remboursés, Djekafo est à son huitième prêt qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 500 boites de pommade, 330 bouteilles de parfums de différentes qualités et une importante quantité de quinqueliba. Elles achètent le quinqueliba dans les villages environnants de Marka-Coungo pour les stocker à domicile et ensuite les revendre à Bamako (capitale de la république de Mali) au comptant à des grossistes.  De retour sur Marka-Coungo elles achètent les produits cosmétiques qui seront vendus à une clientèle féminine au comptant en détail et à crédit au marché de Marka-Coungo et de Fana.
Avec ce prêt elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice de 30 000 FCFA chacune qui sera utilisé essentiellement à renforcer le fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the group Djekafo are married women averaging 23 years of age and three children. They live in traditional extended families with their husband, co-wives, children, brothers-in-law, parents-in-law, and other parents in the village of Marka-Coungo (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali).

This group opted to buy and sell cosmetics, quinqueliba, and sometimes condiments. Quinqueliba is a plant used as a coffee substitute that has therapeutic properties. Renown for the quality of the goods they furnish, this group continuously increases its customer base.

And so, in order to maintain and satisfy these customers, the group members decided together to work with the Soro Yiriwaso loan program four years ago. After seven solidarity loans (group loans), all correctly repaid, the group is on its eighth loan, which will be used to buy 500 containers of ointment, 330 bottles of perfume of different grades, and a sizable quantity of quinqueliba.

They buy the quinqueliba in the villages surrounding Marka-Coungo and stock it at home, and then they resell it for cash in Bamako (capital of Mali) to wholesalers. On the way back to Marka-Coungo, they buy cosmetic products, which will be sold to women, cash or credit accepted, at the marketplaces of Marka-Coungo and Fana.

With this loan, they each hope to realize a profit of 30,000 francs CFA, which will be used essentially to bolster their working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products and some herbal tea.

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.en:
Olimpia is a member of the Confianza (“Trust”) Village Bank. She is 37 years old and has two children. 

She owns a small store in the Carmen Alto neighborhood of Ayacucho, where she sells “salichipapas” (French fries with hot dog slices, a popular local snack). Olimpia is in her last year of studies to be an educational assistant, and hopes to find work soon after getting her degree. 

Olimpia is requesting a loan of 600 soles to pay for the rest of her schooling and to buy ingredients to make salichipapas. 

Olimpia’s goals for the future are to expand her store and to put a solid roof on her house (her current roof is just a sheet of corrugated tin). She also likes to do handicrafts, and she makes her own puppets. She would like to open a store in her home to sell puppets and other educational materials.

loans.use: School fees, potatoes and hot dogs to make "salichipapas"

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es: Segundo tiene 38 años, es padre de un hijo pequeño y vive junto a su conviviente quien lo apoya. Su dedicación al transporte de pasajeros la tiene desde hace dos años atrás. Él es propietario de un motocarro, y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es conocer muchas personas y darles un buen trato es lo primordial, nos menciona. Su actividad le es muy rentable porque él mismo administra las ganancias de su trabajo y le va bien hasta el momento. Es su primer crédito con MFP, comprometiéndose a ser puntual en sus cuotas de pago. Con el dinero solicitado comprará repuestos para la reparación de su motocarro.
texts.en:
Segundo is 38-years old, has a young son and lives with his partner, who helps support him. He owns a motorcycle-rickshaw and has worked in transportation services for two years. What he likes about his job is getting to know different people and above all, providing his customers with good service. His work is very profitable because he manages his earnings himself. It is Segundo’s first loan with MFP, and he promises to be punctual in his repayments. With the money he has requested he will buy spare parts to repair his rickshaw.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for motorcycle-rickshaw

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima K. is 47 years old. She is married and the mother of 6 children. Since she was very young, Salima worked on a small farm, and now, along with her children she works cultivating wheat, corn, and vegetables. When their crop comes in, they transport it to the capital for sale. This activity has helped to pay the economic expenses of her family and give an education to her children.

Today she needs a loan to prepare her land for the upcoming season. With this desire in mind, she asks your consideration to receive her family in your kind heart. She requests 2500 Somoni for the term of 8 months. Salima wants to thank everyone for supporting her and promises to repay the loan on time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Farakhim

texts.en:
Farakhim M. is a 38-year-old trader who sells confections such as candies, chocolate, cookies and other items. He is married and has one adorable daughter who is the meaning of his life. 

Farakhim opened his store in 1999, when he could not find any job in his village and his family stayed without any means of subsistence. Farakhim would like to expand his business and purchase more confections for his store, to increase his income and improve life conditions for his family. For this purpose he applied for a loan of $1200 with 15 months for a term. Your generosity will be very helpful.

loans.use: Purchase confections to resell such as candies, chocolate, cookies and other items

loans.name: Nguyen Thi Hang

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hằng N. năm nay 59 tuổi,  gia đình chị có 3 con đều đã trưởng thành. Anh Nhiên chồng chị là cán bộ hưư trí.  Năm 2006 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương để vay thêm vốn về đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Hiện nay gia đình chị đang chăn nuôi lợn và đây cũng là một trong những nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị bên cạnh  thu nhập từ lương hưu của chồng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 13.000.000đ để mua lợn giống và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Hằng N., 59 years old, has three grown children. Her husband Nhiên is a retired civil servant. In 2006, she became a member of the TYM Fund and used a loan to invest in raising animals. Currently, in addition to the retirement pension of her husband, the family’s main source of income is raising pigs. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 13,000,000 VND (750 USD) to buy breeding pigs and animal feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan K. lives in Hang Heng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer and owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Bou Khim, is a construction worker. His workplace is far from the house, so he usually drives the motorbike to work.

He now wants to change his old motorbike because it is so old and difficult to drive to work. Thus, Mrs. Chan K. requests a loan to purchase a different motorbike for her husband. She is a 39-year-old mother of three children; one is employed in a garment factory, and the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: Purchase a different motorbike for personal use

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es: Yaneth de 27 años es una joven muy alegre, vive en la casa de sus padres, quienes siempre la apoyaron para que pueda sobresalir en la vida, tiene una hija de 4 años, a quien desea darle buenos estudios. Desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, Yaneth está sentada en su puesto, vende quesos en el mercado Santa Bárbara de la ciudad de Juliaca, sus clientes la buscan porque es una vendedora muy carismática y siempre les brinda una sonrisa cuando compra uno de sus deliciosos quesos, aunque es algo tímida, ya que no pudimos lograr que nos brinde una sonrisa para la foto. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, desea hacer progresar su negocio e implementar mejor su puesto. Lo que menos le gusta es tener que soportar el intenso frió que hace dentro del mercado, aun así sabe que tiene que hacer todo lo que esté a su alcance para mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es el primer préstamo de Yaneth con MFP y espera pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere perjudicar a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida, por la alegría que brinda. Con el dinero que está solicitando planea incrementar su capital de trabajo, para así poder implementar mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Yaneth, 27 years old, is a cheerful young woman. She lives in her parents' house, and they have always supported her so she could be successful in life. She has a four-year-old daughter, and hopes to be able to give her a good eduction. From the wee hours of the morning, Yaneth sits at her stall in the Santa Bárbara market in Juliaca, selling cheeses. Her customers seek her out because she is a charismatic saleswoman and always offers them a small when they buy one of her delicious cheeses. She is somewhat shy, though, and we couldn't get her to smile for a photo. She's been working in the market 15 years, and what she likes best about her job is chatting with the women at the neighboring stalls. She wants to develop her business and better supply her stall. What she likes least is withstanding the intense cold inside the market, but she is nevertheless aware that she has to do anything she can to improve her quality of life. This is Yaneth's first loan with MFP, and she hopes to make all her payments on time, since she doesn't want to hurt the other members of her community bank, where she is cherished for the happiness she brings. She will use the requested loan to increase her working capital and be able to better supply her business.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her business capital

loans.name: Essohazi Robert

texts.fr: Ce monsieur  a pour activité le commerce de boissons locales  alcoolisées appelées « DEHA », il exerce ce commerce depuis  2000, son ancienneté fait qu’il maîtrise bien ce commerce, il est marié et père de 02 enfants, c’est cette activité qui lui permet de subvenir aux charges de sa famille. Il prépare lui-même ces boissons à base de palmiers qu'il met dans des bidons. Ainsi son stock de boissons étant épuisé, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 250 palmiers afin de préparer la boisson.
texts.en:
This gentleman’s business involves commerce in local alcoholic drinks called “DEHA”. He has been in this business since 2000. His seniority means that he has a good command of his business. He is married and the father of two. This business is what enables him to provide for his family. He himself makes these drinks from palm trees. He puts the product into drums. Since his stock of drinks is exhausted, he’s requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 250 palm trees in order to make the beverage.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm trees to make drinks

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena was engaged in a vending business located in their town public market of Ilagan, Isabela. in the market, she sells onions, garlic, vegetables, some cooked snacks, etc. Lucena is requesting a loan as working capital for her vending business. According to her, the loan will be of great help to grow her business because she could have more products to sell. Her children, who are already married, are not living with her but she is the one sending her granddaughter to school. She hopes that she will have more income so that she could provide forthe needs of her family and grandchildren if they need her support.

Lucena is already 50 years old. She resides in Barangay Calamagui 1st Ilagan, Isabela, and a place where the old supermarket of Ilagan was situated before. She was married to Andres P. who is a tricycle operator. They are blessed with three childen who were now married, and she has grandchildren.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Jeri Ketut Taman

texts.en: Jero Ketut Taman - (DNR.M-0687) is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Manistutu, Melaya. She is married and has one school-aged child. Jero Ketut Taman owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 300,000 IDR a month. In 2007, Jero Ketut Taman joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to build a shelter for her pigs. Jero Ketut Taman is now requesting a new loan of 3,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. The loan will be her 3rd from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Jero Ketut Taman - (DNR.M-0687) merupakan 35 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 1 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Jero Ketut Taman memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Jero Ketut Taman sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 8 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Jero Ketut Taman menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 IDR sebulan. Dalam 2007, Jero Ketut Taman bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Jero Ketut Taman meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membangun tempat berteduh/kandang bagi ternak peminjam. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 3,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.
