Jero Ketut Taman berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Merlita M., 25 years old, is married with 1 child and lives in Taboo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She has been engaged in this business since her teenage years and now she personally manages her own fish-selling business. At present, she is applying for a loan of PHP 4,000 in addition to her working capital. She aspires to have a successful business with a concrete store and hopes that all of her children can finish a college degree and have a good future.

loans.use: Additional capital for fish retailing.

loans.name: Kieng

texts.en: Mrs. Kieng S. was born in 1957 and she lives in Ou Phut village, in Takeo province. She owns a small grocery store. Her husband, Mr. Haem Pun, owns a piece of land on which he cultivates rice. Now Mrs. Kieng S. is requesting a loan to buy two cows for breeding and to reduce her costs for plowing the fields. This couple has four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others stay at home to do housework and help the parents work. Her husband is presented on the left of picture.

loans.use: To purchase cows for plowing the fields.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is 40 years old and married with two children. She grinds pepper, tomatoes and beans in her house and has been in the business for the past twenty years. With her years of business experience, she is able to attract and retain her customers.

Deborah hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase a grinding machine so that she can meet the demands of her numerous customers. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding machine

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita.
Delfina casada, tiene 42 años y 5 hijos, Delfina vende ropa a pedido que ofrece a amigos y familiares, la mayor parte de sus ventas son al crédito, además compra quesos de la comunidad de Totos y lo vende de casa en casa.
Delfina necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos.
Los sueños de Delfina son que sus hijos sean profesionales y hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Delfina is a member of the Sarita Communal Bank. She is 42 years old, married and has five children. Delfina sells clothing on order that she offers to her friends and family. For the most part, her sales are on credit. She also buys cheeses from the community of Totos and sells them door-to-door. Delfina needs a loan of 600 Sols which she will use to buy cheese. Delfina dreams of her children becoming working professionals and of building up her business.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheese

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her work.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: A local country face of a small family living in the quiet and peaceful village near the town, N., 36, and her partner life Thol, 42, had been married for years and gave birth to four children all of whom are single and live with her except lives separately in Phnom Penh. Family has business of selling rattan cupboard for years and has a good income supported. Recently, the two family leaders agreed to buy a loan from HKL to invest in their business process. They hope that their children will finish university.

loans.use: to invest in their business process.

loans.name: Lourng

texts.en:
Lourng P. is 34 years old and sells fruit in Kampong Cham province. Her business has been around for about four years and she makes US$5 every day, while her husband is a policeman and is able to make US$3 each day.

Selling fruit has been a difficult business as there is high inflation and weather conditions have not been conducive to a good growing season. She is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to reinvest into her own fruit business, increasing her stock of fruit to sell. She sees this investment as an opportunity that will be able to increase her daily income.

loans.use: Reinvest in her fruit business

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin tiene 50 años es un hombre muy trabajador y comprometido con el progreso de su familia, conformada por su esposa y sus 3 hijos, por quienes se sacrifica todos los días por ofrecerles lo mejor.

Desde muy joven le agradó el arte, pero sobretodo la música, por lo que hace 10 años conformó una agrupación junto a algunas amistades con quienes compartía la misma pasión, y se dedicaron tocar en eventos especiales, haciéndose conocidos con el paso del tiempo.
Edwin considera que su actividad musical es muy rentable, pues sólo toca los fines de semana y tiene tiempo para realizar otros trabajos, como algunos servicios a computadora, ganando  ingresos adiciones. 
Para el futuro desea comprar más instrumentos musicales y así seguir mejorando los equipos que sonido que tiene, los cuales son muy necesarios dentro de su trabajo.

Este es su octavo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, él sabe que con su trabajo y con sus pagos puntuales seguirá mejorando su línea de crédito con su banco comunal, del cual es parte desde hace 5 años. Con el dinero que ahora solicita planea comprar otra computadora para seguir trabajando en su casa prestando servicios de mecanografiado a sus vecinos estudiantes.
texts.en:
Edwin is 50 years old and a hardworking man who is committed to his family’s success. He has a wife and three children, for whom he makes sacrifices every day to provide them the best.

Edwin enjoyed art as kid, especially music. Ten years ago, he formed a group with some of his friends who share the same passion. They play at special events and have become well-known over time. Edwin considers his musical career to be very profitable. He only performs on the weekends, so he has time for other jobs, such as providing computer services, in order to earn additional income. In the future, he wants to buy more musical instruments so that he can improve the sound of his existing equipment, which is necessary for his line of work.

This is Edwin’s eighth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. He knows that his work and his timely payments improve the line of credit he has with his Communal Bank, which he has been a member of for the past 5 years. The money he is requesting will be used to buy another computer so that he can continue working from home providing desktop publishing services to students in the neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
According to Elizabeth, being friendly and having a good moral character is necessary in managing a business. Elizabeth is 58 years old and married to Carlito who is a driver. They have four children namely: Lilibeth-29 years old and a college graduate; Andrey-23 years old who graduated from Hotel and Restaurant Management; Kristel-21 years old, a Midwifery graduate; and Rhizel-20 years old who just finished a two-year course.

Elizabeth is managing a sari-sari store in the village of Rizal, Santiago City. She would like to buy additional merchandise but her capital is not enough that’s why she would like to ask KIVA lenders for a loan amounting to Php 5,000, allowing her to purchase more merchandise to sell.

loans.use: additional capital for her general store's  improvement

loans.name: Aniceto

texts.es:
Aniceto es un hombre de campo que tiene 55 años, vive con su esposa (Donata), de 53 años, y con sus 3 hijos ya mayores; Jaime, Maritza y Juan, en su acogedora casa cerca de su chacra. 

Bajo el cielo azul de la sierra peruana este hombre trabajador siembra papa -tubérculo peruano- de distintas variedades, desde que era muy joven lo aprendió de sus padres. Él trabaja en su chacra con la colaboración de toda su familia, porque el trabajo en esta parte del país es en equipo, así lo aprendió, porque así se traspasan las costumbres de generación en generación, y aún en la actualidad son practicadas, además todos los agricultores saben que así se avanza más rápido. Paralelo a ello, Aniceto también cría ganado ovino que comercializa en los mercados cercanos a su casa.  Él considera a la agricultura como un trabajo rentable porque le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia, además tiene la oportunidad de construir su casa, es por eso que continúa trabajando diariamente, pues quiere dar lo mejor de sí, y eso lo logrará trabajando hasta alcanzar sus metas. 
En el futuro, espera intensificar la crianza de ganado ovino y para ello desea invertir el préstamo que solicita en vitaminas para estos animales y garantizar su crianza, asimismo desea comprar abono e insecticidas para fumigar sus chacras y obtener una buena cosecha.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y siempre se la ha considerado como un hombre honesto que cumple con el pago de sus cuotas, además está conforme con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque a todos los integrantes los conoce desde hace mucho tiempo y sabe que son gente responsable.
texts.en:
Aniceto is a 55-year old farmer who lives with his wife (Donata), 53 years old, and their 3 older children, Jaime, Maritza and Juan, in their home near their farm. Under the blue sky of the Peruvian mountainside, this hard-working man plants potatoes – a Peruvian tuber – of different varieties. He learned farming from his parents at a young age. He works on the farm with the help of the entire family, because the work in this part of the country is done as a team. This is how he himself learned, and it is a tradition passed on from generation to generation that is still practiced to this day. Also, all the farmers know that this is the way to advance quicker. Concurrently to planting his crops, Aniceto also raises sheep that he then sells in the nearby markets. He considers agriculture to be a profitable endeavor, because is has allowed him to sustain his family and improve their standard of living. It also gave him the opportunity to build a house, which is why he continues to work on a daily basis. He wants to give the best of himself, and he will accomplish this by continuing to work hard and meeting his goals. In the future, he would like to expand his livestock, which is why he requests a loan to invest in vitamins for these animals so they grow healthy. He would also like to buy fertilizers and insecticides for his farmlands, so he can achieve a successful harvest. This is his third loan with MFP, and he has always been considered an honest man who complies with his installment payments. He is also satisfied with his cooperative bank’s work because he has known all the members for quite some time, and knows that they are responsible people.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticides, and vitamins for his animals.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia L. is an old woman by age, but strong and healthy. She is capable of running her own business to earn money, which she uses to support her mother and her own family. Since 2008 she has been requesting loans through her membership in ASHI, KIVA's field partner in the Philippines. Thos loans have made her productive by growing a business. All throughout her membership, she has showed very good performance in repayment and attendance during weekly center meeting. She enjoys the camaraderie of her fellow members in ASHI as well as the input about managing a small business she learned from them.

With a much larger amount of business capital in addition to the knowledge she has learned from her fellow small entrepreneurs, Eufemia would be able to enhance the growth of her business, with the help of her husband and a 46-year-old child who is a laborer and lives with her. Therefore, at this point of her membership in ASHI, she is requesting a certain amount based on the need of her business and her capacity to pay back.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and other commodities to sell in her variety store

loans.name: Eugénie

texts.fr: G. Eugénie est née le 22 Mars 1949 et réside depuis environs 16 ans à Davatin à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Eugénie est mariée à BOSSOU Vincent, un agent retraité de la CIMBENIN. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés, dont quatre sont à leur charge. Eugénie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Eugénie n’a fait que l’école primaire. Pour contribuer à assurer les charges familiales, Eugénie mène comme activité, la vente de divers produits (fournitures scolaires, sardines, tomates en boîtes, oeufs, épices, cigarettes, sandalettes, bougies, etc.) à son domicile. Eugénie vend également du bois de chauffage à son domicile. Eugénie s’approvisionne à ONAB et à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Eugénie exerce cette  activité depuis environs 12 ans, et est à son cinquième crédit à ALIDé. Eugénie a bien remboursés les quatre crédits qu’elle avait obtenus de ALIDé. Eugénie sollicite un cinquième crédit afin d’agrandir davantage son activité et de la diversifier par l’acquisition d’autres produits de divers, pour mieux répondre à la demande des clients.
texts.en:
G. Eugénie was born on March 22, 1949 and has been living in Davatin in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for about 16 years. Eugénie is married to BOSSOU Vincent, a retired employee of CIMBENIN. The couple has 5 children, all attending school, of whom 4 still depend on their parents. Eugénie lives together with her husband and children. The couple share in supporting the family.

Eugénie only got as far as primary school. To contribute to covering family expenses, she sells various items (school supplies, sardines, tinned tomatoes, eggs, spices, cigarettes, flip-flops, candles, etc.) out of her house. She also sells firewood out of her house. Eugénie buys her merchandise at ONAB and at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has worked at these businesses for 12 years and is on her 5th loan with ALIDé. She reimbursed the four preceding loans from ALIDé in a timely manner. Eugénie is requesting a 5th loan so as to expand her businesses and diversify by acquiring various other items, so that she can better respond to her customers' needs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various products (school supplies, 8 cases of tinned goods, 10 trays of eggs etc.)

loans.name: Yrma

texts.es:
La Sra. Yrma, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martin, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 50 años  y es madre D. 02 hijos, que aun dependen D. ella.

Su carácter y su anhelo D. cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio D. venta D. abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desD. su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa. Hoy en día, cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su casa, a comprar porque en ella encuentran todo los productos que el ama D. casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atienD.  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas D. pescado en cajas y en variedad D. marcas, huevos en javas y artículos D. higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Yrma, se siente muy bien para continuar trabajando y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades D. desarrollarse en el medio donD. se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Yrma belongs to the Esmeralda Comunal Bank in the Tarapoto District, San Martin Province, Region of San Martin. She is married, is 50 years old and has 2 children who she still supports. Her character and her desire to fulfill her dreams motivated her to launch her own business selling groceries, with whose profits she contributes to the household income. From when she started until today, Yrma has been gaining customers. Her business is located in her house. Today, Yrma has many regular customers who come to her house daily to make purchases, because there they find all the products that a housewife needs and someone who waits on them personally with her characteristic charisma. With this loan of 2,500 soles, she will buy bags of rice and sugar, crackers, noodles, packets of salt, milk and boxes of various brands of canned fish, cartons of eggs and personal hygiene products, in order to continue giving the best service to her customers. Yrma is very happy to continue working and is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her and other women like her to have opportunities to develop in the areas in which they work.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Eldridge, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries to expand her products

loans.name: Balyesiima Group, Mpigi

texts.en:
K. Ssaka is the leader of his lending group in Mpigi. He is a hard-working man and married with 30 children, out of which 15 are still in school, as he takes care of orphans for his late brothers.

Ssaka is a multi-business man who is a farmer, he buys and sells coffee, he owns ginger and banana plantations, he buys and sells cows for meat, he has taxis for a transportation system, and he has rental houses as well as a retail shop. 

He is so proud to mention that he is able to do all that he does because he has been using loans from the Kiva field partner, Pearl Microfinance, for over thirteen years. The loans have also helped him to pay school fees for his children. He has also taught his children about running a business, and two of them now go to Dubai for merchandise. 

Ssaka needs a loan to help with repairing his car by buying an engine.

loans.use: Buying a car engine for better transport services.

loans.name: Gull Mursal Group

texts.en: This is the Gull Mursal group, comprised of three female members led by 33-year-old Nasreen.   Nasreen wants to take a loan for her brother, who sells second-hand dresses and clothes. With this loan he wants to complete his stocks. The second member of  the group is Bibi Maryam who wants to take a loan for her husband, who has a shop that sells bicycles. With this loan he wants to buy some necessary things for his shop. The last member is Fahima, who wants to take a loan for her brother who has a general store. With this loan he wants to buy more foods and tools for his store. They all are happy about this process of small loans in Afghanistan and other poor countries and thank all lenders from both Kiva and AFS.

loans.use: To complete store stocks

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta B. is from the village of   Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 47 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Julieta makes and sells food, snacks and delicacies in her local community. Julieta has been in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Julieta joined HSPFI to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI to expand her business.  Julieta is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to invest in her business.
----------------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Expanding the business

loans.name: Hilary

texts.en:
Like other farmers in his town, Hilary depends on his rice farm to earn a living. He is 27 years old and is married with a 1-year-old child. His family depends on him so he works hard to be able to cope with the needs in his household. He also wants to start saving this early for his child’s education.

Hilary sought the help of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to gain financial assistance for his farm. He applied for a loan of Php 14,000 which he would use to supply his farm with seed, fertilizer and other inputs. Hopefully, this loan will help Hilary earn more.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Terisita

texts.en:
51-year-old Terisita has been in the fishing business since 1990. She wants a loan to provide the materials she needs in her business. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and currently she is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP.

Terisita has seven children and she wants them to be educated. She hopes to provide them with school supplies and to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Prema

texts.en:
Prema is a 48-year-old married woman and lives with her husband, one daughter, and son.  She works hard and places her priority on operating her business.

Prema's business involves making carpets, and she has a lot of experience with this type of business. Currently, she makes only thirty carpets per day. There is strong competition in her area for selling carpets, because Hikkaduwa is a popular tourist destination.  There is a strong demand from foreign tourists for 'prefix carpets' (carpet mats stitched together from previously discarded textiles). Prema's husband helps her by delivering and selling them to customers, which greatly helps the business.

Prema has requested a 40,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka which she will use to buy raw materials and develop the carpet business.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for carpet business

loans.name: We Are One Group

texts.en:
Mae-Mae N. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called We Are One. She is 42 years old, single, and has two children who are 15 and 21 years old. She was only able to attend school through the 12th grade.

For five years, she has been selling soap and drinks on Mechlin Street, downtown Monrovia, Liberia.  She sells in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning. She plans to use her 9,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 43,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more soap and drinks. Her goal is to grow her business and to continue supporting her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mae-Mae is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more soap and drinks.

loans.name: G.. Rios De Agua Viva Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Ríos De Agua Viva está conformado por Ebelia de 43 años y Jaime Antonio de 26 años por lo que juntos han sabido salir adelante, a pesar de las diferentes actividades económicas Ebelia se dedica a una pulpería por lo que tiene más de 12 años de tener este negocio porque siempre se ha preocupado por proporcionarle a sus hijos los estudios necesarios, en el caso de Jaime él se dedica a la venta de carne y pollo, pues tiene 3 años de tener esta actividad, por lo que no ha sido muy fácil mantener a su hijos y familia. Ambos son personas muy responsables por lo que están solicitando este financiamiento para capital de trabajo  para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Ríos De Agua Viva" is made up of Ebelia, 43, and Jaime Antonio, 26, because together they have known how to get ahead in spite of their different economic activities. Ebelia has had a grocery store for more than 12 years, because she has always worried about providing her children with the education they need. Jaime has 3 years of experience selling chicken and beef, as it has not been very easy to support his children and family. They are both responsible people, and they are requesting this loan to use as working capital to buy raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Al visitar este banco comunal Mateo Pumacahua conversamos con el socio Fredy, tiene 39 años,  es casado,  vive en la ciudad de Chinchero del Departamento del Cusco, su actividad principal es vender artesanía a los turistas que vienen a visitar las ruinas de la ciudad de chincheros y el y su esposa aprovechan para vender sus productos. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, el ser socio de la fundación le ha ayudado mucho a superarse y hacer que su negocio crezca, con este nuevo crédito requiere comprar más artesanía como por ejemplo chompas, chalinas, fajas y mucho más.
texts.en:
The staff of Asociación Arariwa visited with the Mateo Pumacahua Communal Bank and spoke with Fredy. He is 39 years old, married, and lives in the city of Chinchero in the Department of Cusco. His main business activity is selling handicrafts to tourists who come visit the ruins in the city of Chinchero. He and his wife take advantage of this opportunity to sell these products. They have been in business for several years and have done very well thanks to the effort they put into their work. Being a member of Asociación Arariwa has helped him greatly to improve and make his business grow.

With this new loan, Fredy plans to buy more handicrafts such as sweaters, scarves, belts, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase handmade sweaters, scarves, belts, and other items to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy V. is from the village of  Consuelo, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 29 years old. Nancy is married and has 3 school-aged children. Nancy owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells food & daily use products. Nancy has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Nancy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nancy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nancy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase the required tools

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
K. Nargiza has a successful business selling high quality clothes for children. She is a very experienced entrepreneur who has been in business for seven years. She offers her customers polite service, reasonable prices and quality products. Nargiza is divorced and has three children. She has requested a loan of 4000 TJS to increase her business capital. This loan will allow her to continue investing in her business and pursue her future goals of expanding and opening new sales locations.    

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit:  www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase children's clothing for resale

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
La señora Clorinda R. V.,  tiene 28  años de edad, viven en la Comunidad de Polígono de la  Provincia de Mizque del Departamento de Cochabamba, tiene tres hijo, el padre de sus hijos fue a trabajar a Europa hace 5 años y desde que se fue no se volvió a saber más de él.  Ella está muy apenada por el abandono del padre de sus hijos y ella sola tiene que mantener, cuidar y alimentar a sus tres hijos.

La señora Clorinda es muy querida y respetada en el lugar donde vive, por lo dedicada a sus hijos  y a su trabajo. Trabaja todos los días como ayudante en las cosechas de sus vecinos para ganar algunos pesos y así mantener a sus hijos, ella está solicitando el crédito para   abrir un negocio de tienda de verduras en el pueblo y de esta manera tener un mejor ingreso económico y  darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y puedan asistir a la escuela  en mejores condiciones.  El crédito ayudara mucho a sus hijos y a ella en el duro trabajo que realiza.
texts.en:
Sra. Clorinda R. V. is 28 years old and lives with her three children in the community of Polígano in Mizque Province, Department of Cochabamba. The father of her children left five years ago to find work in Europe, but she has not heard anything from him since he left and does not know if he will return. She is saddened that he abandoned her and her children. Now she must support, care for, and feed her three children by herself.

Sra. Clorinda is admired and respected in the area where she lives because of her dedication to her children and her work. She works every day by helping in neighbors’ fields so that she can earn some money to support her children. Clorinda is requesting a loan to open a vegetable business in town. This will enable her to have more income so that she can provide her children with a better quality of life and the opportunity to attend a school with better conditions. The loan will be a great help with the hard work she puts in to benefit herself and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to start a vegetable business

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; este banco esta situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria, L a socia tiene 31años de edad, ella es soltera y es contadora de profesión, La socia está a punto de poner un estudio contable y requiere el préstamo para pagar los alquileres.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su estudio contable (alquileres).   
     
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “United for Success” this bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Maria, she is 31 years old, she is single and an accountant. The member is about to begin studying an accounting course and needs the loan to pay the fees. The member needs the loan to invest in her accounting studies.

The member is grateful and values the loan given to her through this medium and is equally committed to meet with the payments of her quotas in the time period established.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member needs the loan to invest in her accounting studies.

loans.name: Pedrito

texts.en: Pedrito Crescencio, a 54-year-old married father of four children, is from Sto. Niño, South Cotabato, where he supports his family through farming. Pedrito has great dreams for his children, the reason he works hard tilling his land. He is now requesting a loan to help purchase his farm inputs including seedlings, fertilizer and farm tools. The additional income accruing from the business will go to his children’s education, family consumption and savings for their future.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings, fertilizer and farm tools

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is divorced. She runs a small business selling plumbing, cutting, welding and other supplies at the central market in Beregovo town. Elizabeth started this business 4 years ago. She learned fast that a large variety and small prices are key factors in her business. This business is the only source of income for Elizabeth.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnas to purchase assorted inventories. She would spend additional income to improve her living conditions. Elizabeth lives with her son in a small apartment.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Idrissa Mohamed

texts.en: This is 32-year-old Idrissa. He is divorced and has one child, aged 12. He has five additional dependents who live with him for school assistance. In 2004, Idrissa established his cosmetics business to take care of himself and his family. Working six days a week, 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,269,000 every month. Idrissa travels to nearby Guinea to buy his products at least twice per month. He would like a loan Le 4,000,000 to buy body lotion, Colgate toothpaste, perfume, and body white. Idrissa hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profit by approximately Le 253,800. In the future, Idrissa plans to build a house and educate his child to university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional cosmetics

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface A. O. is 28 years old and married. His wife stays in the house to take care of house chores while Boniface goes out every day to work at their business, which is located at a busy market called Khayega in Kakamega. Kakamega is the region in Kenya known for production of sugar cane and it's widely known as the sugar belt region. He makes and sells doughnuts and chapatis to the local people. He has been in this business for the last 10 years now. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are many other people in the area doing the same kind of business as his, so customers are not loyal as they are spoilt for choice. He is also financially constrained. However, he works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy an oven to expand his business and be able to sell more to his customers. He hopes to open a mini-bakery in the future. He describes himself as determined, focused and self-motivated.

loans.use: To purchase an oven

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine B. is from the village of Brgy. Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 56 years old. Josephine is married and has 5 adult-aged children. 

To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Josephine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Josephine is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Josephine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products for resale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 23 years old and married. She graduated from preparatory school. She will use this loan to develop her business and purchase another sewing machine, cloth and ribbons. The borrower’s high character and experience helped her to gain lot of clients. She is a skilled lady in sewing women's fashions in various styles. This loan will help her to raise her family’s income.

loans.use: For purchasing a sewing machine & cloth

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.es:
Bernardino es un padre de familia de 36 años de edad que reside junto  a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Jayanca, una zona agrícola de pobladores humildes y trabajadores que se encuentra ubicada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de seis años a la venta de helados de manera ambulante, para realizar su actividad se vale de un carrito. Sus zona de venta son su mismo distrito y los sectores aledaños a la zona en donde vende. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad el se encarga de sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Bernardino desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más helado de modo que puedas satisfacer le demanda de sus clientes durante la temporada de verano. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500.
texts.en:
Bernardino is a 36 year old father living with his wife and two children in Jayanca district, a farming area inhabited by humble and hard working people that is located over an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

For over six years he has been a street vendor of frozen treats.  To do this he avails himself of a small ice cream cart.  His sales zone is his same district and the areas neighboring where he lives.  Income from this activity allows him to support his family.

Bernardino would like to expand his business buying more ice cream to meet customer demand during the summer season.  He has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 500.

loans.use: To buy more frozen treats.

loans.name: Tadeo Uber

texts.es:
Tadeo de 36 años, es licenciado en educación desde hace varios años trabaja en un centro de desarrollo en las mañana. El quiere seguir prosperando para darle un buen futuro a su familia (en la foto aparece toda su familia). 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas) vive con su esposa y dos hijos pequeños. Ha trabajado durante dos años en el centro de desarrollo manteniendo a su familia con su sueldo pero uno de sus objetivos siempre ha sido tener su propio negocio. 

El préstamo lo quiere utilizar para construir en la parte delantera de su casa un local dirigido para una papelería ya que quiere que su esposa también tenga la oportunidad de trabajar comprando cemento, bloques, pintura. En el futuro quiere que el negocio que inicie sea conocido y así poderle dar un buen futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Tadeo is 36 years old and has a degree in education.  For a few years, he has worked in a development center in the morning.  He would like to continue doing well to provide a good future for his family (who are all in the picture).  

He lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil in Paraíso (a peri-urban area with dirt roads and the houses are located in the mountains) with his wife and two young children.  He has worked for two years at a development center and supported his family with his income, but one of his goals has always been to have his own business.

He would like to use this loan to build a stationary store in the front part of his house so that his wife also has the opportunity to work.  He needs to buy cement, bricks, and paint.  In the future, he would like the business they are started to be well-known so that he can give his children a good future.

loans.use: Purchase cement and bricks to build a stationary store

loans.name: Yokasi

texts.en: Yokasi is a sixty year old, ambitious man, married to a teacher with six children. They live in a permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda. His dream is to set up a steady income generating activity for the family .He deals in lumber and has been in business for ten years and it is still reaping great benefits.Yokasi needs the loan to buy trees to cut up for lumber.

loans.use: Buying trees for lumber.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina G. is from the town of Panglao. She is 30 years old. Gina is married and has three young children. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products to the local community. Gina says she wishes to have her own savings.

Gina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Gina is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old, married and has two children. 

In 2009, Amjad opened his own business changing cars’ oil. He sells a wide variety of types of oil and he works at changing the oil, too. He is well known in his local area and has a good reputation.

He is requesting a $1800 loan to extend his shop. He is planning to grow and develop his work.

loans.use: Extend his shop

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CHASKA ÑAHUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marcelina; la socia tiene 51 años de edad, casada y tiene 8 hijos; la socia se dedica a cuidar  un anciano de la tercera edad ,la socia se encarga de su alimentación y salud , la socia lleva un buen tiempo en este trabajo el cual le gusta ya que puede ayudar a una persona que lo necesita, la socia es una persona alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante por su familia, la socia necesita el préstamo ya que empieza el colegio y ella necesita para los útiles escolares de sus hijos y para sus matriculas.

La socia solicita el préstamo para su uso personal como son los utilies escolares de sus hijos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a member of the “CHASKA ÑAHUI” communal bank located in Cusco district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is 51 years old, married and has 8 children.  She works caring for a senior citizen; she is in charge of his nutrition and health.  She’s been in this job for some time now and likes it because she can help someone who needs help.  She is a cheerful person with a strong drive to get ahead for her family.  She needs a loan because the school term is about to start and she needs it for her children’s school supplies and tuition.

She is asking for a personal use loan to buy her children’s school supplies.  She is happy with the loan and commits to pay her installments.

loans.use: To buy school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en: Petronila is a 62-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  Transportation (Passenger Jeep) and a general store. She lives in Siaton, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,500. Petronila is borrowing PHP 14,000 to buy spare parts to maintain the jeep and merchandise to sell in the general store. This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Petronila aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: To  buy spare parts to maintain her Jeep and purchase merchandise to sell in the general store

loans.name: Namsraijav

texts.en:
Namsraijav D., 52, is married and lives with her husband, son and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in someone's backyard. 

Her husband is unemployed and her son has a health problem because of a car accident. They used to live in an apartment and sold it to help their son go to work in Korea. Their son had a car accident when he came back from Korea. 

Namsraijav began selling women's lingerie in 2003 and operated two stalls that she owned. Then she had to sell one of her two stalls when her son had the accident. 

Now her son is getting much better after a long treatment and she wants to operate her business properly. Her current stall is located at a crowded market. Her daily gross income is 80,000 MNT and her current working capital exceeds 3,000,000 MNT. She goes to China once or twice a month depending on the sales. 

She is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase more items to sell in her business, and also to repair her ger.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Marcelina's Group

texts.en:
Marcelina B. is from the village of Cutog GranD., Reina Mercedes, Isabela. She is 41 years old. Marcelina is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marcelina is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Marcelina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Marcelina has been engaged in her business for over 38 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP every three months.

In 2010, Marcelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Marcelina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This is the 3rd loan taken out by Marcelina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Segundo Rafael

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 49 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos en en el distrito de Picsi, ubicado a treinta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la Región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace más de 10 años, el trabaja para un  Compañía Agrícola donde realiza esta actividad junto a otras personas, el se traslada de su casa a esta compañía en una bicicleta llevando sus herramientas, adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de animales. 

Segundo desea adquirir nuevas herramientas para su trabajo  que le permita realizar mejor su trabajo y con rapidez, asi también herramientas para sus hijos que también se dedican a esta actividad. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Segundo, age 49, is married and lives with his wife and three children in the district of Picsi, located 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For more than 10 years, he has worked as an agricultural laborer for a farming company, where he carries out his job along with other persons. He travels from his house to this job by bicycle carrying his tools. In addition, he is engaged in raising animals.

Segundo wants to acquire new tools for his work. This will allow him to carry out his work better and faster. He also wants tools for his children, who also are involved in this job. That’s why he has seen the need of applying to Epydme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 new soles.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his agricultural work.

loans.name: Elsa Celina

texts.es: Celina es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ropa por catalogo desde hace 6 años, dice que emprendió el negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y también por que a ella le gusta tener su propio dinero. Doña Celina vende sus productos a personas que son conocidas ya que les vende en pagos, ya que mucha gente le ha quedado mal y ha tenido perdidas de mercancía y perdidas de ganancias. Comenta que sale a surtir a la cuidad de Toluca o a México, ya que aya le dan buenos precios y así puede ganarle un poco mas a sus zapatos y a la ropa. Ella esta agradecida por su préstamo que le otorgaron ya que así puede tener una fuente de empleo y así darles a sus hijas una buena calidad de vida. Ella esta casada con el señor Enrique el cual es operador de maquinaria pesada y tiene dos hijas estudiantes de primaria, la meta que tiene la señora Celina es comprarse un carro propio para poder trasladarse con su mercancia.
texts.en: Celina is a very hard-working and enterprising woman. She has been selling shoes and clothing through catalogs for six years. She says that she took on the business to help her husband with the costs of the house, and also because she likes to have her own money. Celina sells her products to people she knows since she sells to them on credit. Many people have treated her poorly and she has had merchandise lost and lost income. She comments that she goes out to the city of Toluca or to Mexico to stock up, since they give her good prices there. In this way she can get a little bit more shoes and clothes. She is thankful for the loan that has been given to her. This way she can have a source of employment and also give her daughters a good quality of life. She is married to Enrique who is a heavy machinery operator. She has two daughters in elementary school. Celina's goal is to buy her own cart to be able to get around with her merchandise.

loans.use: to sell footwear through a catalog.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: Juana Maria se dedica a la venta de leña, bananos y hielo. Tiene más de 11 años con su negocio, por lo que disfruta de tener un ingreso diario. Su negocio lo inicio con el objetivo de ayudar a su hijo que necesita vestimenta, educación y alimento. Es una persona muy tranquila y disfruta de tener este medio de vida para poder sobrevivir. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de leña, bananos y bolsas para hacer hielo. Sueña con mejorar sus ingresos cada día de una manera muy humilde y luchadora.
texts.en:
Juana Maria sells firewood, bananas and ice. She has been running this business for more than 11 years, so she has daily income. She began the business to help her son, who needs clothing, education and food.

Juana María is a very calm person, and she enjoys having this means to get by. The loan she is asking for will be used to buy firewood, bananas and bags for making ice. She dreams of increasing her income each day in a humble and hardworking way.

loans.use: to buy wood, bananas and bags for making ice

loans.name: Lorina

texts.en:
Lorina is 25 years old and married. She has two children, aged 3 and 2. 

Lorina is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She primarily grows rice to sell. Lorina has requested a loan and plans to use it to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for this loan to help improve her harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en: Bayarmaa is 26 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her daughters, who haven't reached school age, stay home. With the help of her husband, she manages a clothes and grocery-product trading business between Ulaanbaatar city and her sum (a subdivision of a province). She sells all kinds of grocery items and a variety of clothes for all ages. She started her business in 2005 and is planning to expand her business in the future. She collects orders from her customers and her husband transports the ordered products from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They purchase their products four or five times a month from Ulaanbaatar city. With their business earnings, they bought a car and a plot of land where they live now. She is a polite and open-minded woman who says, "I am planning to conduct my business in the center of province." She is requesting a 3,500,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase more grocery products for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony has been farming in Nyamira, South Rift, Kenya, for the last 20 years. His farm produces maize, beans, bananas and milk with the help of one farmhand. He sells to the local market. He is married with six children, three of whom are still schooling.

Antony has made a loan request for 46,800 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the loan will help him improve his family's standard of living by proving food and generating additional income to meet other needs. Antony hopes to run a retail shop and expand his number of dairy cows to four. Antony sees lack of finances as the challenge, since farmers are not able to buy farming inputs like fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina, de 43 años, es una mujer soltera y trabajadora, que vive en compañía de su mamá Julia, de 77 años, a la que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. El trabajo de Marcelina, es la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de comestibles, donde todas las mañanas desde muy temprano abre sus puertas para comercializarlos a los pobladores de su localidad; pero como ella es una mujer muy activa, por la tarde se dirige a sus cultivos de papa, maíz y arveja, los cuales cuida desde hace 20 años. En todo este tiempo pudo aprender no solo las técnicas de cultivo, sino  también a comercializar sus cosechas a buen precio. En el mercado mayorista de su ciudad, siempre es la que más ventas tiene, pero el pasatiempo de ella es cuidar de sus animales entre carneros y  vacas   Ahora Marcelina, desea aumentar la cantidad de vacas que tiene para poder incursionar en  la elaboración de queso. Sabe que con la ayuda de su banco comunal lo logrará; por que son personas integras y sobre todo responsables. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Pioneros de Cumutay” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además se compromete en pagar de manera puntual con sus cuotas. Marcelina de obtener su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja, varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales y en la contrata de peones para que le ayuden a comenzar su siembra con éxito.
texts.en: Marcelina, age 43, is a single and hard-working woman who lives with her mother, Julia, age 77. She cares for her mother in her own home, located in the hamlet of Cumutay. Marcelina sells basic staples in her store, where she opens her doors every morning very early to sell to the residents of her area. Since she is a very active woman, in the afternoons she takes care of her potato, corn and pea crops, which she has done for 20 years. In this time she was able to learn not only the techniques of cultivation, but also how to sell her crops at a good price. In her city's wholesale market, she is always the one with the most sales. Her hobby is caring for her animals-rams and cows. Now, Marcelina wants to increase her quantity of cows in order to be able to start making cheese. She knows that with her communal bank's help she will achieve this goal; they are upright and, above all, responsible people. She belongs to the "Los Pioneros de Cumutay" communal bank, and this is her ninth loan with MFP. She hopes for your collaboration in order to continue with her goals. She also promises to pay all of her quotas on time. Marcelina, with your support, will invest the requested money in the purchase of two bags of pea seeds and several bags of natural fertilizers, and in contracting labourers to help her to start sowing with success.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of pea seeds and bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for textiles.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
La señora Eliana tiene 33 años, solo estudio la preparatoria y es madre soltera de un niño de 3 años de edad que asiste al preescolar y una niña de 9 años que asiste a la primaria de su comunidad.
Ella nos platica que desde muy pequeña su madre le enseño a trabajar pero ahora que es madre soltera tiene que trabajar mas duro para poder sacar a sus hijos adelante, ella nos platica que todos los dias realiza ventas de fruta de temporada, frituras, semillas, cacahuates, en una pequeña mesa que saca todos los dias al frente de su casa que da la calle, ella nos dice que se vende muy bien pero cuando baja la venta hecha en una bolsa lo que vende y sale a venderlo casa por casa tambien nos platica que todas las tarde sale a vender a otra comunidad la fruta que este de temporada, ahorita hace bolsas de nanches las cuales vende a 10 pesos y nos dice que se vende muy bien.
Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de bolsas desechables, semillas, frituras, fruta, cacahuates, chile en polvo, chamoy y limones, para poder realizar su venta y asi vender sus productos.
Ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere ya que desea dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y poder pagar los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Eliana is 33 years old and only completed high school.  She is a single mother of a 3-year-old son who is in preschool and a 9-year-old daughter who goes to elementary school in their community.

She tells us that her mother taught her to work at a young age but now that she is a single mother, she has to work harder in order to get her children ahead.  She also tells us that she sells seasonal fruit, fried foods, seeds and peanuts at a small table she puts in front of her house facing the street every day.  Her sales are good but when they drop, she puts what she sells into a bag and goes door to door.  She also goes every afternoon to another community to sell fruit in season.  She now prepares bags of nance which she sells at 10 Mexican Pesos (MXN) and she says that they sell well.

She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of disposable bags, seeds, fried foods, fruit, peanuts, chili powder, chamoy and lemons in order to make sales and sell her products.  She hopes that her business will prosper with this loan, as she wants to provide her family with a better quality of life and be able to pay for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to sell fruits and fried food.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Chanthorn (pictured here), 26, is a garment worker. She lives with her brother and widowed mother, who is a rice farmer in a suburb of Phnom Penh City. 

Chanthorn is asking for a loan of $200 to help with her mother’s farming business by purchasing seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.use: To help with her mother’s farming business by purchasing seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene is 24 years old and single. She has been running a retail shop for the past three years, with a monthly income of KES 5,500, which she uses to support her siblings and parents. 

She is applying for her sixth loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Magdalene will use the loan to buy sugar, rice, wheat flour and maize meal to add to her shop to sell.

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will expand her shop. Her hope and dream is to open a wholesale shop, which will cater to her basic needs and those of her siblings.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, wheat flour and maize meal to add to her shop

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 33 years old and single. Nancy works very hard.

Nancy runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her store.

Nancy has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, detergent and other groceries. 

In the future, Nancy would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her store

loans.name: Nestor Jacobo

texts.es: Néstor Jacobo tiene 31 años es casado tiene un hijo vive con su esposa. El se dedica a la venta de medicamentos, pues siempre ha sido una persona muy dedica y al mismo tiempo siempre ha trabajado para proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios. El crédito lo solicita para comprar vitaminas, suplementos, jarabes, pomadas, gel entre otros. El crédito le ayudara como apoyo para mejorar su negocio. Uno de sus mayores desafíos ha sido el complacer a sus clientes en brindarles lo que le solicitan. Su sueño es obtener otro negocio en donde pueda generar más ganancias a su hogar.
texts.en: Néstor Jacobo is 31 years old, married and has a child.  He lives with his wife.  He sells medicines for a living.  He has always been a very dedicated person and has worked to provide his family with the necessary income.  He is requesting a loan to buy vitamins, supplements, syrups, ointments and other things.  The loan will help him to improve his business.  One of his greatest challenges has been accommodating his customers and being able to offer them what they request.  His dream is to obtain another business so he can generate more income for his household.

loans.use: purchase vitamins, supplements, syrups, ointments and other products.

loans.name: Dorie

texts.en: Dorie is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated and has one child. Dorie has a beauty shop that provides haircuts, pedicures and manicures. She has had this business for 3 years. She is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy materials needed for her beauty salon. Dorie has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Dorie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 36-year-old Lebanese, single man living with one parent and a sibling. His business income is important because it helps his family to pay for living expenses. He has eleven years of experience working in furniture manufacturing. Today he is the proud owner of his shop. He is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renew his business tools and purchase equipment that is needed. He notes that these purchases will help him expand his work and increase his business productivity. In the future, he is planning to produce new and modern furniture.

loans.use: to renew his business tools and purchase equipment

loans.name: Clotilde Marina

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica departamento de León, a la señora Clotilde  le apasiona el trabajo de maestra de primaria dirigiendo un pequeño colegio del municipio, dedicándose a esa labor desde hace varios años.

La señora Clotilde requiere mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda por lo que ha tomado la decisión de acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como cerámica, cemento y pago de la mano de obra para realizar las mejora en dicha vivienda.

Ella se siente muy contenta porque espera que el crédito le beneficie grandemente y de esta forma lograr todas sus metas propuestas para ella y su amada familia.
texts.en:
Clotilde loves working as an elementary school teacher heading a small municipal school in the town of Telica in León Department; she’s been doing this work for several years.

Clotilde needs to do some home improvements so has decided to ask Ceprodel for a loan to buy building materials and supplies like tile and cement and to pay labor costs to carry out this home improvement project.

She feels very happy because she hopes that the loan will be of great benefit for her so that she can reach all the goals she’s set for herself and her beloved family.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Jack

texts.en:
Jack is a 31-year-old man from Kisumu City, Western Kenya. He is married to Silvia and they have three children.

Jack operates an electronics stall selling electrical items like power extensions, bulb holders, torches and much more. He has been in this business for the last two years. He makes a monthly income of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

Recently, he joined KADET LTD  and has been awarded a first loan of 20,000 KES which he will use to buy more stock of electrical items for sale like torches and power extensions. Jack will use the additional income to expand his business since he has a hope of opening a big electronics shop in Kisumu City.

loans.use: to buy stock of electrical goods for sale.

loans.name: Magalys

texts.es: Magaly D. 60 años es una mujer casada que tiene 2 hijos en las edades D. 34 y 37 años. Su negocio es la elaboración y comercialización D. manualidades como bolsos, bufandas, muñecos D. trapos, aunque  también venD.  perfumes, cosméticos y todo los que sus clientes le soliciten y ella tenga el capital suficiente para ser oportuna con sus pedidos. Su negocio lo inició en el año 1991, antes fue empleada en empresa privada y cuando dejó D. hacerlo decidió emprender su  propia  aventura  D. negocios. Sus clientes iniciales fueron sus familiares y vecinos,   gradualmente estos fueron remitiéndole otros compradores y con ello ha logrado extender sus líneas D. productos, así como también su cobertura espacial. Algunos D. sus productos los elabora ella misma y otros los compra o le agrega valor con sus propias manos porque es muy creativa. En la actualidad se prepara para afrontar con una diversidad D. oferta, necesarias para las navidades y el año nuevo, pero su capital D. trabajo es insuficiente para desarrollar su estrategia comercial. Esta es la razón por la cual acuD. a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará telas e insumos, para elaborar manualidades y mercancía variada que tiene encargada y desea responder pronto antes que su competencia.
texts.en:
60-year old Magaly is married and has two children aged 34 and 37. She has a business making and selling handicrafts such as bags, scarves, and stuffed toys; she also sells perfume, cosmetics, and anything else that her customers ask her for if she has the money at the time to fulfill these orders.

Magaly started her business in 1991. Beforehand she worked for a private company, and when she left there she decided to embark on her own business adventure. In the early days her customers were her relatives and neighbours. They then referred other customers to her, and she expanded the number of products she sold and the area she covered. 

Some of her products Magaly herself makes, and some she buys and adds her own handiwork as she is very creative. Currently she is preparing a range of special offers for Christmas and New Years. However, she doesn’t have enough money to put into place this business strategy. For this reason she is asking for a loan, her first with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With the money she plans to buy materials and supplies to make handicrafts and other merchandise for which she has orders and wants to fulfill quickly before the competition does.

loans.use: to buy materials and supplies to make handicrafts etc.

loans.name: Ma. Lina

texts.en:
Ma. Lina is 43 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. The oldest child is 14 years old. Ma. Lina's husband is a fisherman.

Ma. Lina sells fish for a living. She sells her husband's catch and also buys from other fishermen. Ma. Lina and her husband support each other to sustain their family.

Ma. Lina has requested a loan to buy fishing nets and more fish to sell. She hopes to be successful with her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and more fish to sell

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Ángela de 18 años, es soltera. Vive junto a su querida madre y hermana en una vivienda alquilada, ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Ángela trabaja en una entidad, pero al margen de ello tiene su restaurante que viene funcionando hace mas de 2 años, con una atención excelente y cordial hacia sus clientes, además que brinda pensión a los trabajadores de la municipalidad. Quien administra éste negocio es su querida madre, juntamente con sus hijas quienes se levantan desde las 4:00 AM para preparar los alimentos, cuentan con el apoyo de un cocinero y un ayudante de cocina. Ángela esta contenta por que su negocio siempre a marchado muy bien, gracias a ello que en dos años de aperturado ya cuenta con un ingreso económico rentable. En un futuro desea crecer e independizarse. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 500 nuevos soles invertirá en la compra de víveres para su restaurante.
texts.en: Ángela is 18 years old and single. She lives with her beloved mother and sister in a rented apartment located in the district of Pichari. Ángela works for an institution, but apart from that she owns a restaurant which has been in business for over two years. It provides excellent and cordial service to the customers and also provides meals for the town's workers. Her beloved mother is the one who runs the business along with her daughters. They wake up at 4a.m. to prepare the food with help from a cook and a kitchen assistant. Ángela is happy because her business has always gone very well and thanks to that she already gets good profits after being open for two years. In the future she plans to grow and become independent. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments in a punctual manner. With the 500 nuevos soles she will purchase foodstuffs for her restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase provisions and goods to prepare food.

loans.name: Kuña Rembiapo Group

texts.es:
El comité se formo por medio de algunas integrantes ya estaban dentro del progrma de comité, puesto que  les quedaba un poco retirado de sus casas decidieron formar uno dentro de su comunidad y de esa manera se inicio el comité. El Grupo actualmente se encuentra en el tercer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras con 15 integrantes.
La sra Lidia es una de las miembros, ella es costurera, tiene 41 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Carlos quien es Constructor de Obras, juntos tienen 8 hijos, quienes son el motivo de lucha de ambos. La Sra Lidia tiene una meta en especial que es comprar más maquinas de coser ya que quiere que sus hijos le ayuden a realizar prendas para venderlas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, botones y demás insumos para poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee was formed through some members who were already in the program’s committee.  Because they were a bit far from their houses they decided to form a committee within their community.  This is the way the committee got started.  The group is currently in their third cycle of the enterprising women’s program; there are 15 members.

Lidia, one of the members, is a seamstress.  She is 41 years old, married to Carlos; a construction worker, and they have eight children.  Their children are their motivation to persevere.  Lidia has a special goal to buy more sewing machines.  She wants her children to help her make clothes to sell.

She is requesting the loan to buy fabric, needles, buttons, and other supplies to be able to meet her customers’ demand.

loans.use: to buy fabric, needles, buttons, and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a farmer aged 35. He is married with four children aged between 15 and 4 years. He has been in farming for four years and currently produces tea which he sells to the local market.

James has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He wants to venture into dairy farming to compliment the profits he makes from tea which take a long time to materialise. He adds dairy income will enable him meet his family's daily needs and educate the children.

James says he is aware of the challenges of dairy farming like rampant diseases and fluctuation in milk prices but hopes to surmount them. He is glad Juhudi Kilimo enables farmers to acquire assets like dairy cows.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Lourdes is 39 years old and has three children are presently in school.

Lourdes has a rice mill business in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries of her rice mill.

Lourdes has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries of her rice mill

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz owns a store that sells school, office and party supplies. She is a single mother of one child who is currently still in school. She mainly sells notebooks, pens and party items for children and adults. The loans will help Luz purchase increased volume of products in times when demand is high such as carnival, Christmas and other holidays. She has over 25 years of experience in this business.

loans.use: Increase inventory in time for Carnival

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.en:
Kokouvi A. is married, has six children, and is a farmer. Not fortunate enough to attend school, he very early on embraced working in the fields. Due to this work, he is somehow meeting the needs of his family. His wife, who makes and sells beignets (a kind of doughnut), also helps to support their household with her small income. Today, exhausted from crude farming methods, Mr. A. brings in less and less income, which has a negative impact on his household. He is requesting a loan of $700 in order to buy fertilizer and other soil amendments to augment his crop yields. All of this will then allow him to increase his income and improve his family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Marié et père de six (6) enfants, Monsieur A. Kokouvi est un agriculteur. N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, il s’adonne très tôt aux travaux champêtres. C’est grâce à cette activité qu’il assume tant bien que mal les besoins de la famille. Sa femme qui fait la préparation et la vente des beignets participe aussi aux charges du ménage avec son petit revenu. Aujourd’hui épuisé par une agriculture rudimentaire, Monsieur A. Kokouvi a un rendement de moins en moins important. Ce qui a un impact négatif sur le ménage. Il sollicite un crédit de $700 afin de pouvoir acheter des engrais et autres intrants pour augmenter le rendement de son champ. Tout ceci le permettra ainsi d’accroître son revenu pour une amélioration du niveau de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other soil amendments to improve his crop yields.

loans.name: Noor Mohammad

texts.en:
Noor M. supports his family by operating a general store shop in the market. During the war he had a cosmetics cart, but materials were in short supply and his sales were small. He participated in the loan program so he could open a general store and earn more income for his family. With his first loan, he stocked his shop with goods his customers need, and his business did better. Now he is requesting another loan so he can further expand his his stock and better provide for his family.
He is very happy with the loan process and gives thanks to those who established these programs that help people like him improve their lives.

loans.use: Buying goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy instruments and costumes

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Ms. Paulina works from Monday through Friday in the mornings doing construction, and in the afternoons she washes laundry at home. On the weekends she sells vegetables in the Rodriguez market in the city of La Paz. This is the first time she has requested a loan.
