The requested amount will be destined for the construction of a wall in front of her house. As you can see in the photo, now it is made of adobe (a mix of earth, water, and straw, which, when dry, is used to make walls) and there is a risk of it slipping away. Her work and effort to improve her habitat allow approval of this loan, since she is doing various activities to gain income.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

La señora Paulina trabaja de lunes a viernes por las mañanas en construcción y por las tardes lava ropa a domicilio, y los fines de semana vende verdura en el mercado Rodríguez de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado para la construcción de muro de contención en la parte frontal de su casa, que como se ve en la foto, es de adobe (adobe es una mezcla de tierra, agua y paja, que una vez seca, se usa para levantar muros o paredes) y tiene el riesgo de deslizarse. Su trabajo y esfuerzo para el mejoramiento de su habitat le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que realiza varias actividades para lograr ingresos.

loans.use: Construction of a wall.

loans.name: Elva Nancy

texts.es:
Elva is a woman that has kept her business, and made it grow, through hard work and devotion. For many years, she has put the same kind of effort into supporting her kids. Elva wants them to fulfil their dreams. Her family has a great deal of expenses, and that makes Elva, and her husband M., work without stop but enthusiastically.

They have increased their inventory slowly through the years. Their customers’ orders have made the business grow little by little. To face this challenge Elva is asking for US$ 200 loan. She will use this money to buy more goods to sell. And maybe, in the long run and working hard, she would get a plot of land. There she would build a little house and set up her store. Then she won’t have to pay the excessive rent she pays now.

Your generous support can help her accomplish this shortly.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Ramón, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elva, es una dama que ha podido hacer crecer su negocio con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, el mismo esfuerzo que le ha dedicado durante muchos años a su actividad también se lo ha brindado a sus hijos a fin de que cada uno pueda perseguir sus sueños.A pesar del inmenso número de gastos que tiene con sus hijos no deja de trabajar en compañía de su esposo. Y poco a poco durante mucho tiempo ha ido incrementando sus productos deacuerdo a las necesidades de sus vecinos que cada día le genran nuevos pedidos. Frente a esta gran oportunidad de negocio Elva solicita la suma de 200 dólares para comprar más productos e implementar su centro de ventas con novedosos artículos que le ayudarán a satisfacer sus necesidades y poder más adelante obtener uno de sus anhelos, adquirir un terreno y construir una casita a la que trasladará su bodeguita para dejar de pagar las grandes sumas de dinero que le demanda el alquiler en la que actualmente se desempeña. Con tu generoso apoyo podrá cristalizar sus anhelos en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Buying more goods to sell

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is a married mother of 33 years of age with 4 children. Her husband works for a local carpentry company in town. Through the years they have had hard times in raising their children and dealing with family commitments. Her husband is paid every two weeks, but unfortunately his salary is not sufficient to support their family. Daisy decided to do something to assist her husband in supporting their children, especially in terms of school fees, bills, and other family obligations for funerals, weddings, and church donations. She is working hard on her sewing and earning 160 Tala (about US$ 64) per week. The extra income really helps in improving their family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for her sewing business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Beatrice L.. In 2006 she established a business selling stationery and other school supplies. She now requires a loan of $200 to purchase additional stock in bulk. Beatrice is married to husband Gerald and has three children aged between 10 months and 18 years. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her stationery shop

loans.name: Munaku A(I) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Christine has a retail shop business. She wants to use the extra profits to re-invest in the business. Sarah sells charcoal and wants to use the loan to add to her stock. Jane offers tailoring services.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more items like sugar, salt, and soap.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en: Rufina, a very kind and persistent woman, lives with her four-year-old boy in the Batey Palavé community of San Cristobal. Rufina prepares decorative candles. She explains that to prepare the candles, she needs a lot of materials such as wax, essence, aroma oils and so forth. Rufina has a well established clientele, and currently her candles are on high demand. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of raw materials in order to prepare more candles and satisfy her customers’ needs. Rufina wants to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: Rufina would like to purchase raw materials to produce decorative candles.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Doña Gabriela F. Q. is a responsible women: one can note the growth she has had as a businesswoman: she has worked in commerce since her girlhood; she moved to Xenacoj municipality, her husband’s home-town; she opened a shop selling various products but her neighbours began to compete with her and as a result she decided to move her business to her son’s wife and with the help of her daughter-in-law serving in the store they found a good location in the suburb where her son and daughter-in-law live: a little removed from the village and there are no other stores. It is already stocked but there has been demand for other products, for which investment is needed in order to have a good quantity and variety of the items her customers are asking for.

Currently, she sells snacks in the park in the afternoons in the village of Sumpango, her home town, in order to obtain extra money which she can invest in the store.

She is mother to six children which help her with her sales, what she wishes to do is to be of supprt to other people in her community.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Gabriela F. Q., es una mujer responsable puede notarse en el crecimiento que ha tenido como empresaria, ha trabajado en comercio hace años desde su juventud; se traslado al municipio Xenacoj; de donde su esposo es originario; ella abrió una tienda de productos varios pero sus vecinos empezaron a hacerle competencia por lo que decidió trasladar el negocio a la casa de su hijo y con la ayuda de su nuera atenderían la tienda encontraron una buena ubicación en la colonia donde vive su hijo y su nuera es un lugar retirado del pueblo no hay mas tiendas ya esta surtida pero hay demanda de otros productos por lo que necesita invertir para tener cantidad y variedad de artículos lo que la clientela pide.

Actualmente atiende una venta de refacciones en las tardes en el parque del pueblo de Sumpango de donde ella es originaria, para obtener un dinero extra y pueda invertir en la tienda.

Es madre de seis hijos quienes le apoyan a las ventas que ella tiene, lo que desea es ser de apoyo a otras personas en su comunidad.

loans.use: Business capital, purchase of essential products

loans.name: Rosa Alicia

texts.es:
Senora Rosa is a member of the communal bank called Mujeres Creativas, located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali, Peru. She is 58 years old and the mother of 5 children. Her husband is a longshoreman. With the first loan she received, Rosa invested in a business preparing and selling food. Today she continues to run her business selling food from a street stall in the evenings. She gets up at 7am to make breakfast for her family, and then she prepares the meals she will sell later that day from 6pm until 11pm.

With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase ingredients she needs to prepare her meals, as well as glasses, napkins, chairs, etc. Rosa is very enthusiastic and content with her business. She has had to work hard to reach her objectives and is now able to help support her family.

La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas II, ubicado en la Urb. Nueva América Mz 5 Lt 21, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 58 años y es madre de 5 hijos, su esposo es estibador. Rosa con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de comida. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de comida en la calle en las noches, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos, y de su esposo y luego se dedica a la preparación de sus comidas, que los vende desde las 6 pm hasta la 11pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará víveres para la preparación de sus comidas, también comprará cubiertos, vasos, sillas, manteles, etc. Rosa esta muy entusiasmada y contenta, ella se volvió una mujer trabajadora y luchadora con el fin de hacer realidad sus objetivos y así poder ayudar a sus familiares

loans.use: TO PURCHASE INGREDIENTS NEEDED TO PREPARE THE MEALS SHE SELLS, CONTINUE TO EARN INCOME AND HELP SUPPORT HER FAMILY.

loans.name: Manuela Rosna

texts.es:
Rosana belongs to the Communal Bank of Las Flores del Paraiso, located at Jr. Apurimac 535 in the District of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 36 years old and has one child. Her husband is a lumberman, but his income is not sufficient to cover their family expenses. With her first loan received from Manuela Ramos for 300 soles, Rosana decided to invest in a business buying and re-selling second hand clothing. Currently she has a good business buying and selling both new and used clothing. She gets up at 7am to prepare breakfast for her son and husband and later she works collecting and distributing the clothing up through 5pm. With this new loan, which will be repaid within 4 months, she will purchase different types of clothing for women, men and children. Rosanda has known how to overcome the barriers that destiny put before her. Now she can support her family thorugh her own efforts which day by day she sees reflected in her work and she is very grateful for the support from Manuela Ramos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

La señora Rosana pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Flores del Paraíso, ubicado en el Jr Apurimac 535, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 36 años y es madre de 1 hijo, su esposo es maderero, pero los ingresos con los que cuenta no le alcanzan para mantener a su familia. Rosana con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de compra y venta de ropas de segunda. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de compra y venta de ropas de primera y de segunda calidad, para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am, para preparar el desayuno de su hijo y de su esposo y luego se dedica al reparto y cobranza de sus prendas, hasta las 5 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: diversos tipos de ropas de segunda para damas caballeros, niños y niñas. Rosana ha sabido superar las barreras que le puso el destino ahora puede apoyar a su familia a través de su propio esfuerzo que día a día se ve reflejado en su trabajo y esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Bouron

texts.en: Mrs. Bouron H. is a housewife in Thoam Mayuth Village in Kampong Chhnang province. Her husband, Mr. Sroy Kong, is a shoe seller in the local market. Mr. Sroy Kong’s business is currently going very well, so he wants to expand it, but he does not have enough money to purchase more fashion shoes. Therefore his wife, Mrs. Bouron H., requested a loan to buy more shoes for her husband's business. Mrs. Bouron H. is 48 and the mother of 2 children, both of whom are attending school. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase more fashion shoes to re-sell in the market

loans.name: Rahel

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Rahel M., who is married and has four children aged between 10 and 22. She has two additional dependents who live with her because they are attending school in the area. In 2007, Rahel established her traditional African cloth business. Working five days a week, eight hours a day, she earns about $90 every month. She now requests a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of traditional African cloth in bulk. In the future, Rahel plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of traditional African cloth.

loans.name: Rina

texts.es:
Rina is a member of the Community Bank Solución (Solution).

Rina is married, 35 years old, and has three kids. Rina has a grocery shop in her house located in the Asoc. San Martín, in which she sells groceries, vegetables, fruits, meat, and writing utilities. Additionally, Rina has internet booths that are located in the same house, in which she works with the support of her husband and son.

Rina needs a loan of 3000 Soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of rice, oil, sugar, sweets, and fruits. Rina's dreams of constructing her home with finer materials, having a commercial wholesale store, and seeing her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Rina es socia del Banco Comunal Solución.

Rina es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Rina tiene una bodega en su casa ubicada en la Asoc. San Martín, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, carne, útiles de escritorio. Además Rina tiene cabinas de Internet que están ubicadas en su misma casa para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo e hijo.

Rina necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, azúcar, golosinas y frutas. Rina sueña con construir su casa con material noble, tener una tienda comercial mayorista y sus hijos culminen sus estudios.

loans.use: Rina needs a loan of 3000 Soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of rice, oil, sugar, sweets, and fruits.

loans.name: Ilda

texts.es:
Doña Ilda cumplió 39 años de edad, estudió primaria completa, es casada y tiene tres hijos que fluctúan entre los 08, 07 y 04 años de edad, vive en la Comunidad de Machacmarca.

Con visión de salir adelante ella decidió integrar el Banco Comunal Ciudad Nueva del Distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia del Collao – Puno. Con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles compró 02 ovinos, ella se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de ganado vacuno, ovino, porcino, comprando los días sábados en la feria de Acora y los días jueves vende en la feria de Pilcuyo, dedicándose a éste negocio hace 14 años desde que vive con su esposo, siempre le gustó hacer negocio desde los 17 años de edad vendía ropa en el mercado de Ilave.

Con este crédito de S/. 1,600.00 Nuevos Soles que pagará en 04 cuotas tiene presupuestado comprar 01 vacuno, 02 porcinos, 01 ovino que serán comercializados en la feria de Pilcuyo.

Su mayor sueño es comprar una casa en la ciudad de Ilave y seguir trabajando con su negocio para obtener más ganancias y educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Doña Ilda is 39 years old and married with three children who are 4, 7, and 8 years old. She completed primary school, and currently lives in the community of Machacmarca. With a vision to get ahead in life, she decided to join the Ciudad Nueva Communal Bank (a group loan) in the Pilcuyo District of Collao Province, Puno. With her first loan of 300 soles (slightly more than US $100) she bought two sheep. Ilda buys and sells cows, sheep, and pigs; she buys them on Saturdays in the Acora market and sells them on Thursdays in the Pilcuyo market. She has been in this business since she began living with her husband many years ago. She has always enjoyed being a businesswoman, ever since she was 17 and sold clothing in the Ilave market. With this loan of 1,600 nuevo soles (about US $540), which she will repay in 4 installments, Ilda plans to buy a cow, two pigs, and one sheep to resell in the Pilcuyo market. Her greatest dream is to buy a house in the city of Ilave, continue working with her business to earn more, and educate her children so they can grow up to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock

loans.name: Chat

texts.en:
Mrs. Chat Y., 55, and her husband, Mr. Sun Tol, 59, who live along national road number one about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1974 and have five children; two sons and three daughters. Two of their daughters are married and live outside the family home and their other daughter is a garment factory worker. One son is a construction worker and the other son builds wooden houses.

Mrs. Chat and her husband have been farming since 1974. They grow cucumbers and ridye gourd in their farmland near the house. Currently, the couple is in the process of building one house for their daughter who was married but lacks the money to finish it. Therefore, Chat is requesting a loan of $1000 to build a house for her daughter.

loans.use: Chat would like to build a house for her daughter and her husband.

loans.name: Koko

texts.fr: Issue d’une famille très pauvres et n’ayant pas eu la chance d’être scolarisé, Madame D. Koko est née en 1966, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Dans le but de subvenir aux besoins de sa petite famille elle se lança très tôt dans le commerce de piment séché qui est une activité très génératrice de revenu surtout en période de pénurie. Mais pour pouvoir arriver à cela il faut au préalable acheter et stocker ; c’est dans le souci de la faire que Madame D. Koko sollicite un crédit. Ce prêt accordé lui sera très bénéfique puisqu’en période de pénurie elle peut doubler son revenu ce qui aura un impact très positive sur le niveau de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Coming from a very poor family and not having had the chance to attend school, Ms. Koko D. was born in 1966 and is a mother with three children. With the goal of providing for her small family, she got started very early on in the commerce of dried chili peppers. This is a business that generates very good income, especialy in times of shortages. But in order to be able to make it happen, buying and creating an inventory must occur first. With this concern in mind, she is requesting a loan that, when granted, will be very beneficial to her, since she can double her income in times of shortages, thus having a very positive impact on her family's standard of living.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To create an inventory of chili peppers to sell

loans.name: Sok Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Sok Ly K. lives in Doun Taur village in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a duck breeder. Her husband, Mr. Suon Siem, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, he now faces some problems because his field is infertile and he does not have much money to hire laborers to work on the field. In order to solve these problems, Mrs. Sok Ly K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and hire laborers to work on the field. She is 34 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom attends the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire laborers to work in a rice field.

loans.name: Yesica Lorena

texts.en:
Yesica is a member of the Cielo (“Sky”) Village Bank (Loan Group). She is 31 years old and has two children, who are three and four years old. Yesica sells Zara and Ripley brand clothing to individuals on special order. She has been in this line of work for the past three years. She travels to Lima (about eight hours by bus) at the end of each month to buy the clothing in one of the city’s plazas, then brings the clothing to Ayacucho to distribute to her clients.

L Yesica needs a loan of 600 soles to buy more women’s and children’s clothing for the holiday season. She sells a lot of clothing at the end of the year, when many people receive their end-of-the-year bonuses and buy Christmas presents. Her goal for the future is to open her own clothing shop in Ayacucho.

loans.use: To buy women's and children's clothing

loans.name: Azamat

texts.en:
Azamat is a responsible family man and father who cares for his family with great attention. He comes from an agricultural family and today it is these activities which provide a major source of income which allows him to support his 3 sons.

Azamat has a friendly family who always try to help each other. In the picture you can see his sons, as Azamat himself was absent from his home. His dream is to see his sons succeed and it is in order to achieve this that his efforts know no limit. In this case, his wish is to improve his seeding and to care for his animals, for which he needs a loan. Your help is very important for this hard-working and humble worker!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Shamim Qadir Muhammad Group

texts.en:
Shamim baji is 53 years old. She has lived in Pakpattan, Pakistan for 20 years. Her husband, Q. M., runs a grocery store in the community. Shamim baji is the mother of two sons. Her elder son works in a decorative embroider business and her younger son is a welder. She is applying for a loan to buy groceries to diversify her husband’s grocery store.

Shamim baji is the group leader. The others in her group are:
Ameena baji, who wants a loan to buy leather to sell. 
Iram baji, who wants a loan to buy paint to sell. 
Ameeran baji, who wants a loan to buy thread to sell. 
Hamidan baji and Shahnaz baji, who each want a loan to buy beams for their shuttering businesses. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Jolita

texts.en:
Jolita A. is a rice grower. She and her husband till their land to support the needs of their five children. She is now 52 years old. She has been a farmer ever since she was just a small kid. Her parents taught her everything she needed to know to plant and harvest rice. Aside from rice, she also grows vegetables in their backyard. She waters them everyday. Her harvest is what she uses to buy the other things they need. 

She is asking CEVI for a loan of Php 8,000. She will use the loan to buy four sacks of Urea fertilizer as well as herbicides. Her loan will definitely help her achieve a better yield. 

CEVI provides their client with the credit assistance that they need. Aside from that, they give all their clients training and insurance coverage

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and herbicide

loans.name: Mrs. Kunthea Chheng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kunthea C. is the village bank leader for eleven people who all live in Mkak village in Takeo province.  All the members will use the loan for different purposes. She is a fruit seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Neth Vy, is a motor taxi driver. Kunthea is requesting a loan to bU. more fruit to resell and to fix her husband’s motorbike. She would use the rest of the money to bU. piglets to start a pig breeding business in order to earn more income to support her family. She is twenty-eight years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Mr. Veasna U. is shown in the picture instead of his wife who is a member of the group.

This is a village bank loan consisting mainly of end-of-term loans. Four members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Buy fruit to resell, fix her husband’s motorbike, and buy piglets to start pig breeding business.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en:
Hồng Phạm (1432071501) is a 28-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá. She is married and has 2 infant children. To making a living, Hồng operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Hồng has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 Vietnamese Dong (about US $140) a month from these activities.

In 2007, Hồng joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hồng has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Hồng is now requesting a second loan of 7,000,000 Dong which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. Hồng plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To buy breeding livestock

loans.name: Ruos

texts.en: Mrs. Ruos C., 51, sells a few grocery items from her home. Her husband Thol, 62, makes a living by driving a motorbike taxi. Besides their current work, they are also local rice cultivators. In order to support the business actions and to earn extra an income, C. has decided to seek a loan from Kiva. They will use the money to buy a cow for plowing their field and to purchase more grocery inventory to continue selling. The older couple has four children who are married and live independently.

loans.use: To purchase grocery inventory for selling and to also buy a cow to plow rice field.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.es:
La solicitante es la Sra Adelia Maidana de 40 años de edad cabe destacar que es casada tiene dos hijos que estudian y van al colegio publico del mismo Barrio donde viven. También hay que mencionar que viven en la casa de los padres en pleno centro de dicha ciudad.

Se trata de una persona que es comerciante hace mas 10 años y vende ropas para recién nacidos con una antigüedad de mas de 10 años en el ramo y esta ubicado en pleno centro comercial de Encarnación y cuenta con mucha clientela formada y sus principales clientes son los Argentinos.

El crédito que quiere es para la compra de mercaderías que tiene que traer del Brasil si compra le sale mas barato y quiere por tiene pedidos por sus clientes Argentinos que le pidieron.
texts.en:
The applicant is Señora Adelia Maidana, who is 40 years of age. It bears mentioning that she is married and has two children who are studying and going to public school in the same neighborhood where they live. It should also be mentioned that they live in their parents' house in the center of the city. She's a person who has been in business for more than ten years selling clothing for infants. Her business is located in the commercial center of the city of Encarnación. She has many regular customers and most of them are from Argentina. The loan which she wants is to buy merchandise which she has to bring from Brazil where she can buy it more cheaply. She wants it to fill orders which she has from her Argentine customers.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for infants.

loans.name: Jumuyiya Kiluvya Group

texts.en:
Otilya M., age 60, is a divorcee with five children aged 47, 45, 38, 29 and 27. She has run a poultry business for four years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 6.30 p.m. daily and is able to earn a monthly profit of about $340.

This will be Otilya’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first loan to increase her poultry business and has paid the loan back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to increase her business by buying more chicks and chicken feed.

Otilya will share this loan with subgroup D of the Jumuyiya Kiluvya group. The subgroup has seven members who sell vegetables, bricks, wire mesh, or have grocery or other shops. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Otilya is first on the right.

loans.use: To buy more chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Business-minded Vicky S. is 31 years old, married with one child, and lives at Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

At her age, Vicky is zealous to be in business – a sari-sari (variety) store, believing that it is of great help to resolve poverty, to help the family and to fulfill one’s dream. Her regular customers are students, friends and neighbors.

Vicky has been a member of Paglaum MPC since December 2008. She is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional goods such as laundry items, seasonings, goodies, toiletries, drinks and other household items. She's planning and looking forward to finishing in college so that she can have a brighter future and be able to help her family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy I. is 40 years old and married with 5 children. She sells provisions and she is requesting for a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana Julia B. Velásquez tiene la edad de 44 años. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica de Ana es brindar el servicio de transporte de taxi.  Ella tenía que buscar el medio para una mejor búsqueda de ingresos para su familia. Los propósitos de Doña Ana son de seguir adelante con su negocio ya que todo lo que tiene actualmente le ha costado mucho esfuerzo y no lo perdería. Es por eso que Ana solicito ayuda en Fundación León 2000 con el fin de aplicarle reparaciones y proporcionarle mantenimiento a su vehículo. Y así podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana Julia B. Velásquez is 44 years old, married, and responsible for 3 children. For a living she offers taxi transportation. She had to search for a way of improving the family income. The purpose of Doña Ana is to get ahead with her business as it has taken a lot of effort for her to have what she owns now and she does not want to lose it.Therefore Ana requests support from Fundación León 2000 in order to fix and maintain her vehicle, and thus offer better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angelica es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño.
Angelica es viuda, tiene 59 años y 6 hijos, Angélica tiene un puesto en el mercado F. Vivanco en donD. venD. canastas y chocolates que ella misma lo prepara D. manera artesanal, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Angelica necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. canastas.
Los sueños D. Angelica son tener capital propio y brindarles estabilidad a sus hijos.

loans.use: Para la compra de canastas.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia A. sells smoked fish and gari at Elmina near Eselem.  Cecilia has no educational background.  She is married and has four children. His wife is a fishmonger. Cecilia has been selling smoked fish and gari since 2004. She supports in the payment of school fees and utility bills. His loan will be used to buy more fish to sell. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save towards her children education.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
“While there is life, there is hope,” this is Adelaida’s principle in life. She is 20 years old and married to Joji M., a tricycle [local three-wheeled transport vehicle] driver. Having a family at a very young age was hard for her but she always believes that they will overcome every trial in life that will come along. They have two children who are both studying. Their eldest is eight years old and their youngest is four. She dreams of sending them both to college someday which is the reason why the couple is working hard with their livelihood activity.

Adelaida and her husband help each other in their transportation business. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 for the continuous maintenance of their transportation business. To help her husband in bringing income for their family, Adelaida also started helping her sister in selling commodities in her canteen located in the school where her sister is giving her a voluntary labor fee. According to her, doing everything to the best of her ability will be done in order to sustain her family needs and to support their children's education.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en:
Kiden A. is currently in the business of selling cooking oil and onions and is requesting a loan to purchase tomatoes and apples to sell. Kiden is 20 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has 1 child and her child does not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase tomatoes and apples to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 45 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y optimista. Vive junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos, quienes son su mayor tesoro.

Desde que sus hijos crecieron ella buscó la manera que apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar. Para ello, adquirió un carrito (móvil) de comida, con el cual trabaja todas las tardes en la puerta de su casa, instalándose en un espacio provisional para atender a sus clientes, quienes en su mayoría son sus vecinos. 
Esta actividad la viene realizando por 5 años y en el corto tiempo ha sabido captar la atención de las personas y conocer los gustos de sus clientes. La rentabilidad de su negocio está en la compra de los productos que requiere para cocinar a un bajo precio y en la preparación, pues las personas reconocen la exquisita sazón que tiene María. 
Sus planes a futuro son de ampliar su casa e instalar un  restaurante  donde atienda por las tardes y noches, pues la venta  de comida es mayormente en esos horarios, con miras a este deseo, viene construyendo poco a poco su casa pensando en cada detalle de su negocio.

Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y se siente muy comprometida con la institución, pues su interés es seguir progresando en base a su trabajo, dedicación y a los posteriores créditos que piensa solicitar. Con el dinero que ahora solicita planea incrementar la cantidad de porciones de comida que ofrece, además de comprar algunos muebles para ampliar su pequeño puesto.
texts.en:
María is 45 years old. She is a hardworking and optimistic woman who lives with her husband and 3 children, who are her greatest treasure.

Since her children are grown, María looked for a way to help her husband with the household expenses. She bought a mobile food cart that she situated in a temporary space in front of her home. María works every evening and most of her customers are her neighbors. She has been in business for 5 years and, within a short time, has managed to capture people’s attention and figure out what her customers like to eat. Her business is profitable because she is able to purchase her supplies at a low price and prepare the food efficiently. People have come to recognize the exquisite taste of María’s dishes.

Her future plans include expanding her house so that she can open a restaurant. It would be open in the afternoons and evenings, since this is when she sells the most food. With this dream in mind, she will pursue these improvements gradually so that she can pay attention to the details required for her future business.

This is María’s first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She is committed to the Institution and making further progress in her work because she intends to apply for future loans. With the money she is requesting at the moment, María plans to increase the quantity of food that she offers and purchase some furniture for her small vending stand.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & some furniture for her vending stand

loans.name: Eyde_Qorban Group

texts.en:
Salaha is the group leader of 'Eyde_Qorban' group. There are two members in this group. Salaha is a married woman. She is 34 years old and she has two daughters who are school students and Salaha wants to take a loan for her bakery. She wants to make her shop larger and expand it.

Sayweta wants to take a loan for her tailoring business, and she wants to expand and progress her business. She makes a shop in her house; she is a married woman and she has one daughter who is small. They have requested a group loan of 20,000 Afghani.

They would like to thank both AFS and Kiva lenders that support the people around the world through their effective process.

loans.use: make their businesses larger

loans.name: Perseus

texts.en:
Perseus G. is from the village of North Poblacion in Guinsiliban. Camiguin Province. He is 46 years old. Perseus is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Perseus uses his motorcycle to provide passenger transportation to local community members. Perseus has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Perseus joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perseus has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Perseus is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase materials that he needs to expand the services that he provides. This will be Perseus's first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income his family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Mrs. Rorn Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fourteen people and they all live in Svay village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Rorn C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. H. Kosal, is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice.

Since the pigs are getting bigger and bigger, Mrs. Rorn C. decided to ask for a loan bU. more pig feed and fertilizer to support the rice field. She hopes to increase their income and improve the family’s standard of living with this loan.

Mrs. Rorn C. is 27 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more pig feed and fertilizer to support the rice field

loans.name: Zee

texts.en: Zee is forty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to four children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing dominated community in the central region of Ghana. Zee is a trader, who trades in second hand bags and footwear. She hawks and treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. Zee has been in business for three years and wants to give her business a facelift. She therefore wants the loan to procure more goods.

loans.use: To buy more second hand bags.

loans.name: Jose Eddy

texts.es:
El Señor José Eddy Martínez Suárez, tiene la edad de 48 años, Labora como METROLOGO (Inspector) en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, el tiene dos hijos a su cargo, los cuales  se encuentran en edad escolar, esta casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante seis años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 7 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción. El cual utilizara para remodelar el piso de su de habitación, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 
José dijo que los préstamos obtenidos por ceprodel le han ayudado mucho en el mejoramiento de su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
José Eddy Martínez Suárez is 48 years old and works as inspector in Managua's Mayoreo Market. He is married and has two children under his care, both of whom are school age. He has received loans from Kiva partner CEPRODEL for six years, and over this time has invested seven loans into the improvement of his home. The loan he is requesting is to invest in the purchase of construction materials to remodel the floor of his, with the goal of providing more security and a better quality of life for his children. José said that the loans he has received from CEPRODEL have greatly helped him make improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvements and expand his home

loans.name: Rakaya

texts.en:
Rakaya D. is currently in the business of selling bread and tomatoes at home and is requesting a loan to purchase onions to sell.  Rakaya is 40 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase supplies of onions to sell

loans.name: Zarif

texts.en:
Zarif is a 34 year old man, married with two children, who dedicates his time to driving a microbus. His usual itinerary is the Kanibadam-Khujand route. Zarif has about 5 years of experience in the public transportation field, and the competition is rather high in this business since there are so many people who need it. His current request is so that he can maintain his vehicle, since this is the tool of his trade. So now Zarif is counting on your help and requesting a loan of $1200 USD. With the loan he’ll purchase the spare parts for his microbus. With your support, Zarif will continue to progress. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts in order to repair the microbus.

loans.name: Asel's Group

texts.en:
Not far from Naryn, there is a village called Kochkor. In winter there is heavy snowfall in Kochkor. Everywhere it seems to be silent and only some sounds of cattle can be heard. However, there are people there. Children make snowballs and play games. Adults are busy with their livestock.  Along with everyone else, Asel K., the leader of the group, also deals with her housework, but what makes her special is her youth and determined character. She is a purposeful individual and seeks differences in her life. She is 27 years old, married, a marvelous mother of two children and a good wife. The older child is five and her daughter is two. Her husband works as a welder in an organization, but in his free time he helps in her business. In 2009, they took out a loan to buy cattle and then sold them. For money they have two calves which they are now fattening. They started with 20,000 KGS ($446). At present their revenue is 3,000 KGS ($66) per month. Their plan is to improve their life and be more comfortable by buying a big house. However, at first they want to get a loan to buy a horse to fatten which they would sell in summer. For profit they are going to gather in a harvest crop from the field which they have already bought. 

Kubatbek A. is a married man aged 60. His wife is a pensioner. They have a son who helps them. They resell potatoes in the market and have already bought a car for 42,000 KGS ($940). They want to invest the loan to increase turnover which is currently 150,000 KGS ($3,400).

Aida J. K. is 34 and has three children. The elder two attend school and the youngest one is at home. Her husband is a member of a peasant household. She has a business which she began three years ago. She buys old pictures and remakes them for selling. She started with 5,000 KGS ($112) and her profit per month is 5,000 KGS ($112).  They have bought a car for 45,000 KGS ($1,004). She wants to get a loan to invest in her business.

Nurgul I. is 36 and the mother of four children. They all attend the local school. Her husband is a member of peasant households. They have bought a tractor for 50,000 KGS ($1,117). Now she fattens cattle. They began with 20,000 KGS ($446) and now the revenue is 3,000 KGS ($66). By taking out the loan they want to buy cattle to fatten and sell afterwards.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a horse for resale in summer and to gather in a harvest crop

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Rice farming is the main source of income for Shirley, 52.  Her business is located in Agusan del Sur. She has a good harvest when the weather is good and no pests attack. She tills her rice field well to support her family.  She is the mother of seven children.

She requested a loan from Kiva's partner Community Economic Ventures, Inc., of 14,000 Philippine pesos to have additional capital for her business to buy farm supplies.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna M., 52 years old, said that she benefits a lot from growing rice. Her husband is also a farmer and both of them work so hard to be able to raise income for their family.

Lorna desires to increase her harvest but needs additional capital to buy all the farming necessities. She would like to apply for a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. The loan will go far in buying fertilizer and farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Diolenda

texts.en: Diolenda B. is a 55 year old married woman with 9 children who lives in Barangay Mabini, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. Diolenda has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon for 3 years now and earns a living by running a sugarcane farm and running a general store business. She is purchasing a solar lantern with a PHP 3,100 loan from NWTF to extend her productive hours and at the same time cut fuel costs and save money in the long run. About NWTF’s Green Loan Products Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation believes that the key to poverty alleviation for the poorest is to provide services beyond just credit. To that end, NWTF offers green energy products designed to save money for its clients. In a partnership with SunTransfer and Arc Finance, NWTF distributes solar-powered lanterns that also function as charging stations for mobile phones. These families normally use kerosene lamps to light their homes. The solar lantern offers a free environmentally friendly renewable source of energy that allows them to reduce their monthly fuel costs. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Purchase of solar lantern

loans.name: Umaja Ni Nguvu Group

texts.fr:
Bubenga A. est présidente du groupe de crédit  Umoja ni nguvu, elle lève sa main sur la photo, avec son contrat de crédit à main au fond derrière, cliente au 4e cycle de crédit, âgée de 46 ans, veuve, mère de 2 enfants filles, toutes ont déjà leurs propres foyers, elles poursuivent convenablement leurs études bien avec l’appui de leurs époux.  Son mari est décédé en 1994 par ignorance et imprudence de la famille. La veuve Bubenga A. dit-elle au lieu d’aller se faire soigner dans un hôpital formel, sa belle famille avait préféré amener son défunt mari auprès d’un féticheur  marabout (tradi- praticien), chose qui a compliqué sa santé et lui fut conduit à la mort précocement. 
La veuve Bubenga A. vend des  légumes (sombe (feuilles de manioc), épinards, amarantes, tomates, aubergine, etc. Elle expose ses produits dans le petit marché du quartier Mapendo-Birere et parfois devant des dépôts de corporation. Elle a commencé son petit commerce  avec  son fonds propre. Son capital initial était 70$, puis elle fut informée de l’IMF Hekima qui donne des crédits aux pauvres sans aucune garantie, delà, elle a trouvé son 1er crédit de renforcement.
Avec  le crédit  de  l’IMF Hekima, Bubenga A. souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achetant des légumes qu’elle pourra revendre.
Le grand défi de la veuve Bubenga A. est relatif c'est-à-dire le contraste est que pendant la période de pluie,  les légumes chutent les prix, étant donné qu’ils sont en quantités suffisantes sur le marché. Lors de sécheresse, il y a pénurie des légumes. Malgré tout cela, les consommateurs (clients, population) achètent et la veuve Bubenga A. y tire son maximum de bénéfice.
La veuve Bubenga A.  s’est décidée  de faire la garde de  sa mère biologique (grand-mère de ses filles) qui est devenue trop vielle. Elle reste à ses cotes pour l’assister et prendre à charge d’autres orphelins de sa famille élargie en situation difficile. Aussitôt que son chiffre d’affaire augmente, elle préférerait changer son activité et aller s’approvisionner  des pagnes (habits femmes congolaises) dans la ville de Bukavu, chef lieu de la province du Sud Kivu.
En outre la veuve Bubenga A. souhaiterait dans le futur, construire une maison dans sa parcelle qui est située dans le quartier  périphérique  de la ville de Goma, à Ndosho (Kiziba II) et y mettre de locataire qui pourrait lui payer de l’argent
La veuve Bubenga A. remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  les crédits  qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie matérielle car grâce à ces crédits, elle parvient à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille  et son business prospère bien. Dit-elle, que Dieu bénisse l’IMF Hekima. 
Ce groupe Umoja ni nguvu  est  composé de 15 membres majoritairement femmes.
texts.en:
Ms. Bubenga A. is the president of the loan group Umoja ni Nguvu. (She is the one in the photo with her hand raised and her loan contract in hand, in the background). She is a 4th loan cycle client, aged 46, widowed, and the mother of two daughters, both of whom have their own homes already. The daughters are appropriately pursuing their education with the support of their husbands. Widow Bubenga's husband died in 1994 due to his family's ignorance and carelessness. Bubenga says that, instead of going to get care at a regular hospital, her husband's family had favored taking her now deceased husband to a féticheur marabout (traditional practitioner), which complicated his health situation, leading to an early death. Widow Bubenga sells vegetables: sombe (cassava leaves), spinach, amaranth, tomatoes, eggplant, etc. She displays her produce at the small market of the Mapendo-Birere district and sometimes in front of warehouses or outlets. She started her small business with her own funds. Her initial capital was $70. Then, she was informed about the micro-finance institution Hekima, which lends to the poor without collateral. From that, she got her first boost loan. With the loan from the MFI Hekima, she would like to increase her sales by buying vegetables she will be able to resell. The big challenge she faces is variability; that is, there is a big difference in prices, such that, during the rainy season, prices plunge, given that vegetables are plentiful on the market. During droughts, there is a shortage of vegetables. Despite this, consumers (customers, people) will still buy, and Bubenga will derive as much profit as she can. Widow Bubenga came to the decision to watch over her biological mother (her daughters' grandmother), who is now very old. She remains at her side to attend to her and to care for more struggling orphans in her extended family. As much as her sales are increasing, she would prefer switching her work to supplying pagnes (clothing of Congolese women) in the city of Bukavu, the capital of the province of Sud Kivu. Moreover, Bubenga would like to build a house in the future on her parcel of land located in the outer district of Goma City, in Ndosho (Kiziba II), and then rent it out. This would bring in money. Widow Bubenga thanks the MFI Hekima for the loans she receives with no collateral at all. Because of these loans, she is managing to provide for her family, and her business is really prospering. She says, "May God bless the MFI Hekima." This group, Umoja ni Nguvu, is composed of fifteen members, mostly women.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vegetables (tomatoes, cassava leaves, spinach, peppers)

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Divinas lo conforman tres mujeres emprendedoras y esforzadas las cuales se dedican al comercio de frutas y verduras actividad de gran trabajo.  Martha Zecilia Pilarte García, coordinadora del grupo compra las cosechas en la comarca y las vende en el populoso mercado oriental. 
De la misma manera trabaja Patrona P. de 52 años quien vende tamarindos, mamón y mango, mientras  Francisca del Carmen Mendosa distribuye sus frutas en Jinotega departamento ubicado al norte de Managua.
texts.en:
The group "las Divinas" is set up by three enterprising ladies who have put a lot of effort into the fruit and vegetable business, an activity of hard work. Martha Zecilia Pilarte García, coordinator of the group, buys the crops in the region and sells them at the popular oriental market. Patrona P., 52 years old, works the same way selling tamarindo, papaya, and mango, while Francisca del Carmen Mendosa distributes her fruits in the department of Jinotega, north of Managua.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase crops of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
El sueño de Florentina es ampliar su establo, tener mas animales para producir leche y derivados, Florentina tiene sus tierras en la comunidad de Sachabamba en donde se dedica al engorde de ganado vacuno que luego vende en las ferias, además Florentina tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García en donde vende verduras al por mayor y menor, productos que son adquiridos de los productores. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de zanahoria, cebolla, tomate.
Florentina tiene 3 hijos y desea que todos ellos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Florentina’s dream is to expand her stables, to have more animals to produce milk and dairy products. Florentina has her land in the community of Sachabamba where she fattens cattle to sell at markets. Florentina also has a stand at the Nery Garcia market where she sells vegetables wholesale and retail, products that she purchases direct from the producers. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of carrots, onions and tomatoes. Florentina has 3 children and hopes that they will all become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy carrots, onions and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Dep

texts.en: Mrs. Dep E., 34, supports her family by selling fish paste. Also, she buys fresh fish and turns thE. into fish paste to sell. She is able to generate an average of $3 per day and has been engaged in this sector for years. Dep E.'s husband is also a financial earner. He is a porter in the local busy market. The couple has given birth to five kids who are all going to school. Dep E. is looking for a loan as capital to order a larger quantity of fresh fish to make into fish paste to sell.

loans.use: To order a larger quantity of fresh fish, with which to make fish paste to sell

loans.name: Agbessignalé

texts.en: Agbessignalé A., 46 years old, lives and works in Lomé, Togo. He is married to another merchant and they have 5 children. Monsieur A. recently purchased a mill he uses to process corn into cornmeal. This is a lucrative business that allows him to provide for his family because cornmeal is a very important staple of the Togolese diet. But mills are expensive and he is now requesting a second loan of 500,000 XOF to help pay off the cost of the mill.

loans.use: To pay for the purchase and installation of a mill to process corn

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan J. B. is a thirty-eight-year-old lady who is married to Joseph Kosgei. They are blessed with four beautiful children and live in Mafuta in the outskirts of Eldoret Town. Joseph, like Susan, is a farmer and together they plant maize and wheat to sell after harvest.

Susan has been a farmer for eight years now, earning a monthly income of 12,500 shillings. This will be her third loan from KADET and she plans to use it to buy fertilizer for her farm. She anticipates earning a profit which she will use to expand her farming business and even hire more land for planting maize and wheat.

In the future, Susan hopes to expand her farming, become a better farmer, and also support her family by providing their basic needs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pork

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca Estela Carreón es una mujer comerciante que tiene varias actividades como lo son  tienda de Dulces, venta de joyería, venta de ropa usada y hace manualidades; estos trabajos los viene realizando desde hace 3 años. Estas ventas que ella tiene lo hace con gusto pues es de la manera que percibe un ingreso mas, aparte de la pensión de su esposo que es mensual. Blanca desea un crédito para comprar material y mercancía para seguir teniendo más ganancias.
texts.en:
Irma Angelica Armenta and her husband started building their own house with their savings but they currently see a need for a loan to complete the bathroom. They would like add tiling and purchase the toilet, the sink and the shower. They would like to complete this project to provide their children with greater comfort and a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy has a mixed farm in Litein town, Rift Valley, Kenya. She has been farming for 10 years. Her main products are cabbages, beans, potatoes, milk and tea which she sells at a local market. She also earns income from her kiosk in the same area.

Emmy is 37 years old. She is married with 5 children who are now between the ages of 4 and 14. Four of the children attend school.

Emmy has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 70,000KES to purchase a dairy cow. With this loan she will be able to acquire a quality cow that will increase her milk production. She will therefore be able to provide enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. She however faces the challenge of insufficient dairy feed.

In the future, she plans to improve her farming by keeping the best dairy breeds and planting more grass and other dairy feed for her animals. She is grateful for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Legoyia Ketoi

texts.en:
Legoyia has been practicing livestock farming in Naivasha town for the last nine years. He is 26 years old, married to Masialle Legoyia and they have three children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the cash to buy 10 calves which he will rear and sell later at a profit.

Legoyia is planning to buy a big piece of farmland where he will practice livestock farming on a large scale.

loans.use: To buy 10 calves to rear and resell

loans.name: Twetungure Women, Bushenyi Group

texts.en:
Edith B.’s social nature has been at the heart of her success in the ten years she has been operating her stationery and bookbinding business in Ishaka town within the district of Bushenyi. Her experience in this business has taught her the virtue of being cordial to your clients.

Given the nature of her occupation where competition is tight, the above traits have come in handy for 56-year-old Edith. This mother of two reveals her family’s standard of living has improved ever since she began her business in which she binds books and Bibles and also makes envelopes for sale.

On a weekly basis she says she makes 60,000 UGX. With this amount she has managed to send her children to school. With this loan she says she wants to buy more bookbinding materials and expand her operations. Her future plans are to elevate her financial status through the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To purchase more bookbinding materials

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn B. is married, 29-years old, and supports her family by operating three business ventures. These businesses are crystal installing, pig fattening, and farming. She lives in Prk. Mabinuligon, Brgy. Maricalum, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of the NWTF - Project Dungganon since 2007, and she has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans and hard work. As a result, she is helping her family to become more economically stable, and she now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000. 

Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 18,000 so that she can continue to purchase raw materials. This will be her 7th loan from NWTF - Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 was repaid well within its term, and was a step in her journey toward economic freedom. Jocelyn aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Jolinda

texts.en:
Jolinda A. is from the village of Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 35 years old. Jolinda is separated from her spouse and has 5 school-aged children. 

To make a living, Jolinda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling vegetables & spices like garlic, onion, ginger, cabbage, red bell pepper & tomatoes in the local community. Jolinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jolinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Jolinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional vegetables to buy and sell. Jolinda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jolinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase inventory & use as working capital

location.town: Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

She operates a restaurant business, cooking beans and rice, making tea and chapati (flat bread). Her potential customers are villagers and passersby. In addition she sells cashew nuts and paraffin to provider her with another source of income. Mwanaisha hopes to expand and establish a hotel in the future. 

With the 40,000 Kshs she wants to purchase stock of beans, rice, sugar, tea leaves, milk and cooking fat oil for her restaurant business. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad T. is from the village of Mialen Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old.  Natividad is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Natividad owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  Natividad has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Natividad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Natividad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC.  

Natividad is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Natividad from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand pig farming business

loans.name: Yoisy Feliciana

texts.es:
Yoisy de 33 años, tiene un taller de confección y costura de ropa. Viviendo con su hijo de 10 años en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas). 

Comenzó haciendo cursos de confección porque siempre le gusto esta actividad y decidió tener su propio taller de costura. En la actualidad trabaja todos los días desde las 07h00am hasta las 20h00pm en su casa confeccionando pantalones, vestidos, blusas a sus clientes y así tener ingresos suficientes para darle una mejor vida a su hijo de 10 años. Tiene muchas aspiración con su negocio por eso quiere continuar para su taller de confección telas, hilos  por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa y máquina de coser. 

 En el futuro quiere seguir con su negocio de confección y poder mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Yoisy is 33 years old and manages a sewing and dressmaking shop. She lives with her ten year old son in an urban area called Orquídeas de Guayaquil, which is named after the many orchids that existed when it was discovered.

Yoisy began making clothes because she always enjoyed sewing, so she decided to open her own shop. She currently works every day from 7am to 8pm at home making trousers, dresses, and blouses for her customers so that she can earn enough income to give her ten year old son a better life. Yoisy has many aspirations, so she wants to continue her sewing business with this loan by purchasing fabrics and thread so that she will able to produce clothes and acquire a sewing machine.

In the future, she wants to continue with her dressmaking business and make improvements to her home.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics & thread

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  membres du groupe  Sabali  sont  femmes mariées. Elles  ont en moyenne  34 ans, 3 enfants et vivent majoritairement dans des  familles monogames à  Mancourani I, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur huitième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de pagnes et de chaussures avec WASSA C., qui compte acheter avec son  prêt, 100 paires de chaussures. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de Sikasso et  quelques fois à Bamako. Les chaussures s sont revendues au  grand marché de Sikasso et à domicile à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, essentiellement au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités..
texts.en:
The five members of the group named Sabali are married women. On average they are 34 years old and they have 3 children each. Most of them live in monogamous families in Mancourani I, a quarter in the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali). 

They seek their eighth loan through the microfinance institution of Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) in order to meet client demand. This group of women sells cloth wraps and shoes with Wassa C.. With their loan they hope to purchase 100 pairs of shoes. They purchase their merchandise in the large market in Sikasso and sometimes in Bamako. The shoes are resold in the large market in Sikasso and from their home to a clientele made up of both men and women. The sales are completed mostly in cash. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 75 FCFA, a part of which will be used to help her husband meet the daily expenses, and some will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase shoes for resale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick K. is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is single and has no children. Patrick has a retail shop business, which he has run for ten years.
To help expand his business, Patrick has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar and soap for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Patrick hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, he hopes to expand his rentals business further.

loans.use: To purchase sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Hilda Margot

texts.es:
Hilda es una madre D. familia D. 44 años D. edad; ella que resiD. junto a su esposo e hijos en el caserío Vallecito ubicado en el distrito D. TambogranD., una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia D. Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Hilda se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores, especialmente ovejas, en un corral situado cerca a su domicilio. Ella los alimenta D. granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donD. resiD..
