Su esposo  trabaja como peón agrícola en los diversos campos D. cultivo D. la zona. Con los ingresos que ambos perciben sacan adelante a su familia.

Ella desea incrementar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento balanceado; D.  esta manera percibir mayores ingresos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Hilda es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es  poder mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Hilda is a 44 year old mother who lives with her husband and children in the village of Vallecito in the District of TambogranD.. This agricultural district is situated in Piura Province, which is in the region of the same name. The community is more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Hilda raises small animals, especially sheep, in a corral located near her home. She feeds the animals grains and natural grasses. Once they have reached the proper level of development, she offers the animals for sale to traders who frequently visit the area where she lives. Her husband works as a field laborer in different farms in the area. Hilda’s family is able to get ahead because of the income both of them earn.

She wants to increase her business by purchasing more animals and balanced feed so that she can generate better earnings. For this reason, she is requesting from Edpyme Alternativa a loan in the amount of 1000 PEN to help her achieve her goal.

Hilda is an earnest hardworking individual. Her greatest wish is to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: Acquire more animals & balanced feed

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: Flora, es una mujer muy bondadosa y noble, de 65 años. Tiene 4 hijos, el mayor vive con su papa en el extranjero. Ella, vive con los tres últimos ya independientes en su casa propia. Desde muy joven trabajó de manera informal en la venta de frutas, en busca de un bienestar para sus hijos, ya que el sueldo de su esposo no es suficiente. Era ya muy conocida en su puesto, pero a veces sufría  por el desalojo de los policías municipales  por ser vendedora informal y, eso le hacia perder sus ventas. Por ello poco a poco buscó y encontró asociarse en un mercado de frutas, desde entonces trabaja más segura durante 15 años, y con estas ganancias educó a sus hijos que ahora son profesionales. En la actualidad su negocio es mucho mas dinámico, ya que los proveedores van a su puesto y le dejan de 300  a 400 cajas de naranjas ó mandarinas de acorde a la temporada, por ello Flora trabaja con la ayuda de su sobrina para agilizar sus ventas. Para ella, su negocio es terapéutico, ya que se siente feliz y  ocupada atendiendo a sus clientes, y piensa, que mas adelante, continuará ampliando su negocio. Es su segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere defraudarles, ya que  este aporte le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca de su progreso. Flora, cada dos días se abastece de más frutas para su negocio, por ello con el crédito que solicita, incrementará más cajas de frutas, de esa manera podrá abastecer de mercadería y cumplir con la demanda que tiene.
texts.en:
Flora, 65, is a very noble, generous woman.  She has four children; her oldest son lives abroad with his father.  She lives with her other three, already independent, children in her own house.  

Since she was very young she’s been working in informal fruit sales seeking wellbeing for her children since her husband’s salary is insufficient.  She was very well known in her stand but sometimes she suffered when the municipal police would evict her for being an informal seller causing her to lose sales.  Because of this, she gradually found a way to become associated with a fruit market and since then she’s been working more securely for the last 15 years and the profits made it possible for her to educate her children who are now professionals.

Her business now is much more dynamic because suppliers come to her stand and leave 300-400 cases of oranges or mandarins according to the season.  Because of this Flora works with help from her niece to speed up sales.  For her, the business is therapeutic because she feels happy and occupied taking care of customers and thinks that later on she’ll continue expanding it.

This is her 2nd loan with MFP and she promises to pay her installments punctually because she does not want to disappoint them because this contribution will allow her to continue working seeking progress.

Flora stocks up of fruit every two days so will use the requested loan to increase the number of crates of fruit to stock up on merchandise and meet the demand she has.

loans.use: To buy more crates of fruit to stock her business.

loans.name: Elija Kireru

texts.en: Elijah is 37 years old, married to Eunice Njoki and has two children. He has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years.  He was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He paid back his previous loan well and in good time. He plans to use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for labor. In the future, Elijah hopes to buy more land and practise large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La Sra. Anita es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, del Distrito de Morales yDepartamento de de San Martín, tiene 32 años y 02 hijos que aún dependen de ella.

Desde muy joven se dedica  al Diseño de Modas y costura, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su casa, en un ambiente amplio y acondicionado. Su responsabilidad, optimismo y gran sentido de deber son sus principales herramientas a la hora de hacer su trabajo, herramientas que le sirvieron para ganarse la confianza de sus clientes, que van desde empresas e instituciones hasta personas particulares. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos Soles comprará: Telas en metros y de diferentes colores, hilos en carretes, blondas, agujas de coser y  para máquina, y parte del dinero lo invertirá en la compra de una remalladora.

Anita manifestó estar muy gradecida al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir en el cumplimiento de sus sueños y ayudarla a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Anita is a member of the "Las Moralinas” community bank which is located in Morales district, in San Martín department.  She is 32 years old and has 2 children who still depend on her.

Anita has been designing clothes and sewing since she was very young.  Her business is located in her home, in a large space adapted for the purpose.  Her responsibility, optimism and great sense of duty are the main tools that she employs when she carries out her work.  They are tools that have helped her to gain the trust of her customers who include companies, institutions and even private individuals.

Anita will use her loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles to buy different-colored fabric by the meter, reels of thread, lace, needles for sewing by hand and needles for her sewing machine.  She will invest some of her money in buying an overlock sewing machine.

Anita is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her to fulfil her dreams and get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is 60 years old and married with 10 children. One child is in school. Marcela works very hard to provide for them.

Marcela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store.

Marcela has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, shampoo, egg, bread, oil, vinegar etc. 

In the future, Marcela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items for her general store

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose “Joe” G. and his wife, Sylvia, own a sports bar called “Joe’s Hide Out.”  They offer cold beer and snacks, as well as a friendly atmosphere where anybody can get to know everybody.  Open Tuesday through Sunday from 11 in the morning to 12 at night, it is closed Monday so that Jose and Sylvia can spend time with Jose’s elderly mother.   As Sylvia says, “Our customers are our friends and family.”  Their loyal clientele includes locals as well as “Winter Texans” who come from as far away as Canada to spend winters in the small town of Donna in the Rio Grande Valley.

In 2003, Joe acquired the bar from an elderly man wanting to retire.  In order to work the bar, Joe took a temporary leave of absence from H-E-B, a Texas grocery store where he had worked for eighteen years.  At the end of three months, Joe realized that he loved owning the bar and resigned from H-E-B.
Joe and Sylvia live in a house across the street from the bar.  They work hard to make “Joe’s Hide Out” a fun place to be. 

Every day, Joe and his wife serve free "botana" (snacks) like squash and chicken, beef and potatoes, and hot dogs.  Recognizing their generosity, customers sometimes pitch in to help cover the cost.  Even when that doesn’t happen, Joe and Sylvia believe it is worth it, because it is fun and attracts business.

Another tradition at “Joe’s Hide Out” is the rule is that whoever rings the bell must buy a round for everyone in the bar.  Sometimes Joe rings the bell, which gets the customers excited and typically leads to their buying rounds for each other.  On the weekends, Jose, Sylvia, and their friends and customers barbecue on their outside grill.  They have musicians come and play music while customers eat, drink, and dance on the patio.

This is Joe and Sylvia’s second loan with ACCION Texas-Louisiana.  With their first loan, they expanded the bar, added pool tables, and bought a television.  With this loan, they will fix the bar’s air conditioner and repair their parking lot.

loans.use: to fix the air conditioning and pave the parking lot.

loans.name: Flavia Concpecion

texts.es: Flavia Concepción tiene 53 años, desde hace 5 años, como siempre emprendedora se dio a la búsqueda de ingresos así fue como nació su tienda, apoyada por sus vecinas. Su sistema de ventas es de contado y la ubicación es en su vivienda. Su sueño es continuar trabajando fuertemente y simultáneamente atender sus responsabilidades familiares y laborales. El financiamiento  es para enlatados, refrescos, pan, detergentes, entre otros. Así podrá tener mucha más disponibilidad de un surtido diversificado.
texts.en:
Flavia Concepción, 53, always enterprising and seeking sources of income, opened a store five years ago with help from her neighbors.  Her sales modality is cash and the store is located in her home.  Her dream is to continue working hard and simultaneously attend to her family and work responsibilities.

The loan is for canned goods, beverages, bread and detergents, among others in order to have much more diversified stock available.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Duo Amor De Dios Group

texts.es:
DUO  AMOR D. DIOS
MIRNA Y ROSENDA, MIRNA ES SOLTERA ELLA SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION D. TEJIDOS EN TELAR Y TAMBIEN FAJAS A MANO, ELLA NECESITA SU CREDITO PARA PODER COMPRAR MATERIA PRIMA PARA PODER CONFECCIONAR MAS PRODUCTO PORQUE ELLA DICE QUE TIENEN UN PEDIDO PARA ESTA EPOCA Y ES POR ESA RAZON QUE NECESITA SU CREDITO. ROSENDA  ELLA TAMBIEN  ELLA ES CASADA TIENE 4 HIJOS ELLA TAMBIEN SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION D. TEJIDOS EN TELAR O SEA A AL ARTESANIA ELLA TAMBIEN NECESITA SU CREDITO PARA COMPRAR MATERIA PRIMA HILOS PARA PODER ELABORAR SU PRODUCTO Y PODER TENER DIFERENTES COLORES Y ESTILO
texts.en:
DUO AMOR D. DIOS

Mirna is single and her business is weaving products on a loom.  She also weaves belts by hand.  She needs this loan so that she can buy raw materials for making more products.  She says that she has an order right now and this is why she needs the loan.

Rosenda is married and has four children.  She also weaves products on a loom and also needs a loan to buy raw materials (threads) so that she can make her products and offer different colors and styles.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for weaving products

loans.name: Benkelema  3 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres de BENKELEMA  3  sont des femmes mariées. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 33  ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. EIles vivent avec leurs maries, coépouses et leurs enfants à Konona, un village situé à environ 30 km de la ville de NIENA région de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ces clientes sont à leur troisième cycle de prêt  de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin en moyen de production et intrant agricole. Les prêts antérieurs ont été remboursés avec satisfaction. 
Ce groupe de femme fait la culture du maïs, du riz, d’arachide, de gombo etc. 
MARIAM compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs d’urée 2 sacs de complexe céréale et le reste comme frais de labour et de sarclage.  Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45.000 à 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: The 10 members of Benkelema 3 are married women. They are on average 33 years old and have on average 5 children. They live with their husbands, cospouses and children in Konona, a village located about 30 km from the city of Niena in the Sikasso region, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. These clients are on their third loan with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy their needs in terms of production and agriculture ingredients. The previous loans were satisfactorily repaid. This group of women grows corn, rice, peanuts, okra, etc. Mariam plans to use her loan to buy 3 bags of urea and 2 bags of complex grains and the rest on labor and hoeing. She envisions making on average 45,000 – 50,000 FCFA, which will be used towards her family’s daily needs.

loans.use: to buy agricultural ingredients and labor

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 41 years old and married with seven children.

Juliet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy grocery items like sugar, soap, etc. to sell.

Juliet has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 11 years and earns additional income from a boarding house.

Juliet aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen is 41 years old, married, and has two children. She operates a bookshop in a busy market and has been in business for seven years. Maureen sells many things including textbooks, staplers, paper, and erasers. She intends to use her loan to purchase more textbooks. 

Maureen hopes to open another bookshop in Shamakhokho. She also hopes to purchase a car so she can deliver books more easily. Maureen describes herself as polite and courageous.

loans.use: to purchase more textbooks to resell.

loans.name: Oscar Fernando

texts.es:
Oscar Fernando tiene 29 años, Es soltero vive con un hijos de seis años, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto los Ángeles, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Oscar se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz  . Compra sus productos en Comercial Procan y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes .   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es vender mas para tener dinero y comprar un terreno.

Le gusta ser un hombre trabajador y horrando.
texts.en:
Oscar Fernando, 29, is single and lives with his six-year-old son in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES, which is involved agriculture, is located in the Los Ángeles Community, in the Ventanas Canton.

Oscar grows corn and rice, buying his supplies in Comercial Procan and selling his produce at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

He is requesting a loan to plant corn and rice, and to buy supplies and fertilizer.  The loan will help him economically to supply his needs.  His dream is to sell more so he will have to money to buy land.

He enjoys being a hard worker and saving money.

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizer.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 19 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Aisha has a business selling food, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 350,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase food for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Aisha hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.  In the future, Aisha hopes to build a house for herself.  

Aisha is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase food for resale.

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Wilfred. He is married and has 4 children, ages 19, 14, 12 and 6 years old. He has 3 additional dependents who live with him because their parents were unable to provide for them. 

In 2001, Wilfred established his firewood and charcoal business. He began his business because his salary was not sufficient for him and his family. Working 4 days a week and 5 hours a day, he earns about 900,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Wilfred requires a loan to buy firewood and charcoal for his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. 

In the future, Wilfred plans to build a store and a house for his family. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more firewood and charcoal for his business

loans.name: Nargis' Group

texts.en:
Nargis is the mother of two sons and a daughter.  Two of them are studying and the youngest one is less than three years old and hasn’t started an education yet. Her husband operates a business selling clothes and she supports him financially by doing embroidery and sewing work for her neighborhood customers. It is very difficult to manage the household expenses due to the increased cost of living everyday. That’s why both of them work very hard to survive financially.
 
Nargis has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business selling clothes. With the loan, he will purchase clothes in bulk, which will enable him to offer more variety to his clients and minimize his cost of traveling every month. Nargis is hopeful that an investment will help him establish his business and increase his income.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nargis.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr:
Né vers 1970 à Nimporodioula préfecture de Sikasso, Monsieur Issa est polygame avec 4 épouses et est père de six enfants. Il réside avec ses quatre femmes et leurs enfants dans sa propre maison à Médine, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrtive de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès notamment l’agriculture et autres, il s’est vite initié aux activités de stockage et commercialisation de produits alimentaires tels le poids sucré, les noix de karité et les céréales depuis plus de 10 années. Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et reçoit beaucoup de commandes de l’extérieur, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins font défaut. Ainsi, il intégra Soro Yiriwaso il y a quatre années  et a bénéficié quatre prêts qui ont été  tous correctement remboursés. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il sollicite  ce cinquième prêt qui lui permettra d’acheter 15 sacs de pois sucré, 3 tonnes de maïs, 7 sacs de mil et 8 sacs de noix de karité. 
Il s’approvisionne dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso pour ensuite les stocker dans son magasin sis au nouveau du marché de  Médine Sikasso, en fin de les ramener à Abidjan et à Bobo Dioulasso (respectivement les république de Côte d’Ivoire et Burkina Faso) sur commande des usines de fabrique de jus de pois sucré et de beure de karité. Pour les céréales, elles sont vendues sur place à la fois en gros et en détail, aux revendeurs essentiellement.    
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA. Avec le bénéfice réalisé, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born around 1970 in the Nimporodioula prefecture of Sikasso, Mr. Issa is polygamous with four wives and six children. He lives with his wives and their children in his own house in Medine, one of the popular districts in the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
After unsuccessfully trying his hand at several businesses, including agriculture, he rapidly learned the business of stocking and retailing food products such as tiger nuts, Shea nuts, and cereals, in which he started ten years ago. With such an experience in this domain, he enjoys a strong reputation and gets many orders from the outside, but he is lacking the resources to meet the demand. He therefore joined Soro Yiriwaso four years ago, and has benefited from four loans, which were all timely repaid.
In order to better meet his ever-growing customer demand, he is requesting this fifth loan. It will enable him to purchase 15 bags of tiger nuts, three tons of corn, seven bags of millet and eight bags of Shea nuts. He gets his supplies from the towns around Sikasso and then stocks them in his store located in the new Medine market of Sikasso, before transferring them to Abidjan and Bobo Dioulasso (respectively in the Republics of Ivory Coast and Burkina Faso) when he gets orders from manufacturers of tiger nut juice and Shea butter. As for cereals, they are sold locally, both wholesale and retail, but mostly to retailers.
With this loan, he is planning on a monthly benefit of 300,000 FCFA. With the profit, he means to address his main expenditure, his family's expenses, to pay his loan's interests and to reinvest the remainder in his business.

loans.use: to purchase food products.

loans.name: Gülcan

texts.en:
Gülcan is 30 years old and married.  She has two children. The youngest child is 8 and oldest one is 10 years old. Gülcan has been making “güpür” (a handmade accessory made of silk, a kind of lacework) for four years.  At first, she began making “güpür” in her house, but now she is teaching other women how to do “güpür”. Moreover, she is also painting the handmade “güpür”.  In addition, she has been selling tobacco for eight months and she wants to buy some more tobacco for her as the bayram (religious celebration for Moslems) is coming. This is the reason for her application to Maya for a loan.

With the loan from Maya, Gülcan thinks that she is one more step closer to her dreams.  She wants to be a great housewife and an employer.  She thinks that she will be able to reach her dreams with her self-confidence. Gülcan also wants to buy a house by herself and work for her children’s education and future. She is an ambitious, patient, resolute and successful woman.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Gülcan Hanım 30 yaşında  ve  evli.  İki çocuğu var ,en büyüğü 10 ,en küçüğü 8 yaşında.
Gülcan hanım dükkanında 4 yıldır  sadece güpür işi yapıyordu.  Güpür işine evinde yaparak başlamıştı,şimdi ise  bayanlara güpür  işini yaptırıyor.  Güpürde boya işi de yapıyor.  Güpür ün yanında 8 aydır tütünde satıyor.  Dükkanında bayram geldiği için biraz tütün almak istiyor.  Bu yüzden maya dan kredi almaya karar vermiş.  Maya dan kredi alarak hedeflerine bir adım daha yakın olacağını düşünüyor.  İyi bir iş kadını ve iş veren olmak istiyor.  Kendine olan özgüveni ile bunu başaracağını düşünüyor.
İleride kendine ait evinin olmasını istiyor.  Çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek hazırlamak ve okumaları için elinden geleni yapmak istiyor.

Gülcan Hanım,azimli,sabırlı  ve başarılı bir kadın

loans.use: to buy more tobacco

loans.name: Marlon Adolfo

texts.es: Marlon Adolfo es un hombre soltero, su negocio lo realiza de manera ambulante es con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación que ha obtenido todo lo que posee. El se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, empezó invirtiendo en pocos productos como calzado, bolsos, ropa, reloj, prendas entre otros fue así que por medio de sus amigo logro tener fama. Es por tal razón que realiza este crédito para la compra de materia prima. El sueña con mejorar sus ingresos y lograr incrementar su inventario.
texts.en: Marlon Adolfo is a single man.  He’s a street vendor who has acquired what he owns through much effort and dedication.  He sells general merchandise.  He started out investing a little in such things as footwear, purses, clothes, watches and other items.  This was the way that he eventually became well known among his friends.  For this reason, he’s asking for a loan to buy merchandise.  He dreams with improving his income and increasing his inventory.

loans.use: to buy footwear, purses, clothes, watches and other items.

loans.name: Yun

texts.en: Yun, 58 years old, is a cake seller earning $10 per day. She is a single mother and lives with her daughter, 31 years old. Her daughter is a soup seller and sell some grocery goods, earning $10 per day. Every month, she has to spend $70 on food, $5 on electricity, and $40 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy wood and cement to repair her house. This loan will help her to have a better house to live in and a proper place for her daughter to sell soup.

loans.use: To buy wood and cement to repair her house.

loans.name: Pulod

texts.ru: Пулод занимается скотоводством 15 лет. Этот вид бизнеса ему по душе. Его дети взрослые и помогают ему. Жена домохозяйка. Скот он кормит кормом, которого он выращивает сам на своем земле. На полученные средства он хочет приобрести 2 скота. Пулод надеется вашу помощь в расширение своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Pulod has been involved in animal husbandry for 15 years and likes this type of business.  His children are adults and help him.  Pulod's wife is a homemaker.  He feeds livestock fodder that he grows on his land.  Pulod wants to use the obtained funds to buy two heads of livestock.  He hopes that you will help him with his business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Rafael Antonio es  soltero y se dedica a la actividad de transporte habiéndose desempeñado como conductor además de trabajar con todo tipo de automóviles y buses. Su actividad consiste en realizar viajes a diversos lugares pero principalmente abastecer de diesel a los conductores de buses de la institución encargada de organizar los viajes ya que él es quien vende el diesel a esta institución de transporte.

Una de las necesidades que atraviesa es la de comprar combustible diesel para continuar abasteciendo a la institución, Por eso visitó Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para seguir comercializando, satisfacer la demanda y obtener los ingresos para el bienestar de su familia
texts.en:
Rafael Antonio is single and in the transportation business having worked as a driver and has worked with all types of automobiles and buses.  His activity consists in traveling to various places to supply diesel fuel to bus drivers of the firm in charge of organizing trips since he is who sells diesel fuel to this transportation firm.

One of his current needs is to purchase diesel fuel to continue supplying the firm.  Because of this he visited Ceprodel to be benefited by a loan to continue in business and meet demand thus earning income for his family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy diesel fuel.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a 36-year-old lady, who is married to a non-Jordanian man. Her husband owns a truck for gas bottle distribution to houses and restaurants. 

In order for Linda to help her husband financially, she started a small home-based business selling food and cleaning products. She has now applied for a loan to increase the quantity she has and add more variety to it. In the future she wants to have a small grocery store.

Because Linda is a conservative person, she asked her mother to appear in the photo.

loans.use: To add more variety to the range of products she sells.

loans.name: Aby

texts.fr:
ABY HABITE DANS UN DÉPARTEMENT DE LA RÉGION SUD DU SÉNÉGAL ÂGÉE DE 65 ANS .ELLE EST VEUVE AVEC QUATRE ENFANTS, L'AINE EST UN COMPTABLE A L'UNIVERSITÉ DE SAINT LOUIS LE DEUXIÈME EST ENSEIGNANT LE TROISIÈME EST A L'UNIVERSITÉ ET LE QUATRIÈME FAIT LA TERMINALE .
ABY EST DANS LE COMMERCE DEPUIS 1989 .ELLE FAIT LE COMMERCE DE LÉGUMES ( CAROTTES CHOUX POMME DE TERRE AUBERGINE COURSE ETC...)DANS LE MARCHE LOCAL DE LA VILLE . AVEC SON COMMERCE ELLE ASSURE LES FRAIS SCOLAIRE DES ENFANTS AVEC LE SOUTIENT DE L'AINE ET DU DEUXIÈME 
ABY HABITE DANS SA PROPRE MAISON MAIS ELLE SOUHAITERAIT EN AVOIR D'AUTRES  POUR SES ENFANTS DANS L'AVENIR .
texts.en: Aby is a 66 year old woman who lives in the southern region of Senegal. She is a widow with four children, one of whom is an accountant at the University of Saint Louis, another whom is a teacher, the third of whom is at university and the youngest is in the process of finishing secondary school. Aby has been selling vegetables since 1989. She sells carrots, cabbage, potatoes, eggplant, etc in the local market. This activity allows her to cover the school fees of her children, along with support she receives from her two eldest children. Aby lives in her own home but her dream is to have other homes for her children in the future.

loans.use: greater quantities of stock available to sell

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is requesting a loan from KIVA partner, Asasah, for her decorative embroidery business. She is a very talented embroiderer and makes beautiful embroidered clothes for her neighboring clients. 

With the loan, she will buy embroidery frames, beads and other embroidery material in bulk quantity to be able to make better-looking embroidered clothes, and to increase her profits.
Her husband is a factory worker and does his job from 9 AM to 5 PM.  Bushra has 2 sons and 2 daughters. Her eldest son is also an embroidery expert while her youngest son works in a factory.  Bushra is very experienced in her business and has been operating it for the past many years. She is confident that she will get more success in her business by investing a loan in it.
Note: "In the photo, the lady who has raised her hand is Bushra."

loans.use: To buy embroidery frames, beads and other embroidery material for embroidery business

loans.name: María Nieves

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Nuevos Horizontes, vive por la parroquia de Sayausi en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por sus cuatro ríos que la bañan, es desde diciembre de 1999 patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora María tiene 48 años, es divorciada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos, cuatro de ellos son casados y viven  independientes, uno de sus hijos trabaja y le ayuda economícamente, un hijo estudia en el colegio y su ultimo hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña María se dedica la agricultura laborando en sus propios terrenos, cultiva hortalizas y vende en un mercado de la ciudad, esta actividad la desempeña hace 20 años. También se dedica a la cría de ganado, cerdos y cuyes.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 6 años, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para sus cultivos.

Su meta es continuar creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
María’s a member of the “Nuevos Horizontes” (New Horizons) communal bank.  She lives in Sayausi Parish in the city of Cuenca.  This city is characterized by the four rivers that bathe it and since December, 1999 has been a Cultural Patrimony of Humanity.  Its residents maintain the culture and traditions of its peoples.

María is 48 years old, divorced and has 7 children.  Four of them are married and live on their own and one of her children works and help her out economically.  One son is going to secondary school and her youngest attends the local little elementary school in the city.  The house they live in is her property.

María works farming her own land.  She grows vegetables that she sells in the city’s market.  She’s been in this line of work for 20 years.  She also raises cattle, pigs and guinea pigs.

She’s been a member of the communal bank for six years and will use her new loan to buy manure for her crops.  Her goal is to continue growing in her business.

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 25-year-old married woman with two children who are not in school. She has had a business of selling food at a food stall in Yambio, South Sudan for four years.
Betty is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is from Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 32 years old and is married with one school-aged child. She owns and operates a gardening business venture. She has been engaged in her business for 11 years and earns about 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Primitiva Susy

texts.es: La señora Primitiva tiene su tienda de barrio en la zona de Alto Llojeta,   en su tienda vende variedad de productos de primera necesidad y también  vende toda clase de juguetes refrescos y variedad de productos, ya que tiene un atienda muy surtida,  tiene una hija que se encuentra estudiando, es separada ya no vive con su esposo hace años, ella sola mantiene a su hija se encarga de sus educación y de los gastos de su hogar,  siempre trabajo con ese negocio de la tienda de barrio,  el crédito  será destinado para compra de mercadería para seguir surtiendo su tienda  ya que  las fiestas de fin de año tiene mucha venta y de esta manera quiere ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientela, se siente agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan para seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Primitiva has her local store in the area of Alto Llojeta. She sells a variety of everyday products along with toys, beverages, and other products in her well-stocked store. She has a daughter who currently studies. Primitiva separated from her husband a few years ago. She is solely responsible for the well-being of her daughter, her education, and their house expenses. She's always worked in her local store business. 

The loan will be used to buy merchandise to continue stocking her store because she sells a lot during the end-of-year celebrations. With the new merchandise, she will be able to offer product variety to her customers. She is thankful for the opportunity to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Yon is 56 years old.  She is widowed and resides with her brother and three nephews in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia.  She has been involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening animals for more than 20 years, earning approximately $3 per day. 

Yon is requesting a loan of $1,200 in order to pay the expenses for her nephew’s wedding ceremony.  In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her house in order to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to pay the expenses for her nephew's wedding ceremony.

loans.name: Xanh

texts.en: Mrs. Xanh  is a hardworking woman, 42 years old. She is married and has two children. She has been running her own cattle farming business for the past 20 years. She is responsible for fulfilling the needs of her entire family and for managing the household. She wants to purchase animals for her business purpose, but due to financial constraints she is unable to purchase these cattle. Therefore, she has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner QB WDF. This loan will enable her to buy these cattle to fulfill the needs of her business.

loans.use: To buy these cattle to fulfill the needs of her business.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica A. is a very active member of Life in Africa who came to Kampala as a result of the war in Northern Uganda.

Monica's husband was seriously wounded by rebels before they came to Kampala. He survived his wounds but has been left permanently disabled and unable to do physical work. Monica made ends meet making paper beads from glue and recycled paper, and working in a stone quarry next to the Internally Displaced camp in the outskirts of Kampala where they live.

In August of 2005 Monica joined Life in Africa and now earns a good living making solidarity bracelets that raise global awareness of the situation in Northern Uganda. She employs others to work at her place in the quarry, and finally has enough income to maintain her family's basic needs. She now has enough income to service a small loan of shs. 800,000 ($475), with which she plans help her husband participate in supporting the family again.

They have a small room at their residence which Monica and her husband plan on turning into a food shop. Her husband will run the shop while Monica continues to work.

Below is her budget; Sugar 3 bags @ 70,000/= 210,000/=
Maize flour 3 bags @ 50,000/= 100,000/=
Peanuts 1 bags @ 150,000/= 150,000/=
Soap 2 boxes@ 15,000/= 30,000/=
Cooking Oil 1 j/can@ 30,000/= 30,000/=
Simsim 1 bag @ 150,000/= 150,000/=
Weighing Scale 1 pc @ 70,000/= 70,000/=
Transport 50,000/=
Contingencies 10,000/=

Based on her current income, she will be able to repay the loan in 12 months. Monica has desig-nated the community impact portion of the interest she pays to support the new Life in Africa WE Center in Gulu, her wartorn home.

loans.use: Purchase of commodities & weighing scale

loans.name: Maria Elba

texts.en:
Maria Elba is a woman who always comes out ahead, thanks to her effort and the dedication she has demonstrated ever since she became a widow. She started a small grocery store, which has functioned very well, but she wants to offer more brands and more variety of products in order to expand her business even further. For this reason she requests a loan of $1200, which she plans to repay in 12 months.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Maria Elba es una mujer que siempre sale adelante, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación que ha demostrado desde que quedo viuda, ella instalo una pequeña tienda de abarrotes la cual a funcionado muy bien pero quiere ofrecer otras marcas y variedad de productos para poder crecer mas aun el negocio, por lo cual esta solicitando un crédito de $1200.00dllrs el cual piensa pagar en un plazo de 12 meses.

loans.use: buy merchandise

loans.name: Mais

texts.en: Mais is an Internally Diplaced Person from the Armenian-occupied Zangilan district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993. Married, he has three children. He started his business in 1994, and borrowed four Normicro loans from Baku branch totaling $2000. Now he wants to borrow $900 to increase the variety of goods in his shop.

loans.use: To in increase variety of goods

loans.name: Purísima

texts.es:
Purisima is 56 years old and married. Her husband can't work outside his home due to blindness caused by his diabetes. He helps to look after the business. Due to this illness, Purisima lost her second son 2 years ago and almost caused them to lose their working capital.

For 18 years, she has run a grocery business from her house. The grocery store is open every day from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. Purisima and her husband started their business with some small savings from her husband's previous job.

They have been able to keep the business running thanks to their constant dedication, work, and service that she and her family had contributed. They have 3 other children that live with them. Their house is made out of wood with a dirt floor. Her greatest wish is to continue working and to help her family move forward

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer.

Purísima tiene su negocio de venta víveres ubicado en su domicilio desde hace 18 años. Su horario de atención es de 6 a.m. a10 p.m todos los días. Con lo poco que había logrado ahorrar del trabajo de su esposo, se decidió a iniciar su propia fuente de ingresos. Ha logrado mantenerlo gracias a la constante dedicación, trabajo y servicio que ella y su familia le han puesto.

Purísima necesita de un préstamo para poder incrementar su capital de trabajo, comprar nuevos productos y brindar más variedad de los víveres que ofrece en su negocio.

Purísima tiene 56 años y tiene esposo .Su esposo padece de ceguera a causa de la diabetes. En la actualidad no puede trabajar fuera de casa pero ayuda en la atención del negocio. Por motivo de esta misma enfermedad hace 2 años, Purísima perdió su segundo hijo. Lo que motivo que casi se quedaran sin capital de trabajo .Tienen otros 3 hijos que viven con ellos .Su casa es de madera con un piso de tierra. Su deseo es seguir trabajando y sacar a su familia adelante.

loans.use: To continue buying grocery products and provide a better assortment for her customers.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana is a hard-working and responsable woman with a 27 year old son and a little girl aged 6. She is separated from her husband and does not recieve any assistance from him, so Diana much work very hard in order to continue to support her family by herself. She began by selling drinks and toast but through her hard work and good service she increased the variety of her products and began a full grocery story, with help from her eldest son.

She hopes to be able to provide the best for her family, and this thought motivates her day in and day out. Currently, Diana is asking for a loan of $200 which she promises to return in three months. With this money she would like to purchase products for her store and continue to expand it s inventory. She is very appreciate of your help and support that will help improve the life of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Diana es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, tiene un hijo de 27 años de edad y una pequeña de 6 años, está separada de su esposo y no recibe ningún tipo de ayuda de él, por lo que Diana ha tenido que trabajar mucho para sacar adelanter a su familia ella sola, inició su negocio vendiendo refrescos y tostadas pero gracias a su esfuerzo y buen servicio ahora ha logrado incrementar la variedad de productos que comercializa e instalar su tienda de abarrotes, donde recibe la ayuda de su hijo mayor.

El deseo de darle lo mejor a su familia la motivan día con día, en estos momentos Diana está solicitando un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 3 meses, con lo que espera comprar mercancía para su tienda y continuar creciendo como hasta ahora. Ella agradece mucho tu generosidad y sabe que con tu ayuda puede mejorar la vida de su familia, decídete a apoyarla.

loans.use: Purchase products, expand inventory

loans.name: Pyalo

texts.en:
Mrs. Pyalo P. is married with two children. She is the owner of a small store where she sells various goods needed by the inhabitants in that area. She is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to expand her business. She will be able to sell her goods as there is a high demand, make a profit, pay back her loan, and use part of the profit for her family's basic needs.

Mrs. P. is a member of the women's group called “ La Patience” a group that has been affiliated to HELP Africa since 2003.

loans.use: to buy various products needed in the area for re-sale

loans.name: Potoae

texts.en: Potoae is sixty six years old with four kids. She is an active woman in her community where she is known for her hard work and her support of her family. Even though she is old, she still wants to help support her family financially. Potoae has  applied for this loan (her second) which is for the same amount as her first loan, in order to pay for the things needed for her plantation such as chemicals and tools.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and tools for her plantation

loans.name: Boltuev

texts.ru:
S. Boltuev is a father of two girls and a husband to his lucky stay-at-home wife. He works as a driver-for-hire for the local taxi shuttle service, but aside from that he has been raising cattle with his father since he was young. For the winter period he would like to purchase a calf for which he requires 2500 somoni and for that reason S. has turned to Microinvest.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Болтуев Шавкат отец двоих дочек и муж счастливой жены домохозяйки.Он работает наемным водителем на частном маршрутном такси.,но по мимо этого он с малых лет вместе со своим отцом занимается скотоводством.В зимний период он хочет купить еще одного бычка, для чего ему нужно 2500 сомони.Шавкат обратился в Микроинвест.

loans.use: raising cattle

loans.name: Pich

texts.en:
Mrs. Pich S., 46, is married and lives with her husband and five children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She has worked as a primary school teacher since 1980 making $2 each day, while her husband works driving a motor-taxi, earning on average about $5 per day in income. One of her children is employed in a hotel and the others are married and live separately.

Mrs. Pich S. hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle for her son to use to go work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her son to use to go to work

loans.name: Cavid

texts.ru:
Cavid X. was born in year 1978. He currently lives in Agsu region. He has been raising farm animals for the past five years. Cavil is planning to get married soon. He would like to expand his business. This is why he wrote a loan request to the NorMicro microcredit agency of Agsu region. He needs help.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Халилов Джавид родился 1978 года рождения. В данный момент проживает в Ахсуниском районе. Пять лет подряд занимается скотоводством. Джавид скоро собирается женится. Этот молодой человек хочеть расширять свой бизнес. Он написал заявление в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал. Ему надо помочь.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of animals

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Señora Soledad belongs to the Progress Communal Bank. She has her restaurant next to the hospital of the district and province of Huaraz, department of Ancash.

With the loan of 1000 soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy 2 bags of rice, 2 bags of sugar, 3 gallons of oil, 3 packages of noodles, 2 bags of oats, 2 bags of salt, 5 boxes of carbonated water in small bottles, 15 boxes of carbonated water in large bottles, two boxes of carbonated water in medium bottles. Part of the money will be invested in buying meat, chicken, fish and vegetables daily.

She is 57 years old of age and married with 4 children, three of whom are independent. One of her daughters still lives with her. Her husband supports her in her work.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Soledad, pertenece al Banco Comunal el progreso, tiene su restaurante frente al hospital del distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará, 2 sacos de arroz, 2 sacos de azúcar, 3 galones de aceite, 3 paquetes de fideos, 2 bolsas de avena, 2 sacos de sal 5 cajas de gaseosas, chicas, 15 cajas de gaseosa grande dos cajas de gaseosa mediana y parte del dinero invertirá comprando carne, pollo, pescado y verduras diariamente.

Ella tiene 57 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos tres de ellos son independientes, una de sus hijas aun esta con ella, su esposo le apoya en este trabajo .

loans.use: To buy sugar, oil, noodles, oats, salt and carbonated water in bulk, as well as to purchase fresh meat, chicken, fish and vegetables daily.

loans.name: Melita Tipto

texts.es:
Melita belongs to the Banco Comunal La Familia group, located in Av. Alfredo Eglintong Mz C Lt. 1, in the district of Calleria, in the county of Ucayali. She is 63 years old and has 3 kids. Her husband makes metal sheets, but his income is not enough to keep them afloat. With the first loan from Manuela Ramos of $300 Melita invested in selling food and cold drinks.

Now she is still selling food. She gets up at 6am and with the help of her kids she makes delicious vegetable stews and on the weekend she goes out and sells, so that she gets more clients. Melita cooks very well so her clients are always happy.

With this loan of $1500, which she will repay over a period of 4 motnhs, she will buy tablecloths, plates, disposable spoons, rice etc.

Melita says that she has always liked to work; it makes her feel independent, and she likes her business as she can speak to her clients and she makes lots of friends, and this makes her feel more like a woman and businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Melita pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en la Av. Alfredo Eglintong Mz C Lt. 1, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 63 años es madre D. 3 hijos, su esposo es laminador, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Melita con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta D. comida y bebidas heladas. En la actualidad continua con la venta D. comidas, se levanta a las 6a.m. con la ayuda D. sus hijos preparan los ricos potajes y los fines D. semana sale a vender y para tener mas clientela. Melita cocina rico sus clientes se van muy felices y contentos. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: manteles, platos, cucharas gaseosas, arroz, etc. Melita dice que siempre le gusto trabajar sentirse independiente por eso le gusta su negocio por que pueD. conversar con sus clientes y hacer muchos amigos, eso la hace sentirme mas realizada como mujer y empresaria.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy merchandise to sell/Con el prestamo comprara  su mercaderia para su venta
